	<item>
		<title>Custom Green Homes in Seattle on Harrison Street </title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/07/07/custom-green-homes-in-seattle-on-harrison-street/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 07 Jul 2011 00:00:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=495</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you’re looking for a wonderful, eco-friendly neighborhood in Washington, you might want to take a look at Issaquah Highlands. If you recognize the name of this neighborhood it might be because of the <a title="Lot 4" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/in-progress/custom-home-built-green-in-issaquah-highlands/" target="_blank">Lot 4 home</a>Gelotte Hommas designed as one of the  custom green homes in Seattle on <a title="Harrison Street" href="http://harrisonviews.com/index.php?page=home" target="_blank">Harrison Street</a>. The Harrison Street development wanted designers with an eco-friendly focus, so we were chosen as one of their <a title="select firms" href="http://harrisonviews.com/architects.php?page=architects" target="_blank">select architecture firms</a> to help design the homes within the area.

<a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/default.html" target="_blank">Curtis Gelotte</a> was featured in two videos on the Harrison Street website during this process to discuss the design of spaces like the master bath and the kitchen:

[youtube http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0HlPO-ITUDQ]

[youtube http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EETtvGxVm9g]

Watch the videos to get a bit of an eye for our design and how we work with homeowners to create a space that is both functional and beautiful while maintaining an environmentally conscious approach.

If you’re looking to build a home in Washington and prefer eco-friendly design, consider moving to Harrison Street. They still have <a title="available spaces " href="http://harrisonviews.com/builders.php?page=available" target="_blank">many available lots</a> with excellent views, and Gelotte Hommas Architecture would be happy to help you design your home.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Summer Holiday Inspirations for Your Home</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/07/01/summer-holiday-inspirations-for-your-home/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 01 Jul 2011 00:00:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=497</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Summer holidays are now in full swing as the Fourth of July weekend is upon us. Many of you are probably preparing to entertain, whether it be a cook out, a pool party, or just a dinner with family and friends. Whatever events you have planned, chances are that this weekend you will notice both things that you love and things that you’re not crazy about in your home.

[caption id="attachment_499" align="aligncenter" width="352" caption="Our design for the project The Point, the indoor seating flows directing into outdoor seating, creating a perfect space for entertaining."]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/The_Point.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-499" title="thepoint" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/thepoint.jpg" alt="" width="352" height="234" /></a>[/caption]

One of those items that become more apparent during summer entertaining is space. The hot summer sun can sometimes become too much for guests out on your patio–Do you have a sunroom or indoor area where they can retreat? When you have a pool party, do your guests have to pass through several halls in your home with wet feet to get to the restroom?

[caption id="attachment_498" align="aligncenter" width="352" caption="Do you have enough seating by the pool? Adding a pool house adds space and accommodates your guests&#039; needs."]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Sammamish_Tuscan.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-498" title="gelotte-hommas-2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/gelotte-hommas-2.jpg" alt="" width="352" height="248" /></a>[/caption]

Solve such issues with architectural additions from<a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank"> Gelotte Hommas</a>, such as adding on a new area to the home to include a sunroom or sitting room, or by building a pool house for guests complete with a restroom and a shower. With such additions, you’ll find your home is much more accessible, as well as more enjoyable, during the summer months.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Share Your Experiences from the Annual Architecture Model Exhibit</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/06/30/share-your-experiences-from-the-annual-architecture-model-exhibit/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 30 Jun 2011 00:00:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=502</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The 14th Annual Architecture Model Exhibit concluded last week for the Seattle Architecture Foundation. Gelotte Hommas had been included in that showing, and would like to extend thanks to all of you who were able to make it out to see the exhibit at Pacific Place.

In addition to our thanks, we would also like to extend a little curiosity: What did you think of the exhibit? Please share your opinions with us in a comment. What was your favorite part of the exhibit? Your favorite model? What did you think of the concept?

[caption id="attachment_504" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Visitors to the exhibit discuss around one of the models. Photo: JOE DYER / SEATTLEPI.COM"]<a href="http://www.seattlepi.com/local/gallery/Seattle-Architecture-Foundation-Model-Exhibit-15541/photo-1063127.php"><img class="size-full wp-image-504" title="SAF-photo" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/saf-photo1.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="302" /></a>[/caption]

We would love to hear your thoughts, even if they don’t relate to Gelotte Hommas’ presence at the exhibit. Also, if you have any pictures from your visit, be sure to share them with us on our <a title="Gelotte Hommas on Facebook" href="http://www.facebook.com/pages/Gelotte-Hommas-Architecture/106339399849" target="_blank">Facebook</a> page! You can visit us there and on <a title="Twitter" href="http://twitter.com/#!/gelottehommas" target="_blank">Twitter</a> for the most up to date information on what’s going on with Gelotte Hommas!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Green House of the Month From Green Source Offers Whimsical Architecture</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/06/26/green-house-of-the-month-from-green-source-offers-whimsical-architecture/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 26 Jun 2011 00:00:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=506</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[GreenSource Magazine, a great resource for environmentally and eco-friendly architects and builders, releases photos of a new green home each month to show new innovation in the industry. <a title=":akewood House" href="http://greensource.construction.com/features/BestGreenHouses/2011/June/Lakewood.asp" target="_blank">The latest design has a whimsical touch to it that makes it almost cute</a>:

[caption id="attachment_507" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="the branch look on the front of this house offers a touch of whimsy."]<a href="http://greensource.construction.com/features/BestGreenHouses/2011/June/Lakewood.asp"><img class="size-full wp-image-507" title="green-house" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/green-house.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="378" /></a>[/caption]

Lakewood House’s signature brise soleil is made from whole, locally felled logs, adding in intriguing focal point to the streamlined building design. The logs aren’t only for looks, however. They take some of the burden of cooling the home off of the geothermal system that is installed. The logs in question were not an elaborate installation either; they were installed by simply bolting them to columns and then securing them with clawed washers. What a simple addition to a green home to not only add a fun touch to the exterior, but to also further energy conservation.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Gelotte Hommas Architecture named “Best Local Architect” in 425 Magazine!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/06/24/gelotte-hommas-architecture-named-best-local-architect-in-425-magazine/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 24 Jun 2011 00:00:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=509</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This morning the post man brought 425 Magazine’s annual “Best of 425″ issue
and with it a big box of excitement!
We are <em>so very proud</em> to announce that
<strong>Gelotte Hommas Architecture was named the “Best Architect”</strong> in all of 425.
Wow! Thank you!

[caption id="attachment_510" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Gelotte Hommas named &quot;Best Architect&quot; in 425 Magazine"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/425_bestof.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-510" title="425_bestof" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/425_bestof.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a>[/caption]

This means more to us than just really great advertising by the way. This announcement is based off of all of you, our clients and friends, voting for us which clearly states  that we must be doing our job right. Our mission statement of  <em><strong>“Develop distinctive architectural solutions that meet the needs of our clients through design excellence, dependable project delivery systems, and proactive client service”</strong></em> is not just some verbiage we have hanging over our door – it’s our philosophy. We want to graciously thank all of you for casting your vote for us over the past few months. Without you, we would not be. We are currently working out exactly how we are going to thank you all so STAY TUNED!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Green Build 2011</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/06/23/green-build-2011/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Jun 2011 00:00:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=512</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[caption id="attachment_513" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="The Green Build Expo features the latest and greatest for green builders."]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/expo.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-513" title="expo" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/expo.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="374" /></a>[/caption]

The Greenbuild International Conference and Expo is coming up, and it’s time for you to register. This event discusses the future of green building, with expert speakers, open forums, and much more.

<a title="greenbuild" href="http://www.greenbuildexpo.org/Home.aspx" target="_blank">Green Build 2011 will be held in Toronto, where speakers (set to be announced on a rolling basis) will discuss the future of green building and eco-friendly architecture across the globe</a>, along with other events, like a green film festival and a green job fair for those new to the trade. For those new to green building, there will be LEED workshops and other educational opportunities to learn more ab out the environmentally friendly aspects of the trade.

This year’s expo is set in Toronto, taking the event into an international status. The dates are set for October 4-6, 2011. Early registration is due by August 15th, so hurry and register. Registration will also be available at the event.

Are you going to Green Build?]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Architecture’s Ability to Alter Perspective</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/06/19/architectures-ability-to-alter-perspective/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 19 Jun 2011 00:00:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=515</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[While venturing onto<a title="design milk article" href="http://design-milk.com/qi-wellness-center-lobby-by-manada-architecture-studio/#more-75424" target="_blank"> Design Milk</a>, a comment in an article particularly caught our eye. In the  posting on Qi Wellness Center, the writer stated the following:
<blockquote>“I am drawn to this wellness center lobby design created by Manadaº Architecture Studio, mostly because it already makes me feel better.”</blockquote>
We can see why, as the beautifully designed space contains natural wood with bright colors in smooth, soothing lines that welcome you into the center:

[caption id="attachment_516" align="aligncenter" width="500" caption="The welcome area of the Wellness Center is fresh and inviting."]<a href="http://design-milk.com/qi-wellness-center-lobby-by-manada-architecture-studio/#more-75424"><img class="size-full wp-image-516" title="qi-wellness-center-1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/qi-wellness-center-1.jpg" alt="" width="500" height="332" /></a>[/caption]

The welcome area of the Wellness Center is fresh and inviting.

What the author is getting at, without having to spell it out, is that the architecture and design of the space immediately effect their perception of the business. By creating a space that gives visitors a “good feeling” about you and your company, you are automatically setting yourself up for success. A wellness center or doctor’s office with a cheerful, less clinical environment in the lobby can be seen as more personable and more relaxing, enriching the experience for those present. A corporate office for a major company can be sleek and streamlined while still readily catering to visitors needs, making the company seem well organized and yet accessible.

How is your architecture benefiting your company?]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Kitchen Upgrade: Beautiful Backsplash</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/08/18/kitchen-upgrade-beautiful-backsplash/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 18 Aug 2011 00:00:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=530</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[caption id="attachment_531" align="aligncenter" width="333" caption="Beautiful Glass Backsplash"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/backsplash1.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-531" title="Backsplash1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/backsplash1.jpg" alt="" width="333" height="283" /></a>[/caption]

A new look in your kitchen can be as easy as replacing your backsplash, the decorative wall space that is usually above the stove or sink. Tile, metal, glass, and brick are just a few of the materials to choose from when designing a new backsplash, and designs range from geometric patterns to art renderings. Check out these stunning backsplashes from <a title="http://www.bobvila.com/HowTo_Library/InspirationGallery/Kitchen_Backsplashes-G4466.html" href="http://www.bobvila.com/HowTo_Library/InspirationGallery/Kitchen_Backsplashes-G4466.html" target="_blank">Bob Vila Home</a> to get an idea of what you want. When  you’re ready to get down to details, consult this <a title="http://www.bobvila.com/HowTo_Library/The_Kitchen_Backsplash-Kitchen-A4032.html" href="http://www.bobvila.com/HowTo_Library/The_Kitchen_Backsplash-Kitchen-A4032.html" target="_self">helpful guide</a>.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The Artwork of Gelotte Hommas: Envisioning a Home</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/08/31/the-artwork-of-gelotte-hommas-envisioning-a-home/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 31 Aug 2011 00:00:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=141</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[When you trust an architect to build your home, you’re trusting their creative eye. They often times will show you the plans that they have, but if those don’t go beyond simple sketches or blue prints, you’re stuck trying to let your imagination picture a place that you’re expecting to live in for the next few decades.

Trying to picture a home from a blueprint, especially if you’re not used to <a title="Reading a blueprint" href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eeqL0VlBOyE" target="_blank">reading them</a>, it can be like picturing your favorite character from a novel, and then watching the book to movie version. No matter how you pictured the character, the silver screen version isn’t quite what you thought it would be–Picturing a house without a clear image to go by can be the same way.

Gelotte Hommas goes beyond the blueprint with clients to show them a clear image of what direction their home is taking, and how they plan to see the finished product. We do so with colorful renderings of the home, so that you can see exactly what to expect. <a title="artwork by gelotte hommas " href="http://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.106808564849.93108.106339399849&amp;type=1" target="_blank">Here are a few examples for you</a>; click each image to see a larger version. Too see more rendering please visit our <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/watercolors.html" target="_blank">website</a>.
<table width="630" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="209"> <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gha_1.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-143" title="GHA_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gha_1.jpg?w=150" alt="" width="150" height="112" /></a></td>
<td valign="top" width="30"></td>
<td valign="top" width="207"> <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gha_2.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-144" title="GHA_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gha_2.jpg?w=150" alt="" width="150" height="97" /></a></td>
<td valign="top" width="30"></td>
<td valign="top" width="217"> <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gha_3.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-145" title="GHA_3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gha_3.jpg?w=150" alt="" width="150" height="98" /></a></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="209"> <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gha_4.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-146" title="GHA_4" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gha_4.jpg?w=150" alt="" width="150" height="99" /></a></td>
<td valign="top" width="30"></td>
<td valign="top" width="207"> <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gha_5.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-147" title="GHA_5" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gha_5.jpg?w=150" alt="" width="150" height="73" /></a></td>
<td valign="top" width="30"></td>
<td valign="top" width="217"> <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gha_6.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-142" title="GHA_6" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gha_6.jpg?w=150" alt="" width="150" height="80" /></a></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The New Gelotte Hommas Website is Live!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/10/27/the-new-gelotte-hommas-website-is-live/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 27 Oct 2011 00:00:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=289</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We’ve already told you that we’re making changes to our website, but now we’re happy to announce that the new website is up and running! This is a great chance for you to re-familiarize yourself with Gelotte Hommas and our projects, as well as to learn about our new ideas and projects.

[caption id="attachment_290" align="aligncenter" width="510" caption="Here&#039;s a look at the Gelotte Hommas website, but we suggest you visit it to see it for yourself."]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gh-website.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-290" title="GH-website" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gh-website.jpg" alt="" width="510" height="504" /></a>[/caption]

The new Gelotte Hommas website, like our architectural projects, is sleek and well defined, while making you feel at home. On it you will find useful facts about our firm and who makes up our design teams, as well as <a title="design principals" href="http://gelottehommas.com/Design.html" target="_blank">which principles we prize in design</a>. You’ll get to see the latest work on all of our projects in our<a title="portfolia" href="http://gelottehommas.com/Portfolio.html" target="_blank">portfolio</a>, as well as learn about initiatives in the community and more that we’re leading or are involved in, like <a title="arc i tek" href="http://gelottehommas.com/Ark.I.Tek.html" target="_blank">arc i tek</a>.

The new website serves as your information highly on all things Gelotte Hommas. Visit it to learn more about our firm and our projects, then keep up with the blogs for a more personal touch and to hear more about design in general, as well as detailed facts about each project.

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Take a Look at Northwest Perspective, a Current Gelotte Hommas Project</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/10/08/take-a-look-at-northwest-perspective-a-current-gelotte-hommas-project/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 08 Oct 2011 19:00:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=311</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[On <a title="our new website" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/events-and-happenings/the-new-gelotte-hommas-website-is-live/" target="_blank">our new website</a>, you can see both completed and in progress Gelotte Hommas projects. While looking over the photos, it’s important to remember that these aren’t just spaces that are designed for the sake of beauty and having a place to rest your head or to go to work–They’re spaces that our team works to tailor for you so that you can’t wait to get home or into the office.

As you look over our projects, get into our perspective by reading our notes.
<div id="attachment_1706">

[caption id="attachment_312" align="aligncenter" width="490" caption="Elevations for current underway project &quot;Northwest Perspective&quot;"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/underway/Northwest_Perspective.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-312" title="Northwest Perspective" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/northwest-perspective.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]

</div>
In the notes on the <a title="northwest perspective" href="http://gelottehommas.com/underway/Northwest_Perspective.html">Northwest Perspective</a> home, you’ll see items that you expect. Dimensions, “4,535 SF custom home”, style, “ Contemporary Northwest style”, and placement, “In the “Infinity” development in Kirkland”, are all expected. Where Gelotte Hommas goes further is in keeping our clients and the family that will live in the space at the forefront of our minds throughout the design process, even sharing a bit about the space in our notes as it effects them.

•”Light filled great room style living” that’s “designed for a family with young children” tells you what the goal of the property is. We want to create a space that is natural, open, and welcoming for a young family as they grow and prosper. This space needs to be adaptable, as the young children will grow up in the home, and need to have a space that grows with them. There should be plenty of room, in case the family expands, and lots of space for entertaining, as birthday parties, club meetings, and more will probably be enjoyed within these walls.

If you’re looking for a home that is custom designed to fit your needs in a modern and eco-friendly perspective, please <a title="contact us" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">contact us today</a>.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Announcing Our New Initiative, Arc i tek</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/10/04/announcing-our-new-initiative-arc-i-tek/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 04 Oct 2011 00:00:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=315</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We’ve been hinting and teasing about a new program with <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a> that would be coming down the pipeline. We offer thanks to everyone for their patience while awaiting the news, and we’re happy to say that we can finally announce arc i tek!

[caption id="attachment_316" align="aligncenter" width="340" caption="Contact Gelotte Hommas for more details"]<a href="http://seattlearchitect.thenewhive.com/arc-i-tek?tag=youth"><img class="size-full wp-image-316" title="Ark.I.Tek youth program" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/ark_i_tek_poster.png" alt="" width="340" height="541" /></a>[/caption]

Arc i tek will be a youth based program in which Gelotte Hommas Architecture will work with the <a title="Seattle Archiecture Foundation " href="http://seattlearchitecture.org/" target="_blank">Seattle Architecture Foundation</a>. The program will feature a series of workshops and tours that will come to a competition. This program is great for youth who have an interest in architecture or just in design, and will help to engage them towards “building a vision of a future Seattle World’s Fair in the year 2062.” In workshops, teachers will work with youth to explore design and create their own submission models for this goal of future vision.

More details should be coming soon, but stay excited about this great opportunity!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Cascade Joinery Highlights Gelotte Hommas Architecture</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/09/08/cascade-joinery-highlights-gelotte-hommas-architecture/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 08 Sep 2011 00:00:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=329</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Thanks to <a title="http://blog.cascadejoinery.com/" href="http://blog.cascadejoinery.com/" target="_blank">Cascade Joinery</a>, who did the timber work on our <a title="http://www.gelottehommas.com/in_progress/23_cedar_haven.html" href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/in_progress/23_cedar_haven.html" target="_blank">“Cedar Haven”</a> project in Carnation, Wash., for highlighting <a title="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/" target="_self">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a> in its blog post <a title="http://blog.cascadejoinery.com/design/its-in-the-details/" href="http://blog.cascadejoinery.com/design/its-in-the-details/" target="_blank">“It’s in the Details.”</a> The post champions the detailed craftsmanship demonstrated by both <strong>Cascade Joinery</strong> and <strong>Gelotte Hommas</strong> in the collaborative home project, built by Hamish Anderson Custom Homes, and sites our firm as producing some of its favorite designs. What can we say? We keep good company. Thanks again, Cascade Joinery!

Here’s a peek at the synergy we achieved in creating this timber-framed balcony:

[caption id="attachment_330" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Extensive use of timber throughout the home"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Cedar_Haven.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-330" title="Cedar Haven" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/cedar-haven-1.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="200" /></a>[/caption]

Check out more <a title="http://www.gelottehommas.com/in_progress/23_cedar_haven.html#" href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/in_progress/23_cedar_haven.html#" target="_blank">photos and details about “Cedar Haven”</a>, a sophisticated 8,500 square-foot <strong>woodland retreat</strong>, featuring:

[caption id="attachment_331" align="alignright" width="490" caption="A petrified stump found on the property featured under the open trellis foyer makes for a very dramatic entry"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Cedar_Haven.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-331" title="large_5" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/large_5.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]
<ul>
	<li>trees, petrified stumps, stones, branches, and other found objects forming organic undertones</li>
	<li>sculptural entry stairway</li>
	<li>hidden three-car garage</li>
	<li><a title="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/in-progress/it%E2%80%99s-in-the-details/" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/in-progress/it%E2%80%99s-in-the-details/" target="_blank">custom-designed artistic glass wall divide</a></li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Creating a Kitchen Remodeling Checklist</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/11/04/creating-a-kitchen-remodeling-checklist/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 04 Nov 2011 00:00:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=337</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Sometimes you begin to notice your kitchen isn’t looking as new or fresh as it once did. One remedy for this situation is to use Gelotte Hommas to remodel your kitchen into a unique and original space. You can rest assured that all of your wants and needs for your dream kitchen will be delivered with Gelotte Hommas beside you. It is also important to plan for this remodel to figure out exactly what it is you want your new kitchen to be and look like. Take a look at some of the <a href="http://www.realsimple.com/home-organizing/home-improvement/home-renovation-checklist-00000000002098/index.html" target="_blank">tips</a> for planning a kitchen remodel:
<div id="attachment_1711">

[caption id="attachment_338" align="aligncenter" width="490" caption="Gorgeous dark wood and marble used in this kitchen design by Gelotte Hommas Architecture"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Southern_sophistication.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-338" title="Southern Sophistication" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/large_41.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]

</div>
<ul>
	<li><em>Make a wish list</em>: Knowing what you want isn’t typically the hard part of the remodel project. The difficulties often arise with getting all of your ideas and inspirations down on paper to sort through them. It can be helpful to make two different columns with elements you want on one side, and elements you need on the other.</li>
	<li><em>Calculate a budget</em>: It is important to figure out a budget for your remodel so you and Gelotte Hommas know what price range you are working with. Be sure to build in some padding into your budget in case you change your mind on certain elements you want or need.</li>
	<li><em>Check the calendar</em>: Make sure you have plenty of time to dedicate to the remodeling project to ensure it can be completed in a way that you will adore.</li>
</ul>
Once you’ve taken the proper steps to plan out the kitchen remodel project, <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">contact </a>Gelotte Hommas to begin designing your dream kitchen.

Photo from <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Southern_sophistication.html" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Fall Post Round Up: Celebrate Our Favorite Fall Blog Posts</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/10/21/fall-post-round-up-celebrate-our-favorite-fall-blog-posts/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 21 Oct 2011 00:00:51 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=367</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The Gelotte Hommas Blog has been up and thriving for over a year now, and by looking back, you can gain a lot of perspective on where we’ve been and where we’re going as architects. We have know showcased over 200 blog posts for you, sharing our tricks of the trade, showing you our recent projects, and discussing great events for the architecturally minded in the Seattle and Bellevue area.
<div id="attachment_1698">

[caption id="attachment_368" align="aligncenter" width="334" caption="Celebrate fall with us in this review of our favorite autumn-centered posts."]<a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/ennev/6251537630/sizes/m/in/photostream/"><img class="size-full wp-image-368" title="fall" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/fall.jpg" alt="" width="334" height="500" /></a>[/caption]

Celebrate fall with us in this review of our favorite autumn-centered posts.

</div>
Here is a round up of some of our favorite fall-centered posted from the past year:
<ul>
	<li>In <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.com/2010/09/27/fall-decor-highlights-architecture/">this post from September 2010</a>, we got to discuss how architecture is accented by beautiful fall decor.</li>
	<li>Who knew that pumpkins had so much to do with architecture? Check out the <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.com/2010/10/27/vote-for-gelotte-hommas-wild-pumpkin-design/">pumpkin carving handiwork from one of our own</a> at Gelotte Hommas, as well as <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.com/2010/11/01/architecture-inspired-carved-pumpkin-wins-contest/">architecturally inspired pumpkin</a> that won the contest he entered.</li>
	<li>Review our celebration of <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.com/2010/10/11/curtis-gelotte-in-october-seattle-homes-lifestyles/">Curtis Gelotte’s feature</a> in the October 2010 edition of Seattle Homes &amp; Lifestyles.</li>
	<li>Enjoy the indulgences of Fall as we discuss how to incorporate a <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.com/2011/11/24/345/">residential wine cellar</a> into your home.</li>
</ul>
<div>Which Fall centered post was your favorite?</div>
<div>Leave us a comment and tell us!</div>
<div></div>
<div>Photo by <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/ennev/6251537630/sizes/m/in/photostream/">Flicker</a></div>

	<item>
		<title>Living on Island Time: The Multi-Island Kitchen</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/10/18/living-on-island-time-the-multi-island-kitchen/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 18 Oct 2011 00:00:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=372</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The<a title="kitchen island design" href="http://www.elledecor.com/home-remodeling/articles/design-basics-kitchen-islands" target="_blank"> island</a>. It has become an almost essential feature in any kitchen. It provides extra work space, an attractive, centering element in the room, and often times offers extra storage. Most everyone can agree that an island is useful. So what would you do with multiple islands?

[caption id="attachment_373" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="This spacious kitchen fits three island stations, allowing you to designate specific functions for each space. Photo by Roger Davies, via Architectural Digest."]<a href="http://www.architecturaldigest.com/homes/homes/2011/11/gleason-mcalpine-napa-valley-home-slideshow#slide=5"><img class="size-full wp-image-373" title="kitchen-slands" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/kitchen-slands.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="355" /></a>[/caption]

Having<a title="multiple islands" href="http://interiordec.about.com/od/kitchenislands/a/a_kitchenisland.htm" target="_blank"> multiple islands or a multi-level island</a> will make your kitchen even more efficient and accommodating, by adding such features, you also add:
<ul>
	<li>Work space that can be designated for different functions. The island closest to the door acts as a catch all for groceries, work bags, and more, while the island near the sink works perfectly for food preparation.</li>
	<li>Multi-levels work especially well for allowing you designate a space for guests and kids while you prepare tapas or a meal. It keeps the “too many cooks in the kitchen” space issue under wraps, and allows you space to work with the food or beverages while you can still interact with your onlookers.</li>
</ul>
<div>If you have an open, spacious kitchen, consider redesigning and using some of that space for a second island. You’ll appreciate the space and comfort.</div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

	<item>
		<title>Contemporary Design From Gelotte Hommas</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/10/14/contemporary-design-from-gelotte-hommas/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 14 Oct 2011 00:00:07 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=376</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Many of our designs from Gelotte Hommas are nature inspired homes with lots of exposed wood and traditional lines, interpreted in a modern way. Still, this natural look isn’t for everyone. If you’re more about sleek lines and smooth surfaces, <a title="Contemporary Architecture" href="http://designcrave.com/2011-03-30/contemporary-architecture-architect-documentaries/">contemporary architecture</a> is probably more your style, featuring sharp angles, lots of light, and open space.

Contemporary design is both beautiful and functional, but some homeowners shy away from the style out of worry that it will be too clinical or sterile in feel rather than relaxing and inviting. In our work for <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/The_Gallery.html">The Galler</a>y in Kirkland, we worked to make a contemporary space still feel natural and cozy without losing the spirit of a modern space:

Click each image to enlarge it:
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="127"> <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/large_93.png"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-377" title="the Gallery" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/large_93.png?w=150" alt="" width="150" height="116" /></a></td>
<td valign="top" width="18">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="top" width="120"> <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/large_8.png"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-385" title="The Gallery" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/large_8.png?w=150" alt="" width="150" height="116" /></a></td>

<td valign="top" width="120"> <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/large_7.png"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-384" title="The Gallery" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/large_7.png?w=150" alt="" width="150" height="116" /></a></td>

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
What do you find to be the strengths of contemporary architecture? What about the weaknesses?In each room you can follow the natural floor which keeps the space grounded in natural elements while allowing it a sleek and modern look. The organic layout of each room helps to accent these details from the space itself, highlighting the architecture and keeping each room at ease.

Photos from <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/home.html">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a>

	<item>
		<title>Winners of the 2011 Solar Decathlon Rejoice in Their Energy Efficient Triumph</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/10/12/winners-of-the-2011-solar-decathlon-rejoice-in-their-energy-efficient-triumph/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 12 Oct 2011 00:00:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=388</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Last year in October <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.com/2010/10/26/responsive-architecture-hot-topic-at-2010-solar-decathlon/">we discussed some of the happenings at the 2010 Solar Decathlon</a>, an “annual collegiate competition that focuses on solar power and green building techniques”, and how the topic of responsive architecture was discussed. If you’re unfamiliar with the competition, teams work on a project for two years with <a title="Goals in the Solar Decathlon " href="http://www.solardecathlon.gov/competition.html" target="_blank">goals in mind</a> as they build a house that:
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="638">
<ul>
	<li>Is affordable, attractive, and easy to live in</li>
	<li>Maintains comfortable and healthy indoor environmental conditions</li>
	<li>Supplies energy to household appliances for cooking, cleaning, and entertainment</li>
	<li>Provides adequate hot water</li>
	<li>Produces as much or more energy than it consumes. (List via Solar Decathlon Website)</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
[caption id="attachment_389" align="alignleft" width="550" caption="This home was created during the Solar Decathlon by the UT Knoxville team. Image via Eco Friend."]<a href="http://www.ecofriend.com/entry/ut-knoxville-creates-self-sufficient-house-for-solar-decathlon-2011/"><img class="size-full wp-image-389" title="UT Zero Prototype" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/solar-decathlon.jpg" alt="" width="550" height="369" /></a>[/caption]

The contest was judged and run from September 23rd until October 2nd. Here are the <a title="Scores" href="http://www.solardecathlon.gov/scores.html" target="_blank">last recorded scores</a> for each team, within the top 5:
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="638">
<ul>
	<li>Maryland 951.151</li>
	<li>Purdue 931.390</li>
	<li>New Zealand  919.058</li>
	<li>Middlebury College  914.809</li>
	<li>Ohio State  903.938</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<div></div>
<div>One of the most intriguing aspects of this competition is the charting of the energy balance, taking a look at the created village to see <a title="Village Energy Balance" href="http://www.solardecathlon.gov/energy_balance.html" target="_blank">how much energy was produced and how much used</a> to help better understand energy needs and efficiency.</div>
<div>Have you competed in the Solar Decathlon? Share your team’s story in a comment.</div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Enjoy a Family Model Making Workshop in Seattle</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/10/07/enjoy-a-family-model-making-workshop-in-seattle/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 07 Oct 2011 00:00:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=398</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[caption id="attachment_399" align="alignleft" width="373" caption="Take your kids from drawing houses to building them with an architecture class."]<a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/benedikte/2395875470/sizes/m/in/photostream/">
<img class="size-full wp-image-399" title="SAF photo" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/saf-photo.jpg" alt="" width="373" height="500" /></a>[/caption]

Earlier this week we officially announced arc i tek, our youth program to be held in conjunction with the Seattle Architecture Foundation. While we know that you’re excited, we didn’t want to leave you waiting for wonderful kid friendly activities involving a passion for architecture. If you want to get into something right now, try the Family Model Making Workshop with the Seattle Architecture Foundation.

The workshop series is holding their “Family Model Making Workshop, More Building” and helps families take a 2D model to a 3D model.
<div class="mceTemp"><dl class="wp-caption alignleft"><dt class="wp-caption-dt">“ Using a variety of materials and techniques, young architects and their families will build several types of models in this workshop. Participants will learn how architects and designers use models to imagine a building. “</dt></dl></div>
Get the entire family involved in the creative process of architecture and design with this wonderful program. The next workshop of this kind is set for November 5th, 11 AM – 2 PM. The cost is $15 per attendee.

Do you enjoy family friendly architecture events?

&nbsp;

Photo courtesy of <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/benedikte/2395875470/sizes/m/in/photostream/">Flickr</a>

	<item>
		<title>The Self Sufficient House: A Zero Energy Home</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/09/29/the-self-sufficient-house-a-zero-energy-home/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 29 Sep 2011 00:00:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=401</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[caption id="attachment_402" align="alignleft" width="198" caption="The Built Green Conference had so many wonderful ideas for discussion, we couldn&#039;t help but share."]<a href="http://builtgreenconference.com/"><img class="size-full wp-image-402" title="built-green-logo" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/built-green-logo.png" alt="" width="198" height="175" /></a>[/caption]

If you weren’t able to attend the 2011 Built Green Conference, then we hate you missed out, but we do have some great information on what’s going on in the green focused architectural community around Bellevue and Seattle. <a title="Zero Energy Home " href="http://bellevuebusinessjournal.com/2011/09/22/2011-built-green-conference-generated-new-ideas-tools-and-winners/" target="_blank">One of the ideas that we loved to see discussed at the conference was that of a Zero Energy Home (ZEH)</a>.

So what is a <a title="Zero Energy Home" href="http://www.tauntonstore.com/toward-a-zero-energy-home-david-johnston-071287.html" target="_blank">Zero Energy Home</a>? A ZEH is a home that is self sufficient–It provides what it needs to consume, and has its own cycle that allows the people within it to save on costs and to lesson their carbon footprint on the planet. Though a home that generates the same amount of energy as it consumes may seem more futuristic, there have already been plenty of homes built that meet this criteria, or at least come within reach. The Zero Energy Home is a great goal for the eco-friendly design and architecture community, and we look forward to seeing how it develops.

What are your thoughts on a ZEH?]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Functional Architecture: The Beauty and the Brawn </title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/09/23/functional-architecture-the-beauty-and-the-brawn/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 23 Sep 2011 00:00:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=404</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[When people look at homes in shelter magazines, they discuss how beautiful a space is, and how much they would love to have aspects A, B, and C in their soon to be constructed space. Yet, when you sit down with someone to discuss what features they would like in their home, they’re likely to discuss issues they have with their current space, and what problem solving, functional features would be great to have.

Great design is about marrying form and function, beauty and brawn, to create a cohesive, well designed space that is both beautiful to the eye and appreciated by the mind for it’s functionality. We<a title="Photos on Facebook" href="http://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.211003335615112.48242.100001163424157" target="_blank"> recently featured photos from Vista Ridge Imaging in our Northest by Northwest Project</a> that display these ideals well:

[caption id="attachment_408" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="A classic library design gets a modern spark and a fresh feel."]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/northeast_by_northwest.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-408" title="NE_nW_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/ne_nw_11.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="373" /></a>[/caption]

Built in bookcases in the library keep the the space uncluttered and unencumbered, while the spacing of the shelves allows for larger titles and a sleek, spacious modern feel that keeps the room from feeling stuffy.

[caption id="attachment_407" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="The kitchen island now works for prep and for guests."]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/northeast_by_northwest.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-407" title="NE_nW_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/ne_nw_2.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="373" /></a>[/caption]

Single level islands often put anyone on a bar stool in the thick of food preparation rather than allowing them a place as a comfortable spectator. By raising a portion of the island, we create an interesting silhouette while also adding seating space and more room to work.

[caption id="attachment_405" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Adding a recessed space adds architecture interest and useful areas to the room."]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/northeast_by_northwest.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-405" title="NE_nW_3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/ne_nw_3.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="373" /></a>[/caption]

This dining room has a recess that may seem just for show, but it also keeps a buffet out of the way of the main room, so guests can walk without dodging furniture. Closets in the dining room provide great storage for special china, linens, and more.

Add function and beauty to your home to create a harmonious and beautiful place that you’ll cherish for years to come. For help with this aspect of your new home’s design, <a title="Contact Us" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">contact Gelotte Hommas</a> today.

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Home For a Lifetime: Creating a Home For All Stages in Life</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/09/20/home-for-a-lifetime-creating-a-home-for-all-stages-in-life/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 20 Sep 2011 18:11:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=410</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[When designing a home, many people consider what they need right now, whether it’s a two bedroom starter home for a new couple, a small cabin for empty nesters, or a four bedroom house with a spacious layout and nice backyard for a growing family. <a title="Green and Sustainable Design with Gelotte Hommas" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/green-and-sustainable/" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas tries to leave as small of a carbon footprint as possible</a> when designing a new home for someone or while remodeling their current one. Though you may take care to examine green design for the homes that you build, it’s also important to think about the environmental impact of the number of homes you’ll inhabit. <a title="L is For Longevity by Dwell " href="http://www.dwell.com/articles/l-is-for-longevity.html" target="_blank">One family decided to design their first home as their “forever home”, creating a space that they plan to enjoy as they raise their children and on into their elderly years.</a>

[caption id="attachment_411" align="aligncenter" width="478" caption="David and Mayuku plan to enjoy this home for the rest of their lives. Photographed by Jessica Haye and Clark Hsiao for Dwell."]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/david-mayuku-home.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-411" title="david-mayuku-home" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/david-mayuku-home.jpg" alt="" width="478" height="637" /></a>[/caption]

David and Mayuko Lai, <a title="Dwell" href="http://www.dwell.com/articles/l-is-for-longevity.html" target="_blank">as featured in Dwell</a>, took five years to design their home. In it they feature elements of universal design so that it will accommodate their young family now and them as they age. One of the most interesting aspects of their story was that they had the freedom to give the home little touches that they knew would be great for them, without having to consider how it might effect future residents or the resale value of their home.

What kind of changes would you make to your home, or what features would you include in a new build, to make it more of your forever home? Tell us about them in a comment.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Upcoming Events For Gelotte Hommas, Including the Built Green Conference</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/09/12/upcoming-events-for-gelotte-hommas-including-the-built-green-conference/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 12 Sep 2011 00:00:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=416</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Architects are an active, engaging group that thrive on interaction, creativity, and the exchange of ideas. Any given month, there’s usually at least one big event in the world of architecture, but September is looking to be an intensely busy month. To keep you up to date on the happenings at Gelotte Hommas, we’ve included our up and coming events:
<ul>
	<li> The<a title="Built Green" href="http://builtgreenconference.com/"> Built Green Conference</a> is just days away on the 14th at Pickering Barn in Issaquah. Our very own Eric Gelotte will be speaking at the conference, discussing how using local merchants add to the greenness of a home, as well as offering information on who/what they are in the area.</li>
</ul>
[caption id="attachment_418" align="aligncenter" width="490" caption="The Built Green Conference and Festival is a great event for those interested in green architecture and how to make your designs and builds more eco-friendly."]<a href="http://builtgreenconference.com/"><img class="size-full wp-image-418" title="built-green" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/built-green.png" alt="" width="490" height="383" /></a>[/caption]
<ul>
	<li>On the 17th of September, we’ll be attending an open house for a client that we assisted with a wonderful remodel on the Sammamish plateau. We designed the space and then the client built the design over the course of five years–An open house is definitely earned after a half decade of labor!</li>
</ul>
[caption id="attachment_419" align="aligncenter" width="352" caption="Many bungalows have their style and charm displayed on the exterior of the space, like our Kirkland Bungalow."]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Kirkland_Bungalow.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-419" title="Kirkland Bungalow" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/bungalow_1.jpg" alt="" width="352" height="282" /></a>[/caption]
<ul>
	<li>Our big event for September,  The Bungalow Fair, will take place on the 24-25 in Seattle. We will be attending and speaking at the fair, with Scott and Eric leading a discussion on “How to teach an old house new tricks”. The talk will focus on how you can add bungalow charm to an existing newer home to add vintage elements and character. Gelotte Hommas loves bungalow style, as you can see from our work on the <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/traditional/05_medina_bungalow.html" target="_blank">Medina Bungalow</a>, <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/traditional/07_beach_bungalow.html" target="_blank">Bungalow on the Beach</a> and <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/traditional/01_kirkland_bungalow.html" target="_blank">Kirkland Bungalow</a>.</li>
</ul>
[caption id="attachment_417" align="aligncenter" width="352" caption="Scott&#039;s talk at the Bungalow fair will help you add bungalow charm to your existing home, with wonderful interior additions like this one, in our Medina Bungalow."]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Kirkland_Bungalow.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-417" title="bungalow-interior_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/bungalow-interior_2.jpg" alt="" width="352" height="278" /></a>[/caption]

We’re ecstatic about these upcoming events, and are excited to share them with you here. Will you be attending either of the conferences or the open house? If so, tell us in a comment!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Green Design: The Longevity of Your Home</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/09/09/green-design-the-longevity-of-your-home/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 09 Sep 2011 00:00:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=422</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you have noticed from our blog posts, Gelotte Hommas puts <a title="Green and Sustainable " href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/green-and-sustainable/" target="_blank">great emphasis on the power and principle of green living and design</a>. By creating sustainable homes, we ensure that each of our creative and inspired spaces puts as little burden on the environment as possible, while ensuring that its occupants enjoy their space. While we’ve talked about materials, design techniques, and energy efficient additions that make a house green, we’ve yet to discuss another important aspect of eco-friendly architecture and life: Longevity.

[caption id="attachment_411" align="aligncenter" width="478" caption="Learn more about how one family built their home to last them their lifetime in our next post, as pictured in this photo by Jessica Haye and Clark Hsiao for Dwell."]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/david-mayuku-home.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-411" title="david-mayuku-home" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/david-mayuku-home.jpg" alt="" width="478" height="637" /></a>[/caption]

The longer you use something, the longer you go without replacing it. In today’s world, the concept of having a different home to fit each stage of your life is common.<a title="Average homes in a lifetime" href="http://www.trulia.com/voices/Home_Buying/What_is_the_average_number_of_homes_a_person_buys_-85721" target="_blank"> On average, you’ll buy about three homes in your lifetime</a>: A starter home, a home for your family, and an empty nest abode.

Each one of these homes is another space that you’ll use, change, remodel, build, or somehow impact the environment with your time there. Even just hiring the moving truck to transfer from one location to the other detracts from your sustainable lifestyle.

Start thinking about how you can make your home last a lifetime instead of a mere 5-7 years. Check out our blog on Monday to read about one family that built their home for a lifetime, and how you can make your space adapt to you walk in life.

How long have you lived in your home?

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Accenting Your Home’s Architecture with Paint</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/09/06/accenting-your-homes-architecture-with-paint/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 06 Sep 2011 00:00:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=424</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The interior design that went into this home after it was designed by Gelotte Hommas truly stands out as a great example of how to<a title="How to Accent Your Architecture with Color" href="http://architecture.about.com/cs/repairremodel/a/pickcolors.htm" target="_blank"> accent the architectural elements of your home through paint</a> and decor. Each of the homes designed by Gelotte Hommas has special features and small touches to accent their over all aesthetic. You can choose to show off these little accents in your home with how you style it.

[caption id="attachment_425" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Photo by Benjamin Benschneider Photography."]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/lakeside_lookout.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-425" title="lakeside_lookout" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/lakeside_lookout.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a>[/caption]

In the room above, styled by Gregory Carmichael Interior Design, you can see how the details of the molding and the ceiling are accented by paint. A glossy white accents the molding, while having a contrasting color on the ceiling brings attention to the interesting elements of the space. The large windows in the dining area are brought to your attention as the darker color that borders them stands out from the lighter walls.

Simple accents like the ones above can take your home from “Oh, this is nice” to “Oh my gosh, this is gorgeous!” Start accenting your home today, or adding architectural interest to your space with <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/about/" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a>.

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Our Experience at the MOB Garden Party</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/08/27/our-experience-at-the-mob-garden-party/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 27 Aug 2011 00:00:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=427</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Recently our very own Scott Hommas was invited to attend a wonderful MOB Garden Party to support the<a title="Pacific Northwest Ballet" href="http://www.pnb.org/" target="_blank">Pacific Northwest Ballet</a>. Garden parties are a great way to celebrate the summer and a great cause or organization, like the Pacific Northwest Ballet, as well as a great way to enjoy your outdoor living space and the great weather.

[caption id="attachment_428" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="The watercolor elevation of the home done during design"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/tweten_elevation.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-428" title="Tweten_elevation" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/tweten_elevation.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="325" /></a>[/caption]

The party was held at Jeanne Tweten &amp; Jim Leslie’s home, which was actually designed by <a title="gelotte hommas architecture" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a>. We were happy to see how the design of the home could cater to the needs of entertaining, as well as to enjoy the company of others there to support such a great program as the Pacific Northwest Ballet.

During the garden party, attendees enjoyed a talk with Peter Boyle, the Artistic Director of of the Pacific Northwest Ballet. Alabastro Photography captured a few photos of the crowd during the speech, several of which have Scott somewhere in the mix, like this one:

[caption id="attachment_429" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Scott Hommas stands with Jeanne Tweten during the Peter Boyle talk. Photo by Alabastro Photography"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/scott-hommas.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-429" title="scott-hommas" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/scott-hommas.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="356" /></a>[/caption]

Did you attend the garden party? What has been your favorite Pacific Northwest Ballet show? What design element do find most essential to outdoor entertaining? Share your thoughts and stories with us in a comment.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>GHA Scavenger hunt – and there is a PRIZE on the line!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/08/25/gha-scavenger-hunt-and-there-is-a-prize-on-the-line/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 25 Aug 2011 00:00:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=432</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We just got something  back from the printer – take a look! This poster is one of our newest projects aptly named <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/northwest/11_Cedar_Haven.html">Cedar Haven</a>.

Where is this amazing poster going? We are so glad you asked! This beauty is going on display in the <a href="http://www.aiaseattle.org/contact">AIA office</a> in downtown Seattle.

[caption id="attachment_433" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="One of two presentation boards hanging downtown in the AIA window"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/bardy_board-e1314293830602-225x300.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-433" title="bardy_board-e1314293830602-225x300" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/bardy_board-e1314293830602-225x300.jpg" alt="" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

<em>You want to know something else?</em> We have <em>one other poster</em> hung there as well and <strong>we want you to go find it</strong>.

<em>Here’s the skinny</em> – one lucky person who goes to the AIA office in Seattle,  finds our other poster and posts a comment on here with the following instructions will win *drum roll* a gift certificate to Starbucks!

<em><strong>Here’s what you need to post:</strong></em>

<strong>1) What style is the home in the poster</strong>

<strong>2) What color is the home</strong>

<strong>3) What is your favorite part about the home design.</strong>

We will choose the winner by the person with the most “impressive” answers <em>by next wednesday 8/31</em>. (We will leave it up to you to figure out what is impressive) That’s  it! Now get out there and enjoy some of this Seattle summer weather. We can’t wait to hear what you all think!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Get Ready for the Seattle Design Festival</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/08/23/get-ready-for-the-seattle-design-festival/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 23 Aug 2011 00:00:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=436</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[As a member of AIA, Gelotte Hommas Architecture is more than ready for the <a title="Seattle Design Festival" href="http://www.aiaseattle.org/node/5493" target="_blank">Seattle Design Festival</a>, coming up next month in Washington state. This year’s event is sure to be as wonderful as years past, if not better. Also this year, our firm will have a wonderful surprise to announce.

[caption id="attachment_437" align="aligncenter" width="500" caption="The Seattle Design Festival promises to be an amazing event."]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/seattle-design-festival.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-437" title="seattle-design-festival" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/seattle-design-festival.jpg" alt="" width="500" height="363" /></a>[/caption]

The 2011 Seattle Design Festival is now set for September 16-25, so be sure to mark your calendars and to arrange your schedule so that you can attend. The festival is put on by AIA Seattle, and will feature a theme, “Beneath the Surface”. The festival is a lengthy event, with “10 days of tours, films, events, speakers, and more…all about architecture and design.”

So, what is our big announcement? You’ll have to attend the conference or keep an eye on our blog to find out. The best way to do the latter is to <a title="subscribe to our blog" href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/gelottehommas" target="_blank">subscribe to our blog</a>, getting the entries sent to your blog viewer or your email. Stay tuned for more exciting information!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>About Us</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/about/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 23 Dec 2011 18:32:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?page_id=2</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[caption id="attachment_97" align="aligncenter" width="300"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Casa_Del_Sol.html"><img class="size-medium wp-image-97" title="Casa Del Sol" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/model.png?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="191" /></a> Model of project "Casa Del Sol"[/caption]
<p style="text-align:justify;">Located in the greater Seattle area, Gelotte Hommas Architecture is a nationally recognized architectural firm that is well-versed in all styles of residential architecture and creative, well-thought out commercial designs.  Founded in 1983, the three principals, Curtis Gelotte, Scott Hommas and Eric Drivdahl have collectively over 90 years of experience creating unique, award-winning spaces.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;">Being a medium-size firm by choice enables us to accept assignments of all sizes.  One of the two principals oversee each project ensuring the highest design quality and customer service, and our staff is selectively hired to keep a broad range of technical and artistic abilities.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;">We invite you to visit our website portfolio to see the breadth of our creative expression that results from listening to our client’s desires.  <a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/">www.gelottehommas.com</a></p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Celebrating 2011: Our Favorite Posts</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/12/21/celebrating-2011-our-favorite-posts/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 21 Dec 2011 21:38:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=100</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The new year is almost upon us, which means 2011 is coming to a close quickly. In order to properly celebrate 2011 and welcome the coming of 2012, we have rounded up some of our personal favorite posts from this past year. We covered a wide variety of topics including, building green, new trends and everything in between. Pay tribute to 2011 and take a look back with us while we revisit some of our favorite posts. Take a look:

[caption id="attachment_102" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Check out some of our favorite posts from 2011"]<img class="size-medium wp-image-102" title="champagne" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/champagne.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="233" />[/caption]
<ul>
	<li><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.com/2011/04/28/how-to-make-the-most-of-a-small-kitchen/">How to make the most of a small kitchen</a></li>
	<li><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.com/2011/06/08/accenting-indoor-architecture-with-plant-infused-green-walls/">Accent Indoor Architecture with Plant-Infused Green Walls</a></li>
	<li><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.com/2011/08/31/the-artwork-of-gelotte-hommas-envisioning-a-home/">The Artwork of Gelotte Hommas: Envisioning a Home</a></li>
	<li><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.com/2011/11/09/entry-way-designs-by-gelotte-hommas/">Entry Way Designs by Gelotte Hommas</a></li>
	<li><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.com/2011/12/06/the-history-of-gelotte-hommas-holiday-cards/">The History of Gelotte Hommas Holiday Cards</a></li>
</ul>
<div>Now that we told you what some of our favorite posts from 2011 were, we want to hear from you! What were some of the posts you enjoyed most in 2011? Leave us a comment and let us know.</div>
Photo from <a href="http://www.freedigitalphotos.net/images/Alcohol_g182-New_Years_Toast_p25354.html" target="_blank">Free Digital Photos</a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>100</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-12-21 21:38:45</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-12-21 21:38:45</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>celebrating-2011-our-favorite-posts</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>

	<item>
		<title>Entry Way Designs by Gelotte Hommas</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/11/09/entry-way-designs-by-gelotte-hommas/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 09 Nov 2011 00:00:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=154</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The entry way. Arguably one of the most important areas in your home. The entry way is not only a chance to set the tone for your home, but a chance to make a first impression that sticks. The entry way is also a place where you drop your keys or your mail, which means functionality of the entry way is important. Gelotte Hommas has created various designs for entry ways that exemplify multiple styles of design. Remodeling your foyer could be just the trick you need to give your home a fresh makeover. Take a look at some of the entry ways done by Gelotte Hommas:

[caption id="attachment_156" align="aligncenter" width="200" caption="This traditional design gives the entry way an open, yet at-home feel."]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/house_on_cozy_cove.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-156" title="house_on_cozy_cove" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/house_on_cozy_cove.jpg" alt="" width="200" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_155" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Following the artsy feel of the rest of the home, this entry way uses art to lead guests from the foyer to the living area."]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/The_Gallery.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-155" title="the_gallery" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/the_gallery.png" alt="" width="300" height="232" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_157" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="This foyer uses details to emphasize the European tone that is given off throughout the home."]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Lakefront_Gothic.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-157" title="Lakefront_gothic" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/lakefront_gothic.png" alt="" width="300" height="232" /></a>[/caption]

Give your home a makeover and talk to <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/Completed.html" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a> about remodeling your foyer. The foyer is a place for impressions, personality and scene setting. Rest assured knowing the end result will be just as you dreamed when you use Gelotte Hommas to remodel your foyer.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The History of Gelotte Hommas Holiday Cards</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/12/06/the-history-of-gelotte-hommas-holiday-cards/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 06 Dec 2011 00:00:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=161</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you have ever worked with Gelotte Hommas before, you probably know that receiving a <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/holiday_cards.html" target="_blank">holiday card</a> from us is normal. However, those of you haven’t yet worked with us might not know the history behind receiving a holiday card in the mail from Gelotte Hommas. The very first Gelotte Hommas holiday card design was in 1986 and we are happy to say we have been doing it ever since. Beginning in November, the holiday card process begins with holding a contest to come up with the theme.

Once the theme is decided on and the card design goes to print, a signing party is held where the entire office spends an evening hand signing each and every card. We enjoy all that goes into the holiday card process due to the simple fact that we love our clients! We’ve rounded up a few holiday cards from years past just for you, take a peek:
<div class="mceTemp mceIEcenter" style="text-align:center;"><dl class="wp-caption  aligncenter"><dt class="wp-caption-dt"><a href="http://gelottehommas.com/holiday_cards.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-163" title="1986)GHA" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/1986gha.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a></dt><dd class="wp-caption-dd">Holiday card from 1986</dd></dl></div>
The card that started it all. This beautiful holiday card was the one designed and sent out in 1986 and began the tradition that still takes place today.
<div class="mceTemp mceIEcenter" style="text-align:center;"><dl class="wp-caption  aligncenter"><dt class="wp-caption-dt"><a href="http://gelottehommas.com/holiday_cards.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-164" title="2001" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/2001.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a></dt><dd class="wp-caption-dd">Holiday card from 2001</dd></dl></div>
A far from the simplicity of the 1986 holiday card, this intricate holiday card uses soft colors and detailing to give a beautiful picture of a winter scene.
<div class="mceTemp mceIEcenter" style="text-align:center;"><dl class="wp-caption  aligncenter"><dt class="wp-caption-dt"><a href="http://gelottehommas.com/holiday_cards.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-164 " title="2001" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/2006.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a></dt><dd class="wp-caption-dd">Holiday card from 2006</dd></dl></div>
This amazing design makes you feel as though you are walking down a long corridor by using depth and detailing.

Getting on the mailing list to receive this amazing holiday cards is easy. Be sure to <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/holiday_cards.html" target="_blank">sign up</a> and begin receiving beautiful holiday cards from Gelotte Hommas every season. Learn more about all things Gelotte Hommas and contact us today.]]></content:encoded>
