	<item>
		<title>Find Gelotte Hommas on Houzz</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/12/20/find-gelotte-hommas-on-houzz/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 20 Dec 2011 00:00:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=174</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Gelotte Hommas is on various social media platforms across the web, including <a href="http://www.houzz.com/pro/gelottehommas/gelotte-hommas-architecture" target="_blank">Houzz</a>! If you are unfamiliar with Houzz, you are in luck. We have compiled all the information you will need on this amazing website. All you have to do is log on, browse through our photographs and recommend us if you so choose!
<div class="mceTemp" style="text-align:center;"><dl class="wp-caption alignleft"><dt class="wp-caption-dt"><a href="http://www.houzz.com/pro/gelottehommas/gelotte-hommas-architecture"><img class="size-full wp-image-175 " title="Houzz" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/houzz.png" alt="" width="319" height="286" /></a></dt><dd class="wp-caption-dd">Click the picture and come follow us on Houzz</dd></dl></div>
<p style="text-align:left;">Houzz is a wonderful website for all things inspiration. Log on and browse through hundreds of photographs and ideas. When you log onto the Gelotte Hommas Houzz page, you will gain access to some wonderful elements. You can browse through our project photographs and idea books. An idea book is a post done by a user, which would be Gelotte Hommas in this case, and features something in the home. For instance, some of our idea books are, “Our Top 20 Favorite Fireplaces”, Mediterranean Style Architecture Brings Life into Small Spaces”, and “Concrete Floored Abode.” The goal of our idea books is to give you inspiration and ideas for your own home.</p>
<p style="text-align:left;">After perusing through our project photographs and idea books, give us a recommendation! Recommendations are easy to give and take approximately five minutes. Tell everyone else on Houzz how much you love us and why with a wonderful recommendation.</p>
<p style="text-align:left;">If you are in the Seattle area and interested in all things architecture, <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">contact Gelotte Hommas</a> today to learn more.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Different Details in Contemporary &#038; Modern Architecture</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/12/14/different-details-in-contemporary-modern-architecture/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 14 Dec 2011 00:00:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=179</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[In terms of architecture, the words “contemporary” and “modern” are often used interchangeably. However, modern architecture styles and contemporary architecture styles are two separate types of architecture. Don’t worry about trying to figure out all the details that make these two styles different from one another, that has already been done for you. Check out all the <a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/397977/list/Modern-or-Contemporary--What-s-the-Difference-" target="_blank">information</a> on what makes modern architecture different from contemporary architecture:

[caption id="attachment_180" align="alignleft" width="300" caption="This contemporary building used salvaged materials such as street signs and even phone books."]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/contemporary_1.png"><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-181" title="contemporary_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/contemporary_1.png" alt="" width="300" height="236" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>Contemporary</strong>: The concept of contemporary architecture essentially refers to architecture that is being produced now. It bends the rules and pushes the limits. Contemporary architecture is also not limited to one specific style of architecture. In addition to making new rules, contemporary architecture is often seen working in sync with energy efficient components. Some contemporary structures even go so far as to use salvaged materials for building.

<strong>Modern</strong>: Unlike contemporary architecture, modern architecture pays tribute to architecture styles past. The early to mid 20th century architecture is often a style most modern architecture spaces recall. Some of the elements from that style of architecture that can be seen in modern structures include, the use of concrete and steel, choosing stucco over brick, open floor plans and using glass in a large setting.

[caption id="attachment_180" align="alignright" width="300" caption="The use of large windows and an open floor plan are signals of modern architecture design in this home."]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/contemporary_2.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-180" title="contemporary_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/contemporary_2.png" alt="" width="300" height="253" /></a>[/caption]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>different-details-in-contemporary-modern-architecture</wp:post_name>

		<title>Cape-cod Shingle Style by Gelotte Hommas</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/12/09/cape-cod-shingle-style-by-gelotte-hommas/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 09 Dec 2011 00:00:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=186</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We love sharing some of our most recent projects with our readers. Being able to take a peek inside just how much magic Gelotte Hommas can work gives you a better idea of all that we are capable of. If you haven’t yet seen the Cape-cod Shingle Style project yet, you are in luck. We’ve rounded up a few pictures so you can get a better idea of just how magnificent this recent Gelotte Hommas project is. Take a peek inside the <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Cape-Cod%20Shingle.html">Cape-cod Shingle Style</a> project:

[caption id="attachment_189" align="aligncenter" width="490" caption="The amazing eyebrow window gives a panoramic view of the Puget Sound."]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Cape-Cod%20Shingle.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-189" title="Cape Cod Shingle Style" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/main_6.png" alt="The amazing eyebrow window gives a panoramic view of the Puget Sound." width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]

		<title>Check Out the Gelotte Hommas Gingerbread Creation</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/12/01/check-out-the-gelotte-hommas-gingerbread-creation/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 01 Dec 2011 00:00:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=191</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It’s no secret that Gelotte Hommas is capable of creating some breath-taking projects. This season, that includes a gingerbread creation! Gelotte Hommas is participating in the<a href="http://jdrfnorthwest.org/events/" target="_blank"> 2011 JDRF Gingerbread Village</a>and need your help. If you haven’t taken a look at the beautiful gingerbread creation done by Gelotte Hommas, prepare to be amazed, its like no other gingerbread house you have ever seen.

[caption id="attachment_193" align="aligncenter" width="600" caption="Architecturally designed by our very own Eric Drivdah, this amazing masterpiece outshines your typical gingerbread house."]<a href="https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10150418991374850&amp;set=pu.106339399849&amp;type=1&amp;theater"><img class="size-full wp-image-193" title="gingerbread_house_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gingerbread_house_1.jpg" alt="" width="600" height="450" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_192" align="aligncenter" width="600" caption="Gelotte Hommas needs your help! Text MYJDRF2 to 50512 to vote for The Gare Du Palais."]<a href="https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10150411309934850&amp;set=pu.106339399849&amp;type=1&amp;theater"><img class="size-full wp-image-192" title="gingerbread_house_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gingerbread_house_2.jpg" alt="" width="600" height="450" /></a>[/caption]

See The Gare Du Palais and the rest of the gingerbread creations for yourself! Head to the Sheraton Hotel Lobby on Sixth Avenue until January 1st to get a peek at The Gare Du Palais. This amazing event is free to the public with encouragement of donations.

Photo from <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10150418991374850&amp;set=a.171691429849.122287.106339399849&amp;type=1&amp;theater" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Our Favorite Fireplaces</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/11/29/our-favorite-fireplaces/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 29 Nov 2011 00:00:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=196</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The holiday season is in full swing and if there is one spot in the home that is focused on the most during this time it’s the fireplace. The center point for all things warm and cozy, fireplaces can be designed to match any style, from modern to contemporary. If you are considering having a remodel or building project done, consider a fireplace. Take a look at some of the ones Gelotte Hommas has done and chances are, you will want one of your very own!

[caption id="attachment_198" align="aligncenter" width="539" caption="This beautiful fireplace pays tribute to the Mediterranean theme that is seen in the rest of the home. While keeping with the tone of the rest of the home, this fireplace also creates a snug ambiance."]<a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/961286/thumbs/Our-top-20-favorite-fireplaces"><img class="size-full wp-image-198" title="Med" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/med.png" alt="" width="539" height="356" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_197" align="aligncenter" width="539" caption="Who says you can&#039;t have a cozy feeling in a modern home? This gorgeous fireplace debunks all myths about creating warmth in a contemporary home. Though it does pay tribute to modern styles, this fireplace also creates a cozy and welcoming atmosphere."]<a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/961286/thumbs/Our-top-20-favorite-fireplaces"><img class="size-full wp-image-197" title="contemporary" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/contemporary.png" alt="" width="539" height="402" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_199" align="aligncenter" width="539" caption="A unique twist on the traditional fireplace, this nature inspired fireplace brings the outdoors, in with reclaimed wood from the property. The beautiful wood and stone work together to create a natural and organic twist on the typical fireplace."]<a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/961286/thumbs/Our-top-20-favorite-fireplaces"><img class="size-full wp-image-199" title="tree" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/tree.png" alt="" width="539" height="401" /></a>[/caption]

Now that you have taken a look at some of our favorite fireplaces, design your own! <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/home.html" target="_blank">Contact Gelotte Homma</a>s today to learn more about how you can accent your home’s design style with a wonderful fireplace this season.

Photos from <a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com">Gelotte Hommas Archtiecture</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Give Your High Ceiling a Smaller Scale</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/11/22/give-your-high-ceiling-a-smaller-scale/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 22 Nov 2011 00:00:14 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=202</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Having <a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/414191/list/How-to-Make-a-Tall-Room-Feel-Right" target="_blank">tall ceilings</a> is definitely a bonus feature in a home. They open up the room and can make your home feel larger than it might actually be. However, sometimes a tall ceiling can feel a little too tall and you want to create a cozier, more at home feeling in the room. With the help of <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a>, your tall ceiling can maintain its height while also creating a more snug atmosphere in the room.

[caption id="attachment_203" align="alignleft" width="221" caption="These beams make the room and high ceiling cozier."]<a href="http://www.houzz.com/pro/gelottehommas/gelotte-hommas-architecture"><img class="size-full wp-image-203" title="GH-Ceiling-221x300" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gh-ceiling-221x300.png" alt="" width="221" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

One feature that can be used in a room with high ceilings are beams. Whether for decorating or structural purposes, beams help break up the open space left from the tall ceilings. The advantage of beams is their ability to create a cozier atmosphere without being in the way. Beams can also be painted to match the ceiling to help blend them into the surrounding area.

If beams aren’t your taste, consider building a false ceiling instead. False ceilings can be built over areas that are often populated, such as the kitchen table. You can build a false ceiling over one part of the room and leave the high ceiling in other parts of the room to add dimension as well as a closer feel without even noticing it.

Perhaps you prefer the high ceiling as is but you are just searching for that little something extra to complete the room. If so, consider building a shelf to display home decor items. This is an easy way to fill empty space as well as show off your personal take on style and design while also keeping the bigger feel to the room.

If you have a tall ceiling that you feel needs work, <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/Contact.html" target="_blank">contact Gelotte Hommas</a> today to learn more about your options.

Photo from <a href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/74853/Formal-Living-Room-traditional-living-room-other-metros" target="_blank">Houzz</a>]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[[&#8230;] are also used to draw attention to various elements of a home. Features such as grand fireplaces, high ceilings, sharp roof lines, and floor to ceiling windows can provide a connection to the natural landscape [&#8230;]]]></wp:comment_content>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Elements of Design with Gelotte Hommas: Part II</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/11/17/elements-of-design-with-gelotte-hommas-part-ii/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 17 Nov 2011 00:00:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=297</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[In our last post, we discussed the first three elements of design that go into every <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/Design.html" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a> project. Throughout this post, you will learn the second half of those elements and how Gelotte Hommas succeeds at exemplifying them in every project. Take a look at the other three elements of design that are executed in every Gelotte Hommas project:
<div id="attachment_1785">

[caption id="attachment_298" align="aligncenter" width="490" caption="This beautiful space executes the design element of light by being designed to take in the most afternoon sun."]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Cape-Cod%20Shingle.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-298" title="Cape Cod Shingle Style" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/main_41.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]

This beautiful space executes the design element of light by being designed to take in the most afternoon sun.

</div>
<ul>
	<li><em>Light</em>: Taking control of light and how it effects spaces is a specialty of Gelotte Hommas. Whether it’s daytime or nighttime, light is constantly playing into an area and should be carefully considered when planning out projects. Designing spaces to play up natural light as well as using lighting techniques to highlight your home after the sun goes down are considerations Gelotte Hommas always pays attention to.</li>
	<li><em>Place</em>: Being considerate of the atmosphere surrounding your home or other space should always play a large role in the planning process. While you do want your home or space to be a sort of haven from the rest of the world, you also want it to blend nicely with the environment surrounding it. Gelotte Hommas pays close attention to the exterior as well as the interior of a home or space to ensure that it all comes together as one whole piece.</li>
	<li><em>Materials</em>: Last, but certainly not least, are the materials. The idea of materials should not be thought of in a construction sort of way, but more as a vehicle in which beauty, form, light, rhythm and place are all delivered through.</li>
</ul>
<div>Rest assured that when you work with Gelotte Hommas, all of the important aspects of design will not only put taken into consideration, but will shine through in your final project. <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/Contact.html" target="_blank">Contact Gelotte Hommas</a> today to learn more about beginning a new design project.</div>
<div>Photo from <a href="http://http//gelottehommas.com/Contact.html" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a></div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Elements of Design with Gelotte Hommas: Part I</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/11/15/elements-of-design-with-gelotte-hommas-part-i/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 15 Nov 2011 00:00:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=300</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[t’s no secret that when Gelotte Hommas designs a space many factors come into play. Some of the biggest factors that come into the process are the elements of design. If you check out the <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/Design.html" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas website</a>, you know that six significant elements of design are outlined and strongly emphasized. However, just to give you a better idea of what all goes into the intricate process of designing a new space, we’ve broken down the six elements of design into two parts. Check out the first part of the elements of design with Gelotte Hommas:
<div id="attachment_1766">

[caption id="attachment_301" align="aligncenter" width="490" caption="The tower in Casa Del Sol is reminiscent of an old silo, doubles as a wildlife lookout and game room thus incorporating Beauty, Form and Rhythm."]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Casa_Del_Sol.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-301" title="Casa Del Sol" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/large_92.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]

</div>
<ul>
	<li><em>Beauty</em>: The age-old saying “beauty is in the eye of the beholder” comes to life when Gelotte Hommas transforms a mere piece of space into something that truly captures the eye. Many factors go into making a space or area beautiful such as scale and proportion. Paying close attention to detail and keeping functionality in mind, Gelotte Hommas is able to expose beauty in just about any project.</li>
	<li><em>Form</em>: Being able to create a structure that is not only beautiful but also acts as a functional structure is an important element of design. Gelotte Hommas is able to create dramatic and breath-taking structures that also have a high level of functionality.</li>
	<li><em>Rhythm</em>: The element of rhythm includes various factors such as repetition and spacing. Gelotte Hommas keeps rhythm in mind when working on a project in order to accent and highlight even the smallest of details in a space.</li>
</ul>
<div>Stay tuned for the second part of the series to learn about the last three elements of design. When you use <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/Contact.html" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a> to transform your dreams into a reality, you won’t have to worry about keeping these elements of design in mind. Rest assured Gelotte Hommas will keep the important elements of design in mind at all times.</div>
<div>Photo from <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a></div>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Join us for our first ever Twitter chat – #archIQ</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/11/16/join-us-for-our-first-ever-twitter-chat-archiq/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 16 Nov 2011 00:00:19 +0000</pubDate>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Have you ever wished that you could corner an architect and ask them whatever you wanted for a half an hour? Well you are going to get that chance on Tuesday November 29th from 6:30 – 7:00 PM PST.

[caption id="attachment_305" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Our first ever twitter chat #archIQ"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/dec_29th_graphic.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-305" title="Our first ever twitter chat #archIQ" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/dec_29th_graphic.png" alt="" width="560" height="371" /></a>[/caption]

	<item>
		<title>3 Tips to Make Your Home Happier</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/11/11/3-tips-to-make-your-home-happier/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 11 Nov 2011 00:00:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=307</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Living in a home that boosts happiness is an important factor. One way to increase the happiness factor in your home is to use <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a> to work on a remodel or project with you. Once you’re perfect project is completed, inserting your own style and design aspects is important. Check out a few <a href="http://shine.yahoo.com/at-home/10-ways-to-make-your-home-happier-2595347.html" target="_blank">ways</a> to use your own inspirations along with Gelotte Hommas design to create a happier home:
<div id="attachment_1750">

[caption id="attachment_308" align="aligncenter" width="490" caption="Accenting with trim and splashes of bring colors can really open up a room"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Asian_ambiance.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-308" title="Asian Ambiance " src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/large_6.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]

</div>
<ul>
	<li><em>Open up with white paint</em>: White paint reflects light, which can open up an area as well as accent the color items in the space. It can also create a cozy, warm feeling during fall and winter seasons.</li>
</ul>
<div>
<div id="attachment_1749">

[caption id="attachment_309" align="aligncenter" width="490" caption="The use of color and throughout this master suite brightens and opens up the entire space"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/lakeside_lookout.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-309" title="Lakeside Lookout" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/large_4.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]

</div>
</div>
<ul>
	<li><em>Color your entry way</em>: The <a title="Entry Way Designs by Gelotte Hommas" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/recent-projects/entry-way-designs-by-gelotte-hommas/" target="_blank">foyer</a> is often where most guests will make a first impression of your home. Catch their attention by adding a pop of color here and there to express your personal sense of style and design. Adding accents with color to the foyer also gives guests an idea of what to expect throughout the rest of your home.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li><em>Go bold</em>: Smaller spaces allow you to be more dramatic. Use a bold print or pattern to brighten up a smaller area of your home.</li>
</ul>
<div>Boosting the happiness in your home can be done easily when you work with Gelotte Hommas. Use these tips and<a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/Contact.html" target="_blank"> contact Gelotte Hommas</a> to begin working on making your home a happy one.</div>
<div>Photos from <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a></div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Find Gelotte Hommas On Facebook</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/11/07/find-gelotte-hommas-on-facebook/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 07 Nov 2011 00:00:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=334</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Facebook is a wonderful tool for a variety of reasons. One of those reasons is because it helps keep you in-the-know about all things Gelotte Hommas! Like us on <a href="http://www.facebook.com/pages/Gelotte-Hommas-Architecture/106339399849" target="_blank">Facebook </a>and you can get access to various helpful elements.
<div id="attachment_1720">

[caption id="attachment_335" align="aligncenter" width="400" caption="Like? More like love! Click on the picture to &quot;Like&quot; Gelotte Hommas on Facebook and fall in love."]<a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/Gelotte-Hommas-Architecture/106339399849"><img class="size-full wp-image-335 " title="fb_like" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/fb_like.jpg" alt="" width="400" height="400" /></a>[/caption]

One of the advantages of liking us on Facebook is the ability to get immediately updated once a new blog post is published. You can even access the new post right from Facebook! The Gelotte Hommas Facebook page also has an abundant amount of photos to give you a peek inside the type of projects completed or in the works. Various albums include, entry ways, kitchen islands, remodeling projects and outdoor living spaces. You can also log onto our Facebook page to get connected with others who love Gelotte Hommas!

</div>
Liking Gelotte Hommas on Facebook is just another way to join the conversation! Jump on the social media train and like us on Facebook.

Now that you know a little more about the Gelotte Hommas Facebook page, let us hear from you! What do you love most about the Gelotte Hommas Facebook page?

Photo from <a href="http://www.freedigitalphotos.net/images/Communications_and_N_g263-Like_Button_p43923.html" target="_blank">Free Digital Photos</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Indulge in a Residential Wine Cellar</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/11/24/345/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 24 Nov 2011 20:36:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=345</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Ready to take your wine-tasting or collecting hobby to the next level? Many wine lovers are indulging their passion by <strong>constructing wine cellars and storage rooms inside their own homes.</strong> An <strong>in-home wine cellar</strong> is an addition that can add an exciting entertainment option to your lifestyle not to mention the ability to control wine storage conditions to procure the perfect glass.

While, wine storage rooms are more practical for some homeowners, in Northern California wine country,<a title="http://www.capradio.org/155192" href="http://www.capradio.org/155192" target="_blank">underground wine caves</a> revive age-old traditions with an authentic cellar experience. These amazing spaces are chronicled in the beautiful coffee table book <a title="http://www.amazon.com/Into-Earth-Wine-Cave-Renaissance/dp/1933415827" href="http://www.amazon.com/Into-Earth-Wine-Cave-Renaissance/dp/1933415827" target="_blank">“Into the Earth: A Wine Cave Renaissance”</a> by Daniel D’Agostini.
<div id="attachment_906">

[caption id="attachment_346" align="aligncenter" width="249" caption="Image via capradio.org"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/wine_1_a.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-346" title="Wine cave" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/wine_1_a.jpg" alt="" width="249" height="166" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_347" align="aligncenter" width="250" caption="Image via capradio.org"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/wine_1.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-347" title="Wine Vineyard " src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/wine_1.jpg" alt="" width="250" height="309" /></a>[/caption]

</div>
<a title="http://gelottehommas.com/" href="http://gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a> in Bellevue, Wa., specializes in translating our clients’ dreams into exceptional designs in a variety of styles and sizes. With thoughtful attention to <a title="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/inspirations/defining-beauty-and-form/" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/inspirations/defining-beauty-and-form/" target="_blank">beauty, form</a>, <a title="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/the-art-of-architecture/" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/the-art-of-architecture/" target="_blank">rhythm, light, place, and materials</a>, we have been crafting custom living spaces in the Seattle area for more than 25 years and are known for our <a title="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/remodeling/curtis-gelotte-discusses-personalized-design/" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/remodeling/curtis-gelotte-discusses-personalized-design/" target="_blank">personalized design</a>.

If you are considering an in-home wine cellar, check out these <a title="http://www.winespectator.com/magazine/show/id/43863" href="http://www.winespectator.com/magazine/show/id/43863" target="_blank">cellaring basics from Wine Spectator</a>, and contact <a title="http://gelottehommas.com/" href="http://gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a> to get explore your design options.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The Art of Architecture</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/the-art-of-architiecture/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 27 Dec 2011 17:51:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?page_id=7</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:justify;" colspan="2" valign="top" width="625">Our approach is best characterized by thoughtful attentiveness to distinct aspects of aesthetics, instead of a specific architectural style.  We blend the intuitive with the rational while uniting how spaces work with how they feel.  The following components contribute significantly to the success of our design.<strong> </strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="91">
<p align="center"><strong><span style="text-decoration:underline;"><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/photo_design_beauty.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-11" title="photo_design_beauty" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/photo_design_beauty.jpg" alt="" width="112" height="112" /></a></span></strong><strong><span style="text-decoration:underline;">BEAUTY</span></strong></p>
<p align="center"><strong> </strong></p>
</td>
<td style="text-align:justify;padding-left:30px;" valign="top" width="547">A structure is transformed from merely functional into something delightful to the eyes by artistically composing specific elements with attention to scale, proportion, and alignment.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="91">
<p align="center"><strong><span style="text-decoration:underline;"><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/photo_design_form.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-12" title="photo_design_form" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/photo_design_form.jpg" alt="" width="112" height="112" /></a></span></strong><strong><span style="text-decoration:underline;">FORM</span></strong></p>
<p align="center"><strong> </strong></p>
</td>
<td style="text-align:justify;padding-left:30px;" valign="top" width="547">Clearly articulated volumes, instead of just creating internal and external spaces, address the building’s function while creating dramatic and evocative structures.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="91">
<p align="center"><strong><span style="text-decoration:underline;"><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/photo_design_rythm.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-8" title="photo_design_rythm" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/photo_design_rythm.jpg" alt="" width="112" height="112" /></a></span></strong><strong><span style="text-decoration:underline;">RHYTHM</span></strong></p>
<p align="center"><strong> </strong></p>
</td>
<td style="text-align:justify;padding-left:30px;" valign="top" width="547">The spacing, repetition, and interplay of elements enrich and deepen otherwise simple components.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="91">
<p align="center"><strong><span style="text-decoration:underline;"><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/light.png"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-9" title="Light" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/light.png" alt="" width="112" height="112" /></a></span></strong><strong><span style="text-decoration:underline;">LIGHT</span></strong></p>
<p align="center"><strong> </strong></p>
</td>
<td style="text-align:justify;padding-left:30px;" valign="top" width="547">From dawn until dusk, light continually changes the colors and moods within a space. We harness that light to energize the character of each space. After the sun goes down, thoughtfully composed lighting creates a whole new series of moods, both inside and outside, expanding the appreciation of your home.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="91">
<p align="center"><strong><span style="text-decoration:underline;"><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/photo_design_place.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-13" title="photo_design_place" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/photo_design_place.jpg" alt="" width="112" height="112" /></a></span></strong><strong><span style="text-decoration:underline;">PLACE</span></strong></p>
<p align="center"><strong> </strong></p>
</td>
<td style="text-align:justify;padding-left:30px;" valign="top" width="547">We pay careful attention to the relationship of the house to the site and the relationship of the interior to the exterior. For homes, this involves providing places of refuge as well as places of prospect: your vantage place to oversee your world.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="91">
<p align="center"><strong><span style="text-decoration:underline;"><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/materials.png"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-10" title="Materials" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/materials.png" alt="" width="112" height="112" /></a></span></strong><strong><span style="text-decoration:underline;">MATERIALS</span></strong></p>
<p align="center"><strong><span style="text-decoration:underline;">
</span></strong></p>
</td>
<td style="text-align:justify;padding-left:30px;" valign="top" width="547">Rich materials, honestly expressed and artistically joined, become more than just basic elements of construction; they are the means through which beauty, form, light, rhythm, and place are expressed.
<p style="text-align:justify;"></p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:justify;" colspan="2" valign="top" width="638">In addition to recognizing these components, our designs are carefully guided by our client’s needs and desires.  The end result always reflects the client’s vision and our architectural artistry.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>]]></content:encoded>

		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>

		<description></description>

		<wp:post_id>38</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

		<wp:post_name>rollovers_02</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>inherit</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>35</wp:post_parent>

		<wp:post_type>attachment</wp:post_type>

	<item>
		<title>Our Work</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/our-work/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 27 Dec 2011 18:51:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?page_id=35</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align:justify;">Below is a brief portfolio of some of our most recent work.  Please visit our website <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/home.html">www.gelottehommas.com</a>  for our comprehensive portfolio.</p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" align="center">

<tr>
<td colspan="3" valign="top" width="283">

A sophisticated woodland retreat with exposed beam ceiling</p>
</td>
</tr>

	<item>
		<title>Highlighting the Outdoor Entry Way</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/12/27/highlighting-the-outdoor-entry-way/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 27 Dec 2011 21:01:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=88</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The outdoor front entry way is one of the very first elements guests and visitors see on your home, meaning it can make or break first impressions. With such a heavy responsibility weighing on the outdoor entry way, it is important to make sure it looks nothing short of spectacular. Using architectural details, you can make your outdoor entry way really shine. If you are considering a remodeling project or building a custom home, don’t forget to include the entry way. Take a look at a <a href="http://freshome.com/2011/01/24/beautifying-your-front-entry-with-architectural-details/" target="_blank">few ways</a> architectural details can make all the difference in your entry way:
<div id="attachment_1849">

[caption id="" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="This beautiful entry way uses lighting to highlight the smaller architectural details."]<a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/"><img src="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/files/2011/12/large_8-300x232.png" alt="Gelotte Hommas" width="300" height="232" /></a>[/caption]

</div>
<ul>
	<li><em>Light it up</em>: Architectural lighting is a wonderful way to mix functionality and beauty into one. Use lighting to guide guests when they enter your home during the night as well as highlight some of beautiful, smaller architectural details on your home.</li>
	<li><em>Focus on architectural period elements</em>: No matter what architecture style your home is, you can always focus on the period in the entry way. Updating or enhancing the more intricate details that point to the architecture period on the entry way of your home is a great way to bring the style to life.</li>
	<li><em>Mix and match</em>: Using various materials in your outdoor entry way is also a way to bring architectural details to life. You can bring the whole look together by using the same type of geometrical shape, but various shapes, sizes and colors. This will create dimension and originality in your entry way.</li>
</ul>
<div>Learn more about how to bring out the best in your outdoor entry way with architectural details by <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">contacting Gelotte Hommas</a> today for more information.</div>
<div>Photo from <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Lakefront_Gothic.html" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a></div>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>GHA_1</title>

		<title>Cape Cod Shingle Style</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/12/09/cape-cod-shingle-style-by-gelotte-hommas/main_4/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 28 Dec 2011 20:21:52 +0000</pubDate>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>188</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-12-28 20:21:52</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-12-28 20:21:52</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>

	<item>
		<title>Add Arches to Your Home</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/12/29/add-arches-to-your-home/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 29 Dec 2011 18:18:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=208</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Arches have a great way of adding depth, dimension and appeal to the home. They can open up a room as well as emphasize certain accents. If you have been considering planning a remodeling project or new home, consider using arches for a wide variety of reasons. It’s okay if you are unsure of what direction to go in terms of arches, we found a few wonderful styles that could be the perfect addition to your home. Take a peek at <a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/601976/list/Arches-Frame-Welcoming-Spaces" target="_blank">some fantastic arches</a> and ways they can accent your home

[caption id="attachment_212" align="aligncenter" width="490" caption="Adding multiple arches is a great way to open up a room and make it seem as though it is more spacious. This room uses arches to create a more seamless, streamline look."]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Vizcaya.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-212" title="Vizcaya" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/large_3.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_213" align="aligncenter" width="490" caption="A series of arches is a classic way to elongate a space and add a touch of timelessness. The arches against the straight ceiling beams creates movement and dimensions."]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Sammamish_Tuscan.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-213" title="Mediterranean Estate" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/large_9.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_214" align="aligncenter" width="490" caption="If you are looking to add richness and a traditional ambiance to a space, consider framing the arches, or adding tile. Framed arches have a great way of adding a feeling of luxury and texture to an area."]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/large_31.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-214" title="Mediterranean wine room" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/large_31.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]

Learn more about all things architecture by <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">contacting Gelotte Hommas</a> for more information.

Photos by Gelotte Hommas]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[A classic library design gets a modern spark and a fresh feel.]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Top Custom Home Design Trends for 2012</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/01/04/top-custom-home-design-trends-for-2012/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 04 Jan 2012 17:59:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=556</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The new year is finally here and we are so excited to see what 2012 has to offer. Designing a custom home is a fantastic way to get 2012 off to a great start. If are already considering designing a new home in 2012, you are in luck. We came across some of the hottest elements and features set to be on the trend list for 2012. Design your home with style in mind and take a look at <a href="http://www.builderonline.com/design/schumacher-predicts-10-custom-home-design-trends-for-2012.aspx" target="_blank">some of the trends</a> you can expect to see in 2012:
<div id="attachment_1869">

[caption id="attachment_557" align="alignleft" width="490" caption="A wall of windows, such as this one, can create a spacious feel in a room that has lower ceilings."]<a href="http://gehttp://gelottehommas.com/completed/Hilltop.htmllottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/large_61.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-557" title="Hilltop" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/large_61.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]

</div>
<div>A wall of windows, such as this one, can create a spacious feel in a room that has lower ceilings.</div>
<ul>
	<li><strong>In-law suites</strong>: Adding an element of privacy to a custom home is becoming increasingly popular. More custom homes are being designed with in-law suites to give guests added privacy and comfort. Some custom homes even go so far as to create separate entrances for the in-law suites to create the maximum amount of privacy.</li>
	<li><strong>Hearth rooms</strong>: Creating a room specifically for a fireplace is becoming a popular trend, especially in colder climates. Designing a hearth room in a custom home can create a warm and cozy ambiance in the home without much effort.</li>
	<li><strong>Walls of windows</strong>: Using a wall dedicated to windows is becoming increasingly popular. This trend touches on sustainability by taking advantage of natural light while also creating a sleek and stylish feel. A wall of windows will also open an area that may not have felt as spacious without the windows.</li>
</ul>
<div>Knowing a few of the latest trends for 2012 is only part of the process. <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/Portfolio.html" target="_blank">Contact Gelotte Hommas</a> today for more information how to get started on designing your perfect custom home.</div>
<div>Photo from <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Hilltop.html" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a></div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Using Exposed Wood in Your Home</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/01/11/using-exposed-wood-in-your-home/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 11 Jan 2012 18:22:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=560</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The use of exposed wood is no longer for barns. The trend of using exposed wood in the home is becoming increasingly popular for a number of reasons. Contrary to popular belief, exposed wood can be used in a variety of ways and does not have to look one certain way. If you are looking to add a touch of something special to your home this year, consider using exposed wood in your renovation or custom home. Take a peek at <a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/713208/list/Supporting-Act--Exposed-Wood-Trusses-in-Design" target="_blank">a few ways</a> exposed wood can be used in your home:

[caption id="attachment_562" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Photo from Houzz"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/1gelotte.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-562" title="1gelotte" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/1gelotte.png" alt="" width="560" height="428" /></a>[/caption]

Create a more streamline, consistent feel by painting the exposed wood the same color as the walls. This will give you all of the advantages of using exposed wooden beams without drawing too much attention upwards.

[caption id="attachment_561" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Photo from Houzz"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/3gelotte.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-561" title="3gelotte" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/3gelotte.png" alt="" width="560" height="371" /></a>[/caption]

If you prefer the industrial look of exposed wooden beams, leave them uncovered and let the natural materials shine. Exposed wooden beams such as these create a more natural and modern look while drawing attention to the space.

[caption id="attachment_563" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Photo from Houzz"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/2gelotte.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-563" title="2gelotte" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/2gelotte.png" alt="" width="560" height="412" /></a>[/caption]

Perhaps you are looking to create a more subtle, quiet feel with exposed wood. Using exposed wood in a way like this creates a warm and cozy ambiance in the home while also letting the natural qualities of the wood be seen.

Learn more about how to use exposed wood in your home by <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">contacting Gelotte Hommas</a> today for more information on how to get started.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Create a Nook in Your Home</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/01/12/create-a-nook-in-your-home/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 12 Jan 2012 18:33:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=565</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[A nook is the ultimate spot for all things relaxation. These cozy little spots allow you to take a breather from the rest of the world and focus on a good book or warm cup of coffee. If you are building a custom home or doing a remodeling project, consider adding a nook to your plans. Take a look at <a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/739730/list/Cuddly-Nooks-for-Every-Room" target="_blank">a few nooks</a> that caught our attention:

[caption id="attachment_569" align="aligncenter" width="421" caption="Photo from Houzz"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/nook1.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-569" title="nook1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/nook1.png" alt="" width="421" height="640" /></a>[/caption]

Add height to your nook by creating the space on an elevated level. A nook like this one is great if you have a wonderful view that you want to escape to every now and again. Natural light also makes for the perfect daytime reading spot in this nook.

[caption id="attachment_571" align="aligncenter" width="398" caption="Photo from Houzz"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/nook2.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-571" title="nook2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/nook2.png" alt="" width="398" height="404" /></a>[/caption]

Perhaps you would like a nook that is a bit of a hideaway. Space under a staircase makes for a wonderful nook location. A nook like this one is perfect if you would like a nook that has a little more privacy and isn’t directly out in the open.

[caption id="attachment_570" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Photo from Houzz"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/nook3.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-570" title="nook3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/nook3.png" alt="" width="560" height="404" /></a>[/caption]

A nook doesn’t necessarily have to be in an enclosed area. Simply design a space to have extra space for a cozy chair or small table and a nook is born. Creating a nook space that is separate from the rest of the room will open the area while also giving you a spot to escape to.

&nbsp;

<a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">Contact Gelotte Hommas</a> for more information on how to create the perfect nook for your home.]]></content:encoded>

		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=576</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Deciding to remodel your bathroom at the start of a New Year is a fantastic idea. A bathroom renovation can give your home that fresh face lift it has been needing. It is also to remodel at the start of a New Year due to the fact that you can get on board with all of the latest trends. We came across <a href="http://www.hgtv.com/bathrooms/bathroom-looks-were-loving/pictures/index.html?nl=HGKB_011612_featlink4&amp;sni_mid=24439&amp;sni_rid=24439.325.688512" target="_blank">a few bathroom trends</a> that are expected to be hot items in 2012. Take a look:</p>[caption id="attachment_578" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Photo from HGTV"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/sink_1.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-578" title="sink_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/sink_1.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a>[/caption]<p>One big trend we found is concrete in the bathroom. Counter tops and sinks, such as this one, are using concrete to mock the look of luxury hotels. This material is expected to become popular due to its natural and organic feel. It is also extremely durable and can add a surprisingly comfortable feel to the bathroom. </p>[caption id="attachment_579" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Photo from HGTV"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/sink_2.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-579" title="sink_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/sink_2.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a>[/caption]<p>Floating fixtures are also items that are predicted to be quite popular in 2012. Using floating fixtures in a bathroom reduces the amount of cramped space by opening up the area, giving you spacial options you might have never known you had before using the fixtures. In addition, floating fixtures can also create that modern feel you have been looking to create in your bathroom.</p>[caption id="attachment_577" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Photo from HGTV"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/sink_3.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-577" title="sink_3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/sink_3.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="746" /></a>[/caption]<p>Adding sparkling and classic features is also becoming a popular trend. Hanging elements such as chandeliers in the bathroom create a feeling of elegance and add a touch of shine. In addition, adding timeless and sparkling elements makes the bathroom connect with the rest of the home and leaves it feeling less like a bathroom and more like a luxurious powder room.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>If you are interested in remodeling your bathroom in line with the trends for 2012, <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">contact Gelotte Hommas</a>today for more information on how to get started.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Planning a Successful Remodel</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/01/23/planning-a-successful-remodel/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 00:00:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=582</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Planning a remodeling project that will be a success can be a difficult task to take on. Renovations on top of day-to-day tasks can be cause for stress, but with the help of a few tips and Gelotte Hommas, you could be on your way to planning a successful remodeling project in no time at all. We have uncovered<a href="http://www.bhg.com/home-improvement/advice/expert-advice/15-tips-for-a-successful-remodeling-project/" target="_blank"> a couple of helpful tips</a> for planning a successful remodel, just for you. Take a peek at how to plan a successful renovation:

[caption id="attachment_583" align="alignright" width="490" caption="Photo Courtesy of Gelotte Hommas"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/lakeside_lookout.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-583" title="large_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/large_21.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;
<ul>
	<li><em>Plan ahead</em>: Make things easier on yourself by planning ahead and selecting material choices in advance. When you decide on the materials you wish to use in your remodeling project early in the process, you are not only saving yourself time but ensuring that you are sticking to your budget as well.</li>
	<li><em>Keep the end result in mind</em>: When planning a remodeling project, it can become easy to get lost in all the little details. Make sure you are keeping the end result in mind to be sure that you are getting the remodel that you want. This will keep your stress levels down while also ensuring your focus is on the finished result.</li>
	<li><em>Get organized</em>: In order to make sure you still have everything you use on a daily basis during a remodeling project, it is often best to get yourself organized before everything starts. Begin by packing away anything delicate or important to avoid harming it. In addition, create a temporary station in your home that you can use for daily tasks and activities.</li>
</ul>
<div>For more information on all things architecture and remodeling, <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/home.html" target="_blank">contact Gelotte Hommas</a> today.</div>
&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Looking Up: Transforming the Attic</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/01/25/looking-up-transforming-the-attic/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 25 Jan 2012 00:00:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=586</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The attic is often the last place people consider remodeling or designing with living space in mind. However, the attic is a wonderful spot to transform into a living area if you are planning a remodel or designing a custom home. Attic space can be used for a variety of spaces. We came across <a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/1174765/list/Look-Up--There-May-Be-Living-Room-in-the-Attic" target="_blank">a few ideas</a> to get you started if you are considering a remodel or designing a custom home. Take a look:

[caption id="attachment_587" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Photo from Houzz"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/attic_1.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-587" title="attic_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/attic_1.png" alt="" width="560" height="422" /></a>[/caption]

Consider using your attic space for a living room. Many traditional homes have a dining room, kitchen and formal living room on the main floor. Create a more casual living area in the attic where you can relax and enjoy a good book or the television.

[caption id="attachment_588" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Photo from Houzz"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/attic2.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-588" title="attic2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/attic2.png" alt="" width="560" height="432" /></a>[/caption]

While a home office is a helpful space, it can sometimes be distracting to work in the center of your home where everything is taking place. Consider using your attic space for a home office to create a better sense of privacy and efficiency.

[caption id="attachment_589" align="aligncenter" width="476" caption="Photo from Houzz"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/attic3.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-589" title="attic3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/attic3.png" alt="" width="476" height="639" /></a>[/caption]

The attic is also a wonderful area for extra storage space. Use your attic for extra closet space to keep yourself better organized. You can also use it to house seasonal items that you may not be able to wear year-round to make room in your closet.

If you are interested in transforming your attic through a remodel project or a custom home design, <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">contact Gelotte Hommas</a> today for more information on how to get started.

&nbsp;

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Bridging the Gap</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/01/27/bridging-the-gap/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 27 Jan 2012 21:52:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.com/?p=592</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Bridges are often only thought about in terms of something that connects two roads across a large body of water. However, bridges are also wonderful elements for inside the home. Using a bridge in your home is a great way to link two different areas in a unique and original way. Bridges also have a way of filling space without too much effort. We uncovered<a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/1266364/list/Bridging-the-Distance-Indoors" target="_blank"> a few great ideas</a> for incorporating a bridge into your home, take a peek:

[caption id="attachment_594" align="aligncenter" width="493" caption="Photo from Houzz"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/bridge_1.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-594" title="bridge_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/bridge_1.png" alt="" width="493" height="537" /></a>[/caption]

Try a look that it a bit more daring with a minimal look such as this one. The glass material paired with the railing that looks as though it is floating mid-air creates an edgy, more excited look. A bridge such as this one is perfect for modern styles or an area you wish to keep as open as possible.

[caption id="attachment_595" align="aligncenter" width="421" caption="Photo from Houzz"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/bridge_2.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-595" title="bridge_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/bridge_2.png" alt="" width="421" height="637" /></a>[/caption]

Bridges in the home do not always have to be large and attention-getting. Simple bridges like this one create an interest in the area while also allowing the rest of the room’s features to shine though. Smaller bridges are perfect for smaller spaces in which you still wish to create an interesting atmosphere.

[caption id="attachment_593" align="aligncenter" width="433" caption="Photo from Houzz"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/bridge_3.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-593" title="bridge_3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/bridge_3.png" alt="" width="433" height="636" /></a>[/caption]

Create a sturdier feel with a bridge by using walls around it. The windows in this area allow for natural sun light, which keeps the space from becoming too dark. A bridge like this one will create a cozier ambiance in the home through the use of space.
If you are in the Seattle area and interested in designing your home with a bridge in mind, <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">contact Gelotte Hommas</a> today for more information.

&nbsp;

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Kitchen Trends for 2012</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/01/31/kitchen-trends-for-2012/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 31 Jan 2012 00:00:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=598</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[When designing your kitchen during a custom home or remodeling project, there are many factors to consider. One of those factors being, the tile choice. The way in which you decide to design the tile or types of materials you use can create a wonderful accent to your kitchen area. One of the best ways to ensure your home is looking fresh and right out of a magazine is to consider the newest tile trends for 2012. We have uncovered <a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/1228362/list/2012-Trends--New-Tile-Styles-for-the-Kitchen" target="_blank">a few trends</a> in kitchen tiles that are predicted to hit high on the trend lists. Take a peek:
<div id="attachment_1928">

[caption id="attachment_599" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Take a look at a few kitchen tile trends for 2012."]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/tile_1.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-599" title="tile_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/tile_1.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="199" /></a>[/caption]

</div>
<ul>
	<li><strong>Graphic patterns</strong>: It has been predicted that graphic patterns in tiles will be hot items on the trend list for 2012. Using graphic patterned tiles in your kitchen design can add texture, dimension and interest to the area. Typically, graphic patterns are best used in a smaller amount of space. Consider following this trend for your back splash to create interest without overdoing it.</li>
	<li><strong>Recycled materials</strong>: It’s no secret how trendy the idea of sustainable building became in recent years and it seems as though that trend isn’t going anywhere anytime soon. One of the other trends in kitchen tiles will be recycled materials. Adding tiles that are made out of recycled materials are a wonderful addition to your kitchen that was designed and built in a sustainable fashion.</li>
	<li><strong>New finishes</strong>: A new trend that has also been emerging is wood-look floor tile. This fantastic product looks exactly like wood but cuts the worry about spilling liquids on it. In addition, this great material is highly durable and wears quite well. Consider this material for your kitchen floor when designing your home.</li>
</ul>
<div>If you are interested in custom home design or remodeling projects, <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">contact Gelotte Hommas</a> today for more information on how to get started.</div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>New year - New blog design!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/02/06/new-year-new-blog-design/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 06 Feb 2012 19:54:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=602</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Happy 2012 everyone! Last year was great and now this year is going to be even better. We redesigned out website last year, and as 2012 came closer we thought maybe our blog could use some sprucing up as well.

So - TADA! Here it is! Here are a few of the new features:
<ul>
	<li>Easier Navigation with a custom tool bar right along the top including:
<ul id="menu-primary-items">
	<li id="menu-item-292"><a title="Home" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/">Home</a></li>
	<li id="menu-item-293"><a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/">Contact us</a></li>
	<li id="menu-item-294"><a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/our-work/">Our Work</a></li>
	<li id="menu-item-295"><a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/the-art-of-architiecture/">The Art of Architiecture</a></li>
	<li id="menu-item-296"><a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/about/">About Us</a></li>
	<li id="menu-item-283"><a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/client-recommendations/">Client Recommendations</a></li>
	<li id="menu-item-276"><a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/">Visit our Website!</a></li>
	<li id="menu-item-279"><a href="http://www.houzz.com/user/gelottehommas">Like us on Houz</a>z<a href="http://www.houzz.com/user/gelottehommas"> </a></li>
</ul>
</li>
	<li>More relevant content about our firm and our team including</li>
	<li>More PROJECT PICTURES! - that's right. We are giving you what you want which is more tips, inside scoops, design ideas and inspiration with more focus on our own projects.  From Underway projects, to completed homes we are bringing you all things Gelotte Hommas.</li>
</ul>
[caption id="attachment_603" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="One of our current underway projects"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/underway/Touch_of_Normandy.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-603" title="A Touch of Normandy" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/cover-rendering.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="350" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;

Easier ways for you to get your questions answered! We have added some back end stuff (technical mumbo-jumbo) that will allow us to keep you in the center of our focus.

We are really excited about 2012 and intend on keeping you informed and inspired throughout the year. Stay tuned!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Inspiration Infusion</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/02/07/inspiration-infusion/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 07 Feb 2012 18:46:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=606</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Do you love to be inspired? Of course you do! We all do from time to time, especially when it comes to designing our home.  We encourage our clients to take a look around in; magazines, interior design books,  and online for inspiration then either tear/print out the page and keep them all in once easy place. (A folder works really well for this.) Whether it's a picture or a vase, a wall color, a certain type of  stone, or an entire home - rip it out and bring it in!

[caption id="attachment_608" align="aligncenter" width="227" caption="&quot;Casa Del Sol&quot; featured in Seattle Homes &amp; Lifestyles"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Casa_Del_Sol.html"><img class="size-medium wp-image-608" title="Casa Del Sol" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/shlpage-6.jpg?w=227" alt="" width="227" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_610" align="aligncenter" width="237" caption="Storybook Cottage featured in Pacific Northwest Magazine."]<a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/1404184/list/A-storybook-cottage-by-Gelotte-Hommas-Architecture"><img class="size-medium wp-image-610" title="Storybook Cottage" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/pacific-nw-storybook-ending-article_page_5.jpg?w=237" alt="" width="237" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

A really great online option for quick infusions of inspiration is <a href="http://www.houzz.com">Houzz.com </a>, and they even have a app (there's an app for that)  for all you smart phone-ies out there.

[caption id="attachment_611" align="aligncenter" width="497" caption="GHA&#039;s profile on Houzz"]<a href="http://www.houzz.com/pro/gelottehommas/gelotte-hommas-architecture"><img class="size-full wp-image-611" title="profile" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/profile.jpg" alt="" width="497" height="411" /></a>[/caption]

We have a few of our projects on Houzz and are uploading new "Ideabooks" everyday.
Here is a link to check out a few, or you can just click on the link in our top navigation bar!

<a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/users/gelottehommas">http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/users/gelottehommas
</a>Head on over to our profile and "follow" us to stay up to date and in the know. Happy inspiring!
<a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/users/gelottehommas">
</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The cardboard cottage</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/02/09/the-cardboard-cottage/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 09 Feb 2012 22:49:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=614</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We've said it before, we'll say it again - we just love our community and getting involved. That in mind, when <a href="http://www.tbcs.org/">The Bear Creek School </a>approached us for a procurement item for their annual auction, needless to say we were thrilled! Almost as soon as we decided to accept we started to consider what we could offer up for the auction block. We tossed a few ideas around; an office tour, a custom rendering, pony rides for the kiddos, but nothing really had that pizzaz we were looking for.  Finally we landed on auction gold (or at least we think so.)

[caption id="attachment_615" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="the Cardboard Cottage"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/cottage_gha.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-615 " title="A cardboard cottage" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/cottage_gha.png" alt="cardboard cottage designed by Gelotte Hommas Architecture" width="560" height="565" /></a>[/caption]

Say hello to the GHA  cardboard cottage! Once we came up with the idea <a href="http://about.me/eric.drivdahl">Eric Drivdahl </a>went to work designing this just over 20 sq. ft adorable cottage. Features; two rooms, a doggie dog, a mail slot, window-sill, slanted roof and tons of windows. Plus the whole thing is designed with a slide and lock feature so it's super easy to take apart and put back together (bonus!).

Check out these picts of us putting it together in the GHA back room/kitchen.

[caption id="attachment_617" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="From the front showing the mail slot and the front door. Check out that window-sill off to the right!"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/img_1488.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-617 " title="cardboard cottage 1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/img_1488.jpg?w=300" alt="cardboard cottage designed by Gelotte Hommas Architecture" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_624" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="From the right. Look at the cute sloped roof!"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/img_1495.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-624 " title="cardboard cottage 2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/img_1495.jpg?w=300" alt="cardboard cottage designed by Gelotte Hommas Architecture" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_623" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="From inside the cottage. See - two rooms!"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/img_1494.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-623" title="IMG_1494" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/img_1494.jpg?w=300" alt="cardboard cottage designed by Gelotte Hommas Architecture" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_620" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Looking through the front door towards the back - check out that window-sill action"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/img_1491.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-620" title="IMG_1491" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/img_1491.jpg?w=300" alt="cardboard cottage designed by Gelotte Hommas Architecture" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_625" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Without the full roof so you can see the inside better."]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/img_1496.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-625" title="IMG_1496" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/img_1496.jpg?w=300" alt="cardboard cottage designed by Gelotte Hommas Architecture" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Head on over to The Bear Creek School auction on March 24th and make a bid on the cardboard cottage. If you win, we would LOVE it if you sent us picts of your little one playing in it!
*If you would like a cardboard cottage or more info on ours please contact <a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/Contact.html">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a>*
<p style="text-align:center;"></p>]]></content:encoded>
