	<item>
		<title>Top ten most romantic homes of 2012 (and one from 2011 too)</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/02/10/top-ten-most-romantic-homes-of-2012-and-one-from-2011-too/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 10 Feb 2012 22:01:12 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=630</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align:left;">There is 3 more days until Valentines day (one if you are only counting business days). *gulp* Are you all set to swoon the love of <em>your</em> life on Tuesday? If not - good luck to you. Well, we can't exactly help you out in the gift department, but in the meantime we sure can get you in the mood for romance. Here are the top ten most romantic homes of 2012 <em>courtesy of <a href="http://www.toptenrealestatedeals.com/homes/featured/2011/the-top-ten-most-romantic-homes/">Toptenrealestatedeals.com</a></em>
</p>


[caption id="attachment_632" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="# 1 - Coco Chanel Estate"]<a href="http://www.toptenrealestatedeals.com/homes/featured/2012/the-top-ten-most-romantic-homes/1/"><img class="size-medium wp-image-632" title="most_romanitc_home_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/most_romanitc_home_1.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="200" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_633" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="#2 Katharine Hepburn Home"]<a href="http://www.toptenrealestatedeals.com/homes/featured/2012/the-top-ten-most-romantic-homes/2/"><img class="size-medium wp-image-633" title="most_romanitc_home_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/most_romanitc_home_2.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="200" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_634" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="#3 Elegant Provencal Farmhouse"]<a href="http://www.toptenrealestatedeals.com/homes/featured/2012/the-top-ten-most-romantic-homes/3/"><img class="size-medium wp-image-634" title="most_romanitc_home_3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/most_romanitc_home_3.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="200" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_635" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="#4 Cedar Grove"]<a href="http://www.toptenrealestatedeals.com/homes/featured/2012/the-top-ten-most-romantic-homes/4/"><img class="size-medium wp-image-635" title="most_romanitc_home_4" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/most_romanitc_home_4.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="200" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_636" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="#5 Romantic Maison De Pierre"]<a href="http://www.toptenrealestatedeals.com/homes/featured/2012/the-top-ten-most-romantic-homes/5/"><img class="size-medium wp-image-636" title="most_romanitc_home_5" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/most_romanitc_home_5.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="200" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_637" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="#6 Fabulous Aspen Estate!"]<a href="http://www.toptenrealestatedeals.com/homes/featured/2012/the-top-ten-most-romantic-homes/6/"><img class="size-medium wp-image-637" title="most_romanitc_home_6" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/most_romanitc_home_6.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="200" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;

[caption id="attachment_638" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="#7 Amazing San Francisco &amp; Golden Gate Bridge Views!"]<a href="http://www.toptenrealestatedeals.com/homes/featured/2012/the-top-ten-most-romantic-homes/7/"><img class="size-medium wp-image-638" title="most_romanitc_home_7" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/most_romanitc_home_7.jpg?w=300" alt="most romantic homes of 2012" width="300" height="200" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_639" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="#8 Story New York Townhouse!"]<a href="http://www.toptenrealestatedeals.com/homes/featured/2012/the-top-ten-most-romantic-homes/8/"><img class="size-medium wp-image-639" title="most_romanitc_home_8" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/most_romanitc_home_8.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="200" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_640" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="#9 “Stranded” On Your Own Private Island!"]<a href="http://www.toptenrealestatedeals.com/homes/featured/2012/the-top-ten-most-romantic-homes/9/"><img class="size-medium wp-image-640" title="most_romanitc_home_9" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/most_romanitc_home_9.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="200" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_631" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="#10 Tammy Wynette-George Jones Estate"]<a href="http://www.toptenrealestatedeals.com/homes/featured/2012/the-top-ten-most-romantic-homes/10/"><img class="size-medium wp-image-631" title="most_romanitc_home_10" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/most_romanitc_home_10.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="200" /></a>[/caption]

Now don't you feel all mushy and romantic? We thought so.  Last year our very own project in Mercer Island was #3 on the top ten most romantic homes. Check it out!

[caption id="attachment_641" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="#3 A Modern Day Fairy Tale"]<a href="http://www.toptenrealestatedeals.com/homes/featured/2011/the-top-ten-most-romantic-homes/3/"><img class="size-full wp-image-641" title="most_romanitc_home_3_2011" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/most_romanitc_home_3_2011.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="373" /></a>[/caption]

<div>Have a safe and happy valentines day everyone!<em>
*images courtesy of toptenealestatedeals.com*</em></div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Pop-Up card for Valentine&#039;s day</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/02/14/pop-up-card-for-valentines-day/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 14 Feb 2012 19:06:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=650</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Happy Valentines Day everyone! Whether you are celebrating today with as a couple, or not, there is always someone you can show some love to today. We were inspired over here at GHA and got a little crafty.

[caption id="attachment_651" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Happy Valentines Day from GHA"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-008.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-651" title="Valentines card_step_by_step 008" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-008.jpg?w=300" alt="pop-up card for valentines day" width="300" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We designed a pop-up card based on a custom tile mosaic on one of our client's wine rooms. <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/lakeside_lookout.html">(You can view the wine room here)</a>

Get your supplies ready and <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines_day_pop_up_card.pdf">download our custom template here</a>. Ready? let's make a valentines pop-up card!

[caption id="attachment_652" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="What you will need: card stock for the template and the card, glue stick, exacto knife, cutting mat, cute red envelope to put your finished valentine in, and chocolate (for energy whilst crafting of course!)"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-001.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-652" title="Valentines card_step_by_step 001" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-001.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_653" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Step 1: cut out all the sections marked &quot;CUT OUT&quot;. *Careful not to cut the red outline*"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-002.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-653" title="Valentines card_step_by_step 002" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-002.jpg?w=300" alt="pop-up card for valentines day" width="300" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_654" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="All cut out and ready for step 2"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-003.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-654" title="Valentines card_step_by_step 003" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-003.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_655" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Fold along the &quot;FOLD HERE&quot; lines"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-004.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-655" title="Valentines card_step_by_step 004" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-004.jpg?w=300" alt="valentines day pop-up card" width="300" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_656" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Fold down the center of the design in half"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-005.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-656" title="Valentines card_step_by_step 005" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-005.jpg?w=300" alt="valentines day pop-up card" width="300" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_657" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Fold the pink heart in half as well *careful not to rip the attached portions on the top and bottom*"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-006.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-657" title="Valentines card_step_by_step 006" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-006.jpg?w=300" alt="valentines day pop-up card" width="300" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_658" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Put some glue on&quot;GLUE TO CARD&quot; tabs on either side of the design. Align the design with the inner fold of your card and push down gently. Close the card over the pop-up design and press down firmly."]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-007.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-658" title="Valentines card_step_by_step 007" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-007.jpg?w=300" alt="valentines day pop-up card" width="300" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_651" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Voilà! You have made yourself a pop-up card! (I knew you could do it) :)"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-008.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-651" title="Valentines card_step_by_step 008" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-008.jpg?w=300" alt="pop-up card for valentines day" width="300" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Once you're done post your pictures of your finished pop-up card in the comments section. We would love to see them!
Have a safe and happy Valentine's day everyone.

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/02/14/pop-up-card-for-valentines-day/valentines-card_step_by_step-008/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 14 Feb 2012 18:48:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-008.jpg</guid>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Voilà! You have made yourself a pop-up card! (I knew you could do it) :)]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>651</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2012-02-14 18:48:02</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2012-02-14 18:48:02</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>valentines-card_step_by_step-008</wp:post_name>

		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:attachment_url>https://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-008.jpg</wp:attachment_url>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_wp_attached_file</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/723/30761957/files/2012/02/valentines-card_step_by_step-008.jpg]]></wp:meta_value>

		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/02/14/pop-up-card-for-valentines-day/valentines-card_step_by_step-007/</link>

	<item>
		<title>Teaching a new house old tricks</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/02/17/teaching-a-new-house-old-tricks/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Feb 2012 23:13:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=664</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One of our top ten most designed home styles is by far the Bungalow, although we have definitely seen a reduction of this particular style over the last few years in the Seattle area. Our bungalow designs have been featured in magazines across the country as well as books (<a href="http://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/creating-a-new-old-house-russell-versaci/1103129992">Creating an Old New House</a>). Styles come and go, and so was the fate of the Northwest Bungalow, or so we thought. Recently we have see a spike in this style again! From keyword searches, to Pinterest, Houzz ideabooks and of course our blog. People want to see more - do you blame them?

[caption id="attachment_665" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Medina Bungalow"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Medina_bungalow.html"><img class="size-medium wp-image-665" title="Medina Bungalow" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/large_12.png?w=300" alt="The Medina Bungalow" width="300" height="232" /></a>[/caption]

When you think of "Bungalow" generally you think of California Bungalow, but there a a number of different renditions including the Northwest Bungalow, however all bungalows have a few key identifying features:

[caption id="attachment_667" align="aligncenter" width="490" caption="Look at all the wood detailing - down to the refrigerator door(From Bungalow on the Beach)"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/bungalow_on_the_beach.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-667" title="large_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/large_21.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]
<ul>
	<li>Low, sloping roof either gabled (front or side) or hipped, often with wide overhangs</li>
	<li>Exposed roof structure throughout the home (beams, rafters)</li>
	<li>Exterior proportions balanced rather than symmetrical in arrangement</li>
	<li>Modest front porch</li>
	<li>Front stoop</li>
	<li>Focus on a garden, even if small</li>
	<li>Open, informal floor plan</li>
	<li>Prominent hearth</li>
	<li>Interior wood details</li>
	<li>Stained glass

[caption id="attachment_669" align="aligncenter" width="490" caption="Wood detailing and stained glass incorporated into the ceiling"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Kirkland_Bungalow.html#"><img class="size-full wp-image-669" title="large_8" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/large_8.png" alt="The Kirkland Bungalow" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]</li>
</ul>
We have a few more of our bungalow projects posted in a new idea book on Houzz called <a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/1493344/thumbs/Classic-arts-and-crafts-style-architecture">"Classic arts and crafts style architecture"</a>. Take a look to get your creativity flowing! Happy Friday!

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[View from the Lake Washington of Waterfront Reflections]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>674</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2012-02-21 19:38:09</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2012-02-21 19:38:09</wp:post_date_gmt>

	<item>
		<title>Northwest living: Waterfront Reflections</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/02/21/northwest-living-waterfront-reflections/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Feb 2012 20:02:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=672</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We have some pretty amazing projects underway, but <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/underway/Waterfront_Reflections.html"><strong><em>Waterfront Reflections</em></strong></a> is unique for a few reasons.

[caption id="attachment_675" align="aligncenter" width="490" caption="Waterfront Reflections"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/large_5.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-675 " title="large_5" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/large_5.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]

'Northwest living' can truly range from deep in the woods of Tumblecreek to a bluff in the San Juan's overlooking the Puget Sound, and everything in between. GHA homes are designed from elegance and embrace the gorgeous Northwest scenery and Waterfront<em> Reflections</em><em></em> is stunning example of this. At 8338 square feet this  custom Northwest Contemporary style home is tucked into the shores of Lake Washington.

[caption id="attachment_673" align="aligncenter" width="490" caption="Aerial view of Waterfront Reflections"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/large_22.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-673" title="large_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/large_22.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]

Although it is designed for a family with small children, this home is boasts brawn and beauty. Our client's love the natural beauty of the lake and wanted to incorporate as much of the "lake lifestyle" as they could into the design, so we went to work. Walls of huge glass windows and a beautiful outdoor living space allow our clients to enjoy the lakefront year round.

[caption id="attachment_674" align="aligncenter" width="490" caption="View from the Lake Washington of Waterfront Reflections"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/large_3.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-674" title="large_3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/large_3.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]

Inside the light filled great room is the center of the home with everything radiating out around the massive stone fireplace. Northwest family living on the shores of Lake Washington is truly "Northwest Living."

Contact Gelotte Hommas today to set up a consultation!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Break ground on an outdoor living space: Moroccan Monday</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/02/27/break-ground-on-an-outdoor-living-space-moroccan-monday/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 27 Feb 2012 22:59:31 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=678</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[caption id="attachment_680" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="A moroccan renovation added square feet to this clients outdoor living area"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/rendering.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-680" title="rendering" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/rendering.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="697" /></a>[/caption]

Are you are considering a renovation or remodel of your outdoor living space this Spring? About a year ago one of our clients had just finished up design and was getting ready to break ground on a total remodel to their outdoor living area. A few questions to keep in mind are:

[caption id="attachment_681" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Consider your desired total square feet (both covered and uncovered)"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/5.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-681" title="5" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/5.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a>[/caption]
<ol>
	<li><strong>How many square feet are you looking to add?</strong>
Have a good idea of what your end goal is important, and don't let the fact that we live in the Pacific Northwest hold you back either. From canopy's to <a href="http://www.nanawall.com/Gallery2/Projectphoto.aspx?id=8231">NanaWalls</a> - there are plenty of ways to enjoy the outdoors <strong>and</strong> stay dry.

[caption id="attachment_682" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Will there be a fire pit or a fireplace?"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/1.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-682" title="1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/1.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="373" /></a>[/caption]</li>
	<li> <strong>Does your dream outdoor space have a <a href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/520118/2012-Trends--Outdoor-living-spaces-get-the-spotlight--landscape-seattle">fire pit</a>, a fireplace, or none of the</strong> above?
Take some time to do some homework and decide if you would like a fire pit or a fireplace. You could have both, although you would need more square footage

[caption id="attachment_684" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="To pillar or not to pillar"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/3.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-684" title="3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/3.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>
</strong></li>
	<li><strong>Are you looking to create a more drama in your outdoor living area?
</strong>Pillars and half walls are a great way to divide your space and keep it open and airy. Plus it adds some major drama and elegance *BONUS*

[caption id="attachment_685" align="aligncenter" width="540" caption="What&#039;s under your feet?"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/4.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-685" title="4" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/4.jpg" alt="" width="540" height="720" /></a>[/caption]</li>
	<li><strong>What is the ground made of?
</strong>Whether your preference is tile, <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Cabin_on_Lake_Wenatchee.html">concrete </a>or <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Northwest_Outlook.html">limestone </a>there are perks and drawbacks to them all. <strong> </strong>Doing a little bit of research here would be beneficial and fun!</li>
</ol>
Regardless of what your dreams are for your outdoor living space, give <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/Contact.html">GHA a call </a>and we can help you figure out how to bring those dreams to life!
This featured project is way beyond completion, but<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/06/05/see-the-final-touches-on-one-of-gelotte-hommass-projects/"> click here</a> if you would like to watch a time laps film of when the construction was wrapping up.
*photos courtesy of <a href="https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.10150178140663937.297890.55899628936&amp;type=3">Faith Sheridan Interior Design</a>*

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Managed office space is the new black</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/02/29/managed-office-space-is-the-new-black/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 29 Feb 2012 18:19:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=689</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[According to an article in the <a href="http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/ezra-klein/post/last-quarters-gdp-numbers-were-better-than-we-thought/2012/02/29/gIQAzoNEiR_blog.html">Washington Post</a> today the economy is on the rebound (woo-hoo). Unemployment is down and disposable income is up meaning that we are going to start to see some things start to shift.  :)
During the downturn there was a large number of people who were laid off, which finally gave them the push they needed to <strong>start their own businesses</strong>! From graphic designers to event planners;  <strong><em>2010 brought the highest percentage of start-ups in more than a decade </em></strong><a href="http://www.portfolio.com/views/blogs/resources/2011/05/20/number-of-small-businesses-rose-since-recession/">(according to portfolio.com)</a>, and now that the economy is starting to turn those businesses are going to grow. Where will they go you might ask? <em>Great question</em>.

Moving out of your home office into uncharted territory is SO exciting, but there are some major draw backs that you probably don't know about. Most corporate office centers have rigid terms and what you are leasing is totally empty. That means you provide the furniture. I don't know about you, but the last time I priced out office furniture I had a bit of sticker shock. Wowza. Plus, once you do buy the furniture it takes up to 6 weeks to get it sometimes. 6 weeks! There is a better option and it's called <em><strong>Managed Office Space.
</strong></em>

[caption id="attachment_690" align="aligncenter" width="336" caption="Our managed office space offers a gorgeous conference room available to you any time you need it"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/large_conference_room.jpg"><img class=" wp-image-690 " title="large_conference_room" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/large_conference_room.jpg" alt="" width="336" height="504" /></a>[/caption]

<em><strong> </strong></em>A managed office space offer the ultimate in flexibility and convenience. When you lease space in a managed office building there are definite perks; the furniture is included (INCLUDED!),  utilities, common area to use, restroom facilities that are clean and always stalked (bonus), gorgeous professional conference rooms for you to use (we make YOU look good), and most are ready in just over 24 hours. Whoa! What a difference!

[caption id="attachment_691" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Managed office space available in Bellevue, WA"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/lease_ad_small-01.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-691" title="lease_ad_small-01" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/02/lease_ad_small-01.jpg" alt="Managed office space in Bellevue" width="560" height="336" /></a>[/caption]

Most people don't know that leasing space in a managed office building is an option, and I am hear to say it is not only an option but a win-win business plan! Some businesses offer specials and promotions depending on what your needs are. So, if you are one of the thousands of start-ups that has out grown your home office take a peek at leasing space in a managed office space and get your business off the ground!
<a title="Contact us" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/">Contact Gelotte Hommas </a>for more information about our  managed office space.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Sage in your ketchup? What custom residential architecture looks like</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/03/02/sage-in-your-ketchup-what-custom-residential-architecture-looks-like/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 02 Mar 2012 19:57:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=700</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[What IS architecture? Have you ever asked this question? Most people have at one point or another considered what it would be like to design and build their own custom home. What stops them is that surprisingly there are quite a few misconceptions about custom residential architecture floating around out there.  Today we thought we would end off the week by tackling a few of them.

[caption id="attachment_702" align="aligncenter" width="377" caption="Scott Hommas explains custom residential architecture"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/sage_ketchup-011.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-702" title="Sage in your ketchup" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/sage_ketchup-011.jpg" alt="" width="377" height="296" /></a>[/caption]

<strong><em>Custom Architecture is expensive and only for the rich and famous.
</em></strong><em></em>Five years ago this statement was true for about 80% of our clientele, now that number is quiet a bit lower. I'm convinced that one of the main reasons more people aren't going down the road of hiring an architect is simply that they don't know they can!  Designing and building homes on affordable budgets is not as elusive as you think. What most people don't know is that custom architecture and designing the home you have always dreamed of is extremely affordable. You still don't believe me? I want to flip your perspective. From renovating your current home, to buying a lot and starting from scratch your budget is made up by YOU! That's right, you. If you want 50 thousand square feet and marble everything we can do that, but if you are wanting something a little more modest we can absolutely do that too.

<strong><em>The tract developers"custom" myth</em></strong>
Everyone has seen one of these developments, has a friend, and or lives in one themselves. They seem to be everywhere now-a-days. Don't get me wrong, these are great home builders who produce quality homes, but they are not as "custom" as they claim to be.
For those of you who don't know - when you buy a custom home from one of these builders you are presented with options every step along the way from carpet to wall color. Some options are standard, and some are called "upgrades" costing a little bit more money and adding onto the cost of the home. For example, you can either get the standard brown tile in the kitchen or you can upgrade to marble tile for a little bit more money. This method of building a home can be a great option. It gives the home owner a sense of customization and bit more pride in the home they are purchasing. What if though (let's say) you wanted to add a skylight in your master bathroom, or add pillars in your kitchen. That is not possible and would not happen because it is outside the scope of what "customizations" are allowed.

Scott Hommas, one of our principals here at GHA, explains it like this; Burger King offers you a burger and you can have it YOUR WAY right? You can add cheese, or bacon, no bun, whatever. It's your burger, have it your way. What if though you wanted the cook to add sage in your ketchup? (I know, sage in ketchup sounds weird but go with it) There would be no way for you to add sage in your ketchup at Burger King because they do not have the means to provide that. If, however, you had a custom chef preparing your meal you could most certainly have sage in your ketchup and literally whatever else you wanted. So, you see. Custom isn't truly custom unless you can get what you want at the price you can afford.

Gelotte Hommas is a custom architecture firm and we could talk architecture all day long! (in fact, we kind-of  do). Whether you are thinking about updating your outdoor living space for Spring, or building a cabin in Tumblecreek we would love to walk you through that process. As with most architects we offer free consultations, so there is literally no pressure what so ever to come and talk about what your thinking. We would love to meet you! Getting some feedback on what your thinking will give you piece of mind, and that you can't put a price-tag on.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>large_7</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/03/09/be-my-littlehouse-onthe-prairi/large_7-4/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 09 Mar 2012 19:04:54 +0000</pubDate>

		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[wood detailing and open floor plans are a big part of prairie style]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>722</wp:post_id>

	<item>
		<title>(Be my) little house on the prairie</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/03/09/be-my-littlehouse-onthe-prairi/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 09 Mar 2012 19:28:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=718</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Since "Prairie Style Architecture" is really popular right now (we've got the blog and website stats prove it), we thought we would give you something to oogle at.
May I introduce you to three projects:

[caption id="attachment_720" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="<strong>Open Prairie</strong>"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Open_Pairie.html"><img class="size-medium wp-image-720" title="large_8" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/large_8.png?w=300" alt="prairie house style" width="300" height="232" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_723" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="<strong>Boxstar Ranch</strong>"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Boxstar_Ranch.html"><img class="size-medium wp-image-723" title="large_9" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/large_9.png?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="232" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_725" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="<strong>Wood, Stone, Water</strong>"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Wood_Stone_Water.html"><img class="size-medium wp-image-725" title="large_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/large_11.png?w=300" alt="contemporary prairie style home" width="300" height="232" /></a>[/caption]
<h2 style="text-align:center;">Open Prairie</h2>
<p style="text-align:center;">is a 3,300 square feet home in Kirkland. Here are some specs:</p>


[caption id="attachment_719" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Gorgeous door with stained glass detailing in &quot;Open Prairie&quot;"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Open_Pairie.html"><img class="size-medium wp-image-719" title="large_7" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/large_7.png?w=300" alt="glass detailing in door on prairie style house" width="300" height="232" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">• Prairie-style with broad, sheltering overhangs</p>
<p style="text-align:center;">• Main level also accessible from an elevator in the garage</p>
<p style="text-align:center;">• Open floor plan maximizes light and views from all spaces</p>


[caption id="attachment_721" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Look at the sky light detailing!"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Open_Pairie.html"><img class="size-medium wp-image-721" title="large_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/large_2.png?w=300" alt="prairie style house in Kirkland" width="300" height="232" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">• Built-in banquette for casual dining</p>
<p style="text-align:center;">• Covered outdoor barbecue off kitchen</p>

<h1 style="text-align:center;"><strong>Boxstar Ranch
</strong></h1>
<p style="text-align:center;">a 6,400 square feet refined rustic rambler</p>


[caption id="attachment_722" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="wood detailing and open floor plans are a big part of prairie style"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Boxstar_Ranch.html"><img class="size-medium wp-image-722" title="large_7" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/large_71.png?w=300" alt="prairie style house" width="300" height="232" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">
• Master suite is a separate pavilion connected by a glass enclosed “breezeway”</p>


[caption id="attachment_724" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="This wall made up of windows spans the length of the house"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Boxstar_Ranch.html"><img class="size-medium wp-image-724" title="large_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/large_1.png?w=300" alt="Prairie style home" width="300" height="232" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">
• Great room focuses to the expansive view</p>

<h1 style="text-align:center;">
Wood, Stone, Water</h1>
<p style="text-align:center;">5,600 square feet prairie style home with a contemporary Northwest twist</p>


[caption id="attachment_727" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Contemporary twist on Prairie style architecture"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Wood_Stone_Water.html"><img class="size-medium wp-image-727" title="large_6" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/large_6.png?w=300" alt="contemporary prairie style home" width="300" height="232" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">
• Heavy-timbered soaring roof structure unites the inside and outside</p>
<p style="text-align:center;">• Home was designed to capture the changing light throughout the day</p>


[caption id="attachment_726" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Look at all that amazing wood work!"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Wood_Stone_Water.html"><img class="size-medium wp-image-726" title="large_3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/large_3.png?w=300" alt="contemporary prairie style home" width="300" height="232" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">• Living room features an indoor waterfall and is spanned by a delicate wood bridge

• Custom designed “tea-house” canopy over the master bed</p>

<h3 style="text-align:center;">
What is your favorite part of Prairie Style Architecture? Leave us a comment!</h3>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The best of 425 is back!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/03/12/the-best-of-425-is-back/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 12 Mar 2012 17:57:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=733</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align:center;">The local Magazine <a href="http://www.425magazine.com/">425</a> hosts a competition every year for everyone's local favorites. From your favorite restaurant to your favorite hiking spot, it's your time to give them all a gold star! Last year GHA was so honored to win "Best Architect" in 425 Magazine.

</p>
<p style="text-align:center;"><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/best_of_425.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-739" title="best_of_425" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/best_of_425.png" alt="" width="115" height="146" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align:center;">We shared the stage with some pretty amazing local favorites as well;</p>


[caption id="attachment_737" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="(Best Interior Designer)"]<a href="http://www.craigwilliamsinteriors.com/"><img class="size-medium wp-image-737" title="Screen shot 2012-03-12 at 9.56.37 AM" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/screen-shot-2012-03-12-at-9-56-37-am-e1331574178184.png?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="105" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_736" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="(Best Art Gallery)"]<a href="http://www.hallwaygallery.com/"><img class="size-medium wp-image-736" title="header01" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/header01.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="51" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_735" align="aligncenter" width="180" caption="(Best Builder)"]<a href="http://hamishanderson.com/"><img class="size-full wp-image-735" title="276503_190818377651259_4852255_n" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/276503_190818377651259_4852255_n.jpg" alt="" width="180" height="139" /></a>[/caption]

We would LOVE to win again, and here's how you can help. Go to <a href="http://bestof425.com/">http://bestof425.com/</a> and select the Home and Garden picture then fill in Gelotte Hommas in the architecture slot. It's that easy! If you don't already have a favorite local art gallery, interior designer, or builder we know some pretty AMAZING ones listed above. Cheers and happy voting!

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>arc.i.tek is almost here!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/03/14/arc-i-tek-is-almost-here/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 14 Mar 2012 23:08:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=741</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[caption id="attachment_742" align="aligncenter" width="400" caption="Get ready for the youth event of the Summer!"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/march_ad_1.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-742" title="march_ad_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/march_ad_1.png" alt="Arc.I.Tek" width="400" height="573" /></a>[/caption]

We have hinted to you about a youth program we have been developing for the past few months. In partnership with; The Seattle Architecture Foundation, The Seattle Center and The Next Fifty we have architect-ed (get it) a fantastic summer youth program, so<em><strong> get ready</strong></em> because it starts NEXT MONTH!
Arc.I.Tek is a series of model making workshops for kids  ages 7-18 where the kids will be looking to the past 50 years of design in Seattle an applying that towards designing what they think the next fifty years will look like. Each model will be put into a design competition between the kids with the grand prize being an internship at Miller Hull Architects in Seattle. How cool is THAT?!
<p style="text-align:center;"><em><span style="color:#ff9900;">The First model making workshop is</span> </em><strong><span style="color:#0000ff;">APRIL 21ST AT THE SEATTLE CENTER.</span>
<em><span style="color:#ff9900;">Tickets to the workshops are<span style="color:#0000ff;"> $20</span></span>
<span style="color:#ff9900;">Ticket's will be available through <span style="color:#0000ff;">BrownPaperTickets.com</span> </span>
*tickets are not available yet. We will let you know as soon as they are available to purchase*

</em></strong>We are so excited for this event that will run all summer long through October.
<em>Please contact<span style="color:#ff9900;"><a href="http://gelottehommas.com/Contact.html"><span style="color:#ff9900;"> Gelotte Hommas Architecture</span></a></span> or <span style="color:#ff9900;"><a href="http://seattlearchitecture.org/"><span style="color:#ff9900;">The Seattle Architecture Foundation</span></a></span> for more information </em></p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>741</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2012-03-14 23:08:28</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2012-03-14 23:08:28</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>arc-i-tek-is-almost-here</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>

		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>

	<item>
		<title>Gelotte Hommas Architecture of Seattle, WA Receives  Houzz’s 2012 ‘Best Of Remodeling’ Award</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/03/19/gelotte-hommas-architecture-of-seattle-wa-receives-houzzs-2012-best-of-remodeling-award/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 19 Mar 2012 22:47:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=748</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p align="center"><strong>Gelotte Hommas Architecture of Seattle, WA Receives </strong></p>
<p align="center"><strong>Houzz’s 2012 ‘Best Of Remodeling’ Award</strong><strong> </strong></p>
<p align="center"><!-- Houzz BEGIN --></p>


[caption id="attachment_749" align="aligncenter" width="490" caption="Houzz: Best of Remodeling 2012 - Seattle Pools"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/large_72.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-749" title="large_7" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/large_72.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>[/caption]
<p align="center">
<!-- Houzz END--></p>
<p align="center"><strong><em>First-Ever Survey &amp; Analysis of More than 1.2 Million Members Reveals Top-Rated Professionals and Current Design Trends from Across the Country</em></strong></p>
<strong>Seattle, WA</strong>  --  March 19, 2012 – Gelotte Hommas Architecture of  Seattle, Washington has been awarded  “Best Of Remodeling” 2012 by Houzz, the leading online platform for residential remodeling and design.  The award winning custom residential design firm was chosen by the more than 1.2 million registered members of the Houzz community.

The Houzz “Best Of Remodeling” award for 2012 is given in two categories: <em>Customer Satisfaction</em> and <em>Design</em>. <em>Customer Satisfaction</em> award winners are based on homeowner members who rated their experience working with remodeling professionals in 12 categories ranging from <a href="http://www.houzz.com/professionals/architect">architects</a>, and <a href="http://www.houzz.com/professionals/interior-designer">interior designers</a> to <a href="http://www.houzz.com/professionals/general-contractor">contractors</a> and other residential <a href="http://www.houzz.com/professionals">remodeling professionals</a>.  <em>Design</em> award winners’ work was the most popular among the 1.2 million members, also known as “Houzzers,” who saved more than 16.5 million professional images to their personal ideabooks via the <a href="http://www.houzz.com/">Houzz site</a> and <a href="http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/houzz-interior-design-ideas/id399563465?mt=8">iPad/iPhone app</a>.<strong> </strong>

<strong>“Thank you for choosing GHA to be a part of the ‘Best of Remodeling 2012’ chosen by the Houzz community. Houzz is a wonderful tool for home owners and professionals alike infused with inspiration and creativity. We are truly honored.” – Gelotte Hommas Architecture</strong>

“With 3.5 million monthly unique users and 80 million monthly page views, Houzz has rapidly become the largest community of active remodelers, providing homeowners and design enthusiasts with first-hand advice from Houzzers who have been through the renovating and decorating process,” said Liza Hausman, vice president of marketing for Houzz. “This is a real stamp of approval for <strong>Gelotte Hommas Architecture </strong>from the Houzz community and we’re thrilled to welcome them to this elite group of ‘Best Of’ winners.”

With Houzz, homeowners can identify not only the top-rated professionals like<strong> Gelotte Hommas Architecture,</strong> but also those whose work visually aligns with their own design goals. Homeowners can also evaluate professionals by contacting them directly on the Houzz platform, asking questions about their work and evaluating their responses to questions from others in the Houzz community.

<strong>About Houzz</strong>

Houzz (<a href="http://www.houzz.com/">www.houzz.com</a>) is the leading online platform for home remodeling, providing inspiration, information, advice and support for homeowners and home improvement professionals through its website and mobile applications. Houzz features the largest residential design database in the world, articles written by design experts, product recommendations, a vibrant community powered by social tools, and information on more than 1.2 million remodeling and design professionals worldwide who can help turn ideas into reality. @houzz_inc

Our work won in the "Design" category, as our portfolio includes some of the most popular images on Houzz.
You can see our award-winning work in these "Best of" ideabooks:
<a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/1714792/thumbs">http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/1714792/thumbs
</a><a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/1714888/thumbs/Houzz--Best-of-Remodeling-2012---Seattle-Media-Rooms">http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/1714888/thumbs/Houzz--Best-of-Remodeling-2012---Seattle-Media-Rooms</a><a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/1714792/thumbs">
</a>

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>A GHA home is going to be featured in Luxe Magazine next month!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/03/21/a-gha-home-is-going-to-be-featured-in-luxe-magazine-next-month/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 21 Mar 2012 22:59:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=767</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We just found out today that one of our projects Classic on the Green is being featured in Luxe Magazine next month!

[caption id="attachment_770" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Classic on the green<br />Exterior"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/ext3.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-770" title="Ext3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/ext3.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="441" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_771" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Classic on the green <br />Expansive Kitchen"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/kit2.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-771" title="Kit2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/kit2.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="438" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_768" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Classic on the green <br />Master Bathroom"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/bath.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-768" title="Bath" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/bath.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="437" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_769" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Classic on the green <br />Interior stairwell"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/entry2.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-769" title="Entry2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/entry2.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="714" /></a>[/caption]

The article is on <a href="http://www.henseldesignstudios.com/about/bio.php">Steven Hensel</a>, the interior Designer. We are stoked this project will be getting a highlight. Congratulations Steven Hensel!
Find this issue of Luxe Magazine on newsstands next month!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Happy Birthday to us!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/04/02/happy-birthday-to-us/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 02 Apr 2012 17:00:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=775</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[caption id="attachment_776" align="aligncenter" width="341" caption="<strong>Happy 29th Birthday to GHA!</strong>"]<strong><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/birthday_hat.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-776" title="birthday_hat" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/birthday_hat.jpg" alt="" width="341" height="548" /></a></strong>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">Ok, so TODAY is not actually the birthday for the firm. The actual birthday is April 1st. No Foolin!
The Principal architect Curtis Gelotte  founded Curtis Gelotte Architects 29 years ago on April Fool's day. Upon meeting Curtis you would know he is wonderfully witty and loves a good laugh, thus the decision to open his doors in 1983 on the national holiday for laughter makes perfect sense.</p>


[caption id="attachment_777" align="aligncenter" width="289" caption="<strong>Curtis Gelotte</strong>"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/12.jpg"><img class=" wp-image-777 " title="12" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/12.jpg" alt="" width="289" height="282" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">After graduating Montana State University with a Bachelor of Architecture in 1986, Scott Hommas started his career as an intern for Curtis Gelotte Architects. He then spent a few years exploring different types of architecture before returning to Curtis Gelotte in 1996. In 2007 Curtis Gelotte and Scott Hommas united and Gelotte Hommas Architects was born.
<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/curt_scott_birthday.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-779" title="curt_scott_birthday" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/curt_scott_birthday.png" alt="" width="560" height="121" /></a></p>


[caption id="attachment_780" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Curtis Gelotte &amp; Scott Hommas"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/20-ll.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-780" title="20-ll" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/20-ll.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="300" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">Happy Birthday to GHA. Next year we are going to celebrate 30 years as a firm with a party. Follow our blog so you can be sure to get all the details.<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/curt_scott_birthday.png">
</a></p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Presenting the 2012 Arc.I.Tek youth program</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/04/02/presenting-the-2012-arc-i-tek-youth-program/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 02 Apr 2012 18:46:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=788</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[caption id="attachment_790" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Come and meet our super hero team called &quot;The Arcitecks&quot;<br /> {click on the above image to view the Arc.I.Tek website}"]<a href="http://seattlearchitect.thenewhive.com/arc-i-tek"><img class="size-full wp-image-790" title="logo_arciteks" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/logo_arciteks1.png" alt="" width="560" height="535" /></a>[/caption]

We have been talking about this for almost a year, and we are so very proud to say it is finally here!
<span style="color:#ff6600;">ARC.I.TEK</span> is a program built for engaging and guiding young Seattle citizens in learning the process of architecture and design, developing their skill sets and assisting them to shape their vision of the future, ultimately empowering them to make a difference in Seattle.

Entrants, ages 7 thru 18 (grades 1-12), will arrive at Seattle Center's Classroom of the Future to attend a 4 hour workshop lead by industry design professionals.  A brief review of the history and legacy of the 1962 Seattle World's Fair and Seattle Center will be covered, followed by a 3 hour design session for Seattle's young citizens to build architectural concept models of their vision of a world's fair in 2062.

<span style="color:#ff6600;"><strong>Workshop Dates:</strong></span>  April 21st, May 19th, June 16th, July 21st, August 18th, and September 15th
<span style="color:#ff6600;"><strong>Where:</strong></span> Seattle Center Classroom of the Future
<span style="color:#ff6600;"><strong>Cost:</strong> </span>$20 per entry, scholarships for attendance available upon request

An expression, webpage developed through the new hive [thenewhive.com], will be created for each entry by the ARC.I.TEK Program, which will go live starting September 22nd thru October 13th.  Entrants will be encouraged to share their designs thru the website.  The extent of how much their vision is shared and marketed through the new hive expression will be factored into the judging.
Select models will be on display throughout the Next50 celebration. Judging is based on the captured imagery of the models, the entrant's description of their vision, and entrant's engagement of Social media via the new hive.

<strong><span style="color:#008080;">Entrants are invited to come together to attend the ARC.I.TEK Grand Finale and Awards Ceremony on October 22nd, 2012!</span></strong>

<em>Criteria for Judging: Sustainability, Innovation, Social Media, Aesthetics</em>

<span style="color:#008080;"><strong><em>AWARDS Categories will be defined for the varying age groups|grades:</em></strong></span>
<strong><span style="color:#ff6600;">Novice: Grades 1-4</span></strong>
<strong><span style="color:#ff9900;">Apprentice: Grades 5-8</span></strong>
<strong><span style="color:#ffcc00;">Distinguished: Grades 9-12</span></strong>

<a href="http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/239801"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-791" title="tickets" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/tickets.png" alt="" width="374" height="677" /></a>
<p style="text-align:center;"><strong>Workshops will fill up fast, so make sure you book your tickets now through <a href="http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/239801">brownpapertickets.com</a>.
See you all there!</strong></p>


[caption id="attachment_792" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Sponsored by"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/sponsors.png"><img class="size-medium wp-image-792" title="sponsors" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/sponsors.png?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="164" /></a>[/caption]]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:post_id>792</wp:post_id>

		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_wp_attached_file</wp:meta_key>

	<item>
		<title>We were blogged!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/04/03/we-were-blogged/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 03 Apr 2012 18:35:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=797</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One of our project managers Eric Drivdahl was interviewed by BUILDER BLOG. Check it out!
<div>
<h3><a href="http://builderblog.integritywindows.com/buildchat-seattle-architect-eric-drivdahl-of-gelotte-hommas-architecture" rel="bookmark">BuildChat: Seattle architect Eric Drivdahl of Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a></h3>
<div>March 23rd, 2012 by John Kirchner</div>
</div>
<div>

<a href="http://builderblog.integritywindows.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/Eric_Drivdahl_-_CCC_Bio_PicSM.jpg"><img title="Eric_Drivdahl_-_CCC_Bio_PicSM" src="http://builderblog.integritywindows.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/Eric_Drivdahl_-_CCC_Bio_PicSM-300x300.jpg" alt="" width="210" height="210" /></a>

Excellence in design and energy efficiency has long been the M.O. for architects based in the Pacific Northwest. Year after year, the region produces some of the  most innovative homes which feature sustainable materials and generous use of natural elements.

For that very reason, we sent some questions along to <a href="https://twitter.com/#!/archierictect">Eric Drivdahl</a>, a Seattle-based architect who specializes in custom residential design, historic buildings and religious facilities. Drivdahl is a senior project manager for <a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a>.

<strong>What’s your favorite design trend right now? ...<a href="http://builderblog.integritywindows.com/buildchat-seattle-architect-eric-drivdahl-of-gelotte-hommas-architecture">{read the full article here}</a></strong>

</div>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Meet Lakeville Homes - the main sponsor for Arc.I.Tek</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/04/04/meet-lakeville-homes-the-main-sponsor-for-arc-i-tek/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 04 Apr 2012 23:59:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=799</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Lakeville Homes is the main sponsor for our youth program <a href="http://seattlearchitect.thenewhive.com/arc-i-tek?user=seattlearchitect">Arc.I.Tek</a>.

They are a home a custom home builder and remodeler who is CONSTANTLY winning awards. (all the time, seriously.)
Some of their amazing work:

<img src="http://lakevillehomes.com/wp-content/uploads/Lakeville-Homes_Lake-Sammamish_03.jpg" alt="" />

<img src="http://lakevillehomes.com/wp-content/uploads/lakeville_homes_greenlake-bungalow_pic1.jpg" alt="" />

<img src="http://lakevillehomes.com/wp-content/uploads/lakeville_homes_laurelhurst-kitchen_pic2.jpg" alt="" />
If you get a chance head on over to their blog and check them out!
<a href="http://lakevillehomes.com/coming-soon-arc-i-tek/">http://lakevillehomes.com/coming-soon-arc-i-tek/

	<item>
		<title>Arc.I.Tek launch party re-cap</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/04/06/arc-i-tek-launch-party-re-cap/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 06 Apr 2012 19:27:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=806</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align:center;">Good morning and happy Friday! Last night we had our launch party for Arc.I.Tek and here is a brief re-cap;<strong><span style="color:#ff9900;"> It was</span></strong> <strong><span style="color:#ff9900;">AWESOME!
<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/arc_t_tek_ad.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-810" title="arc_t_tek_ad" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/arc_t_tek_ad.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="724" /></a> </span></strong></p>
<p style="text-align:center;">We would like to say <em><span style="color:#008000;">THANK YOU</span></em> to all of the people who showed up to become volunteers. This is going to be such a great program, but we can't do it without all of our amazing volunteers.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;">We advertised that everyone would be fed, but we didn't talk about the  super cool <span style="color:#ff9900;">Swag Bags</span> with all SORTS of fun stuff in them including:</p>

<ul>
	<li>BRAND spankin' new issue of GRAY Magazine with the full page Arc.I.Tek ad. GRAY Magazine is our Media sponsor. If you have not had a chance to check this new Seattle design magazine, then go oogle at the online version by <span style="color:#ff9900;"><a href="http://issuu.com/graymag/docs/gray_magazine_issue_3/11"><span style="color:#ff9900;">clicking here</span></a></span></li>
	<li>The Next Fifty goodies from car stickers to book's</li>
	<li>A cool Ark.I.Tek t-shirt featuring the ArcItek's</li>
	<li>The Official Arc.I.Tek Poster <span style="color:#ff9900;">{<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/arc_poster_final1_print_qr.pdf"><span style="color:#ff9900;">Download your copy here</span></a>}</span></li>
	<li>Seattle Architecture Foundation goodies and MUCH more</li>
</ul>
Even if you weren't there for last night's kick off event, that's ok! This youth program is an amazing way for your kiddos to get involved with design in Seattle while becoming apart of history. Seattle Center and The Next Fifty kick off the celebratory festivities next month on APRIL 21ST - which is also the first model making workshop. <a href="http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/239801"><span style="color:#ff9900;">{Get your tickets by clicking here}</span></a>
<p style="text-align:center;">Our amazing sponsor's:</p>


[caption id="attachment_792" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Arc.I.Tek sponsors"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/sponsors.png"><img class="size-medium wp-image-792" title="sponsors" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/sponsors.png?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="164" /></a>[/caption]]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>New prize just added for Arc.I.Tek!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/04/09/new-prize-just-added-for-arc-i-tek/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 09 Apr 2012 21:38:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=813</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[In our summer youth model making workshops <a href="http://seattlearchitect.thenewhive.com/arc-i-tek?user=seattlearchitect">Arc.I.Tek</a> has three different age/grade levels to the competition:
<h1><strong>Novice: Grades 1-4
</strong>
<strong>Apprentice: Grades 5-8
</strong>
<strong>Distinguished: Grades 9-12</strong></h1>
The grand prize for the Distinguished age group is an internship at <a href="http://www.millerhull.com/html/home.htm">Miller Hull Architects</a> - total score! The winning student will have some major cookie points to showcase on his/her college resume. "Who me? Yea, I already did an internship before I even WENT to college!" (Winning!) With such an awesome grand prize in one group, we wanted to make sure the other groups had similarly awesome, age appropriate prizes.

Today, thanks to our amazing sponsor <a href="http://lakevillehomes.com/">Lakeville Homes</a>, we now are so excited to announce to latest prize in the <a href="http://seattlearchitect.thenewhive.com/arc-i-tek?user=seattlearchitect">Arc.I.Tek</a> prize pool: *drumroll*
<h1>One winning student will receive a <span style="text-decoration:underline;"><strong>Family Fun Deluxe Membership</strong></span> to <a href="http://www.kidsquestmuseum.org/">KidsQuest Children's Museum</a> in Factoria!</h1>
[caption id="attachment_814" align="aligncenter" width="484" caption="&quot;The Backyard&quot; exhibit in KidsQuest Children's museum"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/kidsquest_2.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-814" title="kidsquest_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/kidsquest_2.jpg" alt="" width="484" height="241" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_815" align="aligncenter" width="484" caption="&quot;Waterways&quot; exhibit in KidsQuest Children's museum"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/kidsquest_1.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-815" title="kidsquest_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/kidsquest_1.jpg" alt="" width="484" height="241" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_816" align="aligncenter" width="484" caption="&quot;The Tree House&quot; exhibit in KidsQuest Children's museum"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/kidsquest_4.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-816" title="kidsquest_4" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/kidsquest_4.jpg" alt="" width="484" height="241" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_817" align="aligncenter" width="393" caption="&quot;The Garage&quot; exhibit in KidsQuest Children's museum"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/kidsquest_3.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-817" title="kidsquest_3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/kidsquest_3.jpg" alt="" width="393" height="241" /></a>[/caption]

KidsQuest Children's Museum is a great 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that relies on the support of the community through memberships and donations, and the support of local corporations and foundations.  Here is some more info about them and what a perfect fit they are with <a href="http://seattlearchitect.thenewhive.com/arc-i-tek?user=seattlearchitect">Arc.I.Tek</a>:

<span style="text-decoration:underline;"><strong>Mission</strong></span>

Create learning through the power of play and exploration that connects children to their communities and the world
<h3><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Vision</span></h3>
Be the trusted educational and cultural institution for all children and their families in the Puget Sound Region.
<h3><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Core Values</span></h3>
Whole Family Learning

We support and encourage learning that engages the whole family – children, their parents and their broader family– and offers opportunities for children and adults to learn together, about themselves and each other.  Understanding that each individual learns differently, our exhibits and programs meet the needs of different age groups and learning styles.

Innovation and Leading Edge Learning
We use emerging research and studies in early childhood education and family support to develop creative programs and exhibits.  We practice flexibility and, when appropriate, risk-taking to capitalize on our strengths, resources and opportunities to serve our community.

<span style="text-decoration:underline;"><strong>Patron Focus</strong></span>
We place the highest value on our patrons who support our organization and help us accomplish our mission.  We respect and appreciate their cultural, social and economic diversity, as well as their unique abilities and contributions.

<span style="text-decoration:underline;"><strong>Accessibility</strong></span>
We are committed to providing exhibits and programming that are accessible to our entire community, while providing age appropriate challenges and growth opportunities for the cognitive, physical, and emotional development stages of all children.  We honor and intentionally design diversity into our programming so that our Museum is a reflection of our community.

<span style="text-decoration:underline;"><strong>Community Building and Partnership</strong></span>
We strive to be a trusted community resource for the education of children, their families and our community.  Through collaboration and cooperation with public and private partnerships we accomplish more together.

<span style="text-decoration:underline;"><strong>Integrity</strong></span>
We are trustworthy, open, honest and transparent in everything we do.

<span style="text-decoration:underline;"><strong>Fiscal Responsibility</strong></span>
We honor and embrace our fiduciary responsibility to manage our resources efficiently and effectively, and to remain accountable to our donors and funders.
You can find KidsQuest Children's Museum on Facebook <a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/KidsQuest-Childrens-Museum/47410844893?ref=ts#">HERE</a> or on their website <a href="http://www.kidsquestmuseum.org/">HERE</a>.

Stay tuned as we add more great prizes and updates to the <a href="http://seattlearchitect.thenewhive.com/arc-i-tek?user=seattlearchitect">Arc.I.Tek</a> youth program.

[caption id="attachment_791" align="aligncenter" width="374" caption="Make sure you don't miss out!<br /> Get your tickets now by <a href='http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/239801'>clicking here!</a>"]<a href="http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/239801"><img class="size-full wp-image-791" title="tickets" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/tickets.png" alt="" width="374" height="677" /></a>[/caption]

Contact <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/Contact.html">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a> or <a href="http://seattlearchitecture.org/youth.html">The Seattle Architecture Foundation</a> for more information
<em>*photos courtesy of KidsQuest Children's museum </em>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>GHA featured on Materialicious right now - go check it out! (no really)</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/04/13/gha-featured-on-materialicious-right-now-go-check-it-out-no-really/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 13 Apr 2012 21:55:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=827</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.materialicious.com/">Materialicious</a> is an online mecca for all things design, and today some homes by Gelotte Hommas are being featured.

[caption id="attachment_828" align="aligncenter" width="560" caption="Hillcrest Farm being featured on Materialicious"]<a href="http://www.materialicious.com/search?search=Gelotte+Hommas&amp;commit=Search"><img class="size-full wp-image-828" title="materialicious" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/materialicious.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="550" /></a>[/caption]

From architecture to fashion, automobiles to wood, and everything in between.  If it's made of material, design related, and trendy you will find it on Materialicious.

This is one more amazing resource for design inspiration we send our clients to.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>1st Arc.I.Tek model making workshop THIS Saturday!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/04/16/1st-arc-i-tek-model-making-workshop-this-saturday/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 16 Apr 2012 21:19:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=831</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[For all you Seattle area readers with kids ages 7-18, the Arc.I.Tek model making workshops start this weekend!

Can't make it this weekend? That's ok - starting this Saturday and <span style="color:#ffcc00;"><strong>then every third Saturday until September</strong></span> at the Intiman theater Playhouse in Seattle we will be hosting these model making workshops.
The cost is $20 for an afternoon of model making wonder with architects and design professionals. All your kiddo's will need to bring with them is a sack lunch and their imagination  - we provide the rest.
<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/arc_t_tek_ad.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-810" title="arc_t_tek_ad" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/arc_t_tek_ad.jpg?w=231" alt="" width="231" height="300" /></a>
Head on over to brown paper tickets and get your tickets now before they fill up!
We can't wait to see you there!

[caption id="attachment_832" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="CLICK HERE TO GET YOUR TICKETS TO ARC.I.TEK"]<a href="http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/239801"><img class="size-medium wp-image-832" title="ticket" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/ticket.png?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="247" /></a>[/caption]

	<item>
		<title>Our project &quot;Classic on the green&quot; featured in this month&#039;s issue of Luxe magazine</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/04/20/our-project-classic-on-the-green-featured-in-this-months-issue-of-luxe-magazine/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 20 Apr 2012 22:48:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=836</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Last month we shared that one of our projects <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Classic_On_The_Green.html#">Classic On The Green </a>was going to be featured in the April Issue of Luxe Magazine. We received our copy of Luxe this week, and we wanted to share.

The home has been internally re-designed by interior designer <a href="http://www.henseldesignstudios.com/about/bio.php">Steven Hensel</a>. For those of you who don't have this month's issue of Luxe, take a look at the immaculate re-designed interiors of this gorgeous Gelotte Hommas Architecture designed home.

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/classic_on_the_green_11.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-850" title="Classic_on_the_green_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/classic_on_the_green_11.jpg?w=1024" alt="" width="1024" height="662" /></a>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/classic_on_the_green_21.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-851" title="Classic_on_the_green_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/classic_on_the_green_21.jpg?w=1024" alt="" width="1024" height="662" /></a>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/classic_on_the_green_31.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-852" title="Classic_on_the_green_3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/classic_on_the_green_31.jpg?w=1024" alt="" width="1024" height="662" /></a>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/classic_on_the_green_41.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-853" title="Classic_on_the_green_4" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/classic_on_the_green_41.jpg?w=1024" alt="" width="1024" height="662" /></a>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/classic_on_the_green_51.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-854" title="Classic_on_the_green_5" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/classic_on_the_green_51.jpg?w=1024" alt="" width="1024" height="662" /></a>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/classic_on_the_green_61.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-849" title="Classic_on_the_green_6" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/classic_on_the_green_61.jpg?w=1024" alt="" width="1024" height="662" />I</a>mages courtesy of Luxe Magazine
Contact Gelotte Hommas Architecture for information on your custom home]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>We&#039;re on Pinterest - are you?</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/04/30/were-on-pinterest-are-you/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Apr 2012 23:57:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=858</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Pinterest is another social networking site that is similar to Houzz in that you post or "pin" images. The difference with Pinterest is that you organize your "pins" on boards instead of in idea books. You can search through all sorts of topics from #architecture to #fashion, #weddings and #pets and everything in between.

Once you find a cool person or board that you want to follow their pins - just follow them and all the pins they make show up in your home feed (similar to Facebook). It's that easy!

We are on Pinterest and you can find us by clicking the link below:

[caption id="attachment_859" align="aligncenter" width="1024" caption="Click the image to find us on Pinterest!"]<a href="http://pinterest.com/gelottehommas/"><img class="size-large wp-image-859" title="pinterest" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/pinterest.jpg?w=1024" alt="" width="1024" height="577" /></a>[/caption]

Happy Pinning!

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>
