	<item>
		<title>How far can $20 go? Get involved in the Seattle Foundation&#039;s GIVE BIG campaign.</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/05/02/how-far-can-20-go/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 02 May 2012 19:18:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=862</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Today is the Seattle Foundation's Give Big campaign. The event helps more than 1,400 local nonprofits raise money and awareness through online donations.
"The idea is to create a sense of excitement around one day in which the whole community comes together to support the nonprofits," said foundation spokeswoman Mary Grace Roske.

<em><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/feature_givebigresults.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-865 aligncenter" title="feature_GiveBIGresults" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/feature_givebigresults.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="224" /></a></em>
<div><span style="color:#0000ee;"><em><span style="text-decoration:underline;">
</span></em></span>Here at GHA local non-profits are very close to home.  As you know we have teamed up with local non-profit The Seattle Architecture Foundation for our youth program Arc.I.Tek which is helping put design in the hands of youth and engaging them in what tomorrow holds. Non-profits are the life blood of our communities providing (at no cost) food, shelter, education materials and care for those who need it most. These are organizations that our community needs and they need our us to keep their doors open and keep helping people.

Today we are going to highlight just one of the many non-profits that this Give Big campaign is helping out - Raven Rock Ranch in Redmond, Wa.
<div id="center">
<div id="PageTitle">
<h1><span style="text-decoration:underline;"><span style="color:#77ae99;text-decoration:underline;"><a href="http://www.ravenrockranch.org/"><img class="aligncenter" src="http://www.ravenrockranch.org/Images/picts%20of%20the%20horses/resized%20for%20left%20justifypng_large.png" alt="raven rock ranch logo" /></a>
</span></span></h1>
</div>
<div id="Main">
<div id="top"><span style="text-decoration:underline;"><em><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/feature_givebigresults.jpg">
</a>Description:</em> </span>The need is overwhelming- there are over 70,000 cases of child abuse every year in our state. The needs are reconnection of children coming from Child Protection Services (CPS), Foster care, and any other agencies that attend to at-risk children.</div>
<div id="middle">
<div id="middleMain">
<div>
<div id="middleMainTop">

Children and teens who have experienced traumatic events feel isolated from their school group, family and their community at large. Raven Rock Ranch pairs a rescued horse with an at-risk child.  The experience of connecting to the horse gives each child a starting place to reconnect with the community.

</div>
</div>
<div><strong>Mission Statement</strong></div>
<div id="middleMainMiddle">Rescuing horses, recovering kids, restoring families.
Working together to change lives.Raven Rock Ranch rescues horses from abandonment, neglect and abuse, rehabilitating them both physically and mentally. We then pair the appropriate horse with at-risk youth. A bond of trust is established, which is the first step in the recovery process.Raven Rock Ranch is a safe and supportive place, providing the nurturing environment that allows each child to thrive. The one-on-one interaction of the instructor with each child and horse pair facilitates family restoration as each team works and plays together.

</div>
</div>
<div id="middleRight">
<div id="orgName">RAVEN ROCK RANCH</div>
<div>20503 NE 122nd St
Redmond,</div>
<div>
<div id="contactStateBlock">WA98053</div>
</div>
<div>(425) 869-2302</div>
<div>Sandy Matts,President</div>
<div><a href="mailto:tim@ravenrockranch.org">tim@ravenrockranch.org</a></div>
<div id="ContactWebSite"><a href="http://www.ravenrockranch.org/">http://www.ravenrockranch.org/</a></div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="bottom">
<div id="bottomLeft">
<div id="ctl00_PlaceHolderMain_RadMultiPage1">
<div id="ctl00_PlaceHolderMain_Programs">
<div>
<div>
<h4>RAVEN ROCK RANCH PROGRAMS</h4>
</div>
<div>

The primary program at Raven Rock Ranch (RRR) is to provide unconditional acceptance to every at-risk child as well as the connection to our horses which brings about a feeling of safety that allows each child to heal.  Through the pairing of the at-risk youth and the horse there is a trust that is developed through basic horsemanship which is taught to them in a 6 week program.  We use “Natural Horsemanship” with an emphasis on "Liberty Work" to encourage mental and emotional connection between the human and the horse.  There is no cost for our students. We are 100% supported by donations.

The second program we have at RRR is to rescue abused and abandoned horses.  Some horses we receive will just need to be "re-homed" from an owner who cannot provide for their basic needs (owner will quite likely have the best interest of the horse in mind and may donate the animal to our program), others will truly need to be rescued from situations of neglect and abuse (owner will likely not part with horse unless dollars are involved.) Once a horse is in our care, assessments will be made to see if the animal will work into our program. We carefully evaluate each horse for temperament and reliability.

</div>
<div>
<h4>RECENT SUCCESSES AND CURRENT CHALLENGES</h4>
</div>
<div><strong>Some recent successes at RRR
</strong>We primarily work with foster children that come from very abusive environments.  Therefore we are typically dealing with attachment disorder, anger, abuse, post traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), and abandonment issues to name a few.These are quotes from the guardians or parents of our riders:“In the first two weeks of “F” time at RRR she went from being the meanest kid in the school to being kind and accepting of others.”

“We feel unconditionally loved and accepted at RRR.”

After several threats of wanting to kill his mother, 10 year old “S” visited Raven Rock Ranch.  After his second visit, he said, “I Love You!” His mom hadn’t heard those words in a very long time.

“We have been having a rough week the only thing holding us together right now is Raven Rock Ranch.”

<strong><span style="color:#77ae99;">**Our current need is a covered arena so our program can run all year round.**</span></strong>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="bottomRight"></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<h1 style="text-align:center;"><span style="text-decoration:underline;"><span style="color:#77ae99;text-decoration:underline;">BE A PART OF SOMETHING BIGGER</span></span></h1>
<h6 style="text-align:center;">Your contributions matter. The Seattle Foundation makes it easy for you to give effectively by providing you with knowledge of community issues, evaluations of nonprofits and proven giving strategies.
<a href="http://www.seattlefoundation.org/npos/Pages/RavenRockRanch.aspx?bv=nposearch">CLICK HERE to donate now and get involved in your community. </a></h6>
</div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Friday fun: Secret doors</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/05/04/friday-fun-secret-doors/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 04 May 2012 23:27:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=867</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Happy Friday everyone! Here in Seattle it has successfully rained and shined today with more of the same  forecasted this weekend. Considering that Seattle weather is known for being a little less than fun (in general) I thought we could kick on a Friday Fun series. From now on, we will be posting something fun about architecture or design every Friday. Follow us and share some of your thoughts, inspirations or weather stories as we go!

Today on Friday fun we are going to talk about <a href="https://www.google.com/search?sourceid=chrome&amp;ie=UTF-8&amp;q=fsecret+doors%2C+gelotte+hommas#hl=en&amp;sclient=psy-ab&amp;q=secret+doors&amp;oq=secret+doors&amp;aq=f&amp;aqi=g4&amp;aql=&amp;gs_l=serp.3..0l4.2901.2901.1.3184.1.1.0.0.0.0.51.51.1.1.0...0.0.laQS-2VKa-I&amp;pbx=1&amp;bav=on.2,or.r_gc.r_pw.r_cp.r_qf.,cf.osb&amp;fp=ecb6a798695883bc&amp;biw=1920&amp;bih=1085">secret doors</a> in architecture. The office went on a little field trip this morning to check out one of our projects that is under construction in Kirkland. This project has a secret door, which is actually pretty common with some of our client's. Home owner's put in secret doors for all sorts of reasons. From utlization of space to actually hiding a secret room or location. Either way, they are pretty fun little aspects to these houses that add a little extra to the "wow" factor.

Our Project <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/northeast_by_northwest.html">Northeast by Northwest</a> is one of our projects that has a secret door.

[caption id="attachment_873" align="aligncenter" width="533"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/sd_2_closed.jpg"><img class=" wp-image-873 " title="SD_2_closed" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/sd_2_closed.jpg?w=666" alt="" width="533" height="819" /></a> Northeast by Northwest secret door[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;"><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/sd_2_open_.jpg"><img class="aligncenter  wp-image-870" title="SD_2_open_" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/sd_2_open_.jpg" alt="" width="533" height="817" /></a></p>
This project is called <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Tuscano_sul_lago.html">Tuscano Sul Lago</a> and this secret door is at the top of a stair case. This door opens to an secret office located on the second floor.

[caption id="attachment_871" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/sd_1_closed.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-871" title="SD_1_closed" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/sd_1_closed.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="860" /></a> Tuscano Sul Lago's secret door[/caption]

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/sd_1_open_.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-872" title="SD_1_open_" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/sd_1_open_.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="860" /></a>

Secret doors are fun no matter what they are hiding. Does your house have any secret doors? Leave a comment and tell us about them. Have a good weekend.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Wooden slab into conference room fab: Re-purposing</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/05/08/wooden-slab-into-conference-room-fab-re-purposing/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 08 May 2012 00:07:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=878</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Re-purposing materials for another use is a part of our architectural practice with our projects, but it doesn't stop there. When we moved into our current office building four years ago we gained an extra conference room. A bigger conference room, which of course needed a bigger conference room table. The current table that we had was designed by Frank Lloyd Wright (of course) and although it is pretty fancy and Frank Lloyd Wright-ish, the table itself posed some problems.

[caption id="attachment_883" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/conference_table_2.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-883" title="Conference_table_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/conference_table_2.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a> Frank Lloyd Wright designed table[/caption]

&nbsp;

[caption id="attachment_881" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/conference_table_1.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-881" title="Conference_table_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/conference_table_1.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a> Custom Gelotte Hommas Architecture conference room table[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">Say hello to our conference room table.

This is a 12 foot long table made out of two 6 feet long re-purposed wood slabs. We have some renderings on the wall and some art, but the thing that most of our clients end up admiring the most is this table (for obvious reasons). We worked with <a href="http://www.urbanhardwoods.com/default.aspx">Urban Hardwoods</a> here in Seattle to custom select and create this work of art.</p>
The major problem with our original conference room table was that it was too small. With a growing office came a growing staff and the need to fit more than four people at the table. Once we figured out that we wanted to use re-purposed wood to make our table, as well as the general dimensions we wanted, then Curt went to work designing his masterpiece.

This cantilevered table is more of a joint technology and thus there are no legs getting in the way of our legs or our chairs.

[caption id="attachment_882" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/conference_table_4.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-882" title="Conference_table_4" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/conference_table_4.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a> Our table joints. They are attached under the table length wise with the foundation also running length wise.[/caption]

&nbsp;

Eric Drivdahl chose the final pieces that make up this table. As you can see it had some major "blemishes" that we chose to keep. The fine folks over at Urban Hardwoods are master's at this and thus knew where to install a dove tail, as well as which cracks and crevices to fill with resin and which one's could be left as is.

[caption id="attachment_884" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/conference_table_3.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-884" title="Conference_table_3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/conference_table_3.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a> One of the two blemishes left on filled with resin[/caption]

We are just so very pleased with the way the table came out, and most of our clients agree with us.
Do you have anything re-purposed in your home or office? Leave us a comment and tell us about it!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Why is the Space Needle Orange? We know the answer!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/05/14/why-is-the-space-needle-orange-we-know-the-answer/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 14 May 2012 23:28:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=891</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[As most of you know, Seattle has a pretty spectacular land mark -the Space Needle. As some of you may, or may not know, it came from the World's Fair here in Seattle in 1962. Yea, a little Seattle knowledge. You're welcome!
Did you also know that when the Space Needle first arrived it was Orange? Well it was, and 2012 marks the 50 year anniversary of the Space Needle and the orange paint job starts the anniversary "summer season" for the birthday needle and Space Center. Cool huh!

[caption id="attachment_892" align="aligncenter" width="468"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/space_needle_orange.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-892" title="space_needle_orange" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/space_needle_orange.jpg" alt="" width="468" height="306" /></a> The original debut of the Space Needle in "Galazy Gold"<br />Image courtesy of <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/90342017@N00/2375829093/in/set-72157604380878280/">azzurrolou</a>[/caption]

This is where <a href="http://seattlearchitect.thenewhive.com/arc-i-tek?user=seattlearchitect">Arc.I.Tek</a> comes in! That is our youth program we built in conjunction with The Seattle Architecture Foundation, The Seattle Center and The Next Fifty to help celebrate this amazing anniversary.
The first of the model making workshops kick-off this Saturday. Do you know anybody with kids ages 7-18 who would be interested? Great! Share this link, or download the PDF brochure <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/arc-i-tek_ebrochure.pdf">here</a> and share away!

Happy Birthday Space Needle!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Check out one of our projects that is about to break ground.</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/05/16/check-out-one-of-our-projects-that-is-about-to-break-ground/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 16 May 2012 19:19:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=897</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Our underway project Deliberate Demense is about to break ground on the water in Medina. This project is a 7,400 square foot new construction home.

[caption id="attachment_902" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/large_4.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-902" title="large_4" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/large_4.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a> Site Plan[/caption]

It has a flexible, open floor plan designed for entertaining including a light filled kitchen and great room with open views to Meydenbauer Bay.

[caption id="attachment_903" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/large_5.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-903" title="large_5" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/large_5.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a> Rendering of our project in Medina "Deliberate Demense"[/caption]

The style is a contemporary rendition of traditional Mediterranean details.  The lot the home is being built on has a structure on it currently that will need to be demo'ed first. As is our tradition, our client's get to take the first "whack" at the existing structure before our machinery tears it down. Once that happens we will be sure to post pics for you all to enjoy!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>897</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>check-out-one-of-our-projects-that-is-about-to-break-ground</wp:post_name>

	<item>
		<title>Friday Fun - Rustic Remodel</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/05/18/friday-fun-rustic-remodel/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 18 May 2012 18:56:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=909</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Remodel's have been popular on the blog lately, so we thought we would post about another one of our remodel projects that wrapped up not too long ago.
Meet our Rustic Remodel.

[caption id="attachment_914" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://lakevillehomes.com/remodel-rustic-chic-project-kick-off/"><img class="size-full wp-image-914" title="rustic_remodel_before_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/rustic_remodel_before_1.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="372" /></a> This project is located in Issaquah on about 20 acres. The barn is amazing![/caption]

[caption id="attachment_915" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://lakevillehomes.com/remodel-rustic-chic-project-kick-off/"><img class="size-full wp-image-915" title="rustic_remodel_before_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/rustic_remodel_before_2.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="372" /></a> The home is 3,500 square feet and is scheduled to undergo a 2 phase remodel.[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_910" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://lakevillehomes.com/remodel-rustic-chic-project-kick-off/"><img class="size-full wp-image-910" title="rustic_remodel_before_3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/rustic_remodel_before_3.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="841" /></a> Phase 1 of the remodel is complete, which included this bathroom and the master bedroom.[/caption]

The home owners wanted to capture the "Northwest Rustic" charm of the property in the remodel of their home.

[caption id="attachment_911" align="aligncenter" width="521"]<a href="http://lakevillehomes.com/"><img class="size-full wp-image-911" title="rustic_remodel_after_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/rustic_remodel_after_1.jpg" alt="" width="521" height="468" /></a> The master bedroom after Phase 1 of 2 in this Rustic Remodel.[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_912" align="aligncenter" width="391"]<a href="http://lakevillehomes.com/"><img class="size-full wp-image-912" title="rustic_remodel_after_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/rustic_remodel_after_2.jpg" alt="" width="391" height="521" /></a> This fireplace is stone with a gas insert.[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_913" align="aligncenter" width="391"]<a href="http://lakevillehomes.com/"><img class="size-full wp-image-913" title="rustic_remodel_after_3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/rustic_remodel_after_3.jpg" alt="" width="391" height="521" /></a> The "after" picture of the bathroom.[/caption]

This project is a gem. We will be sure to post the picts as phase 2 gets underway, so stay tuned everyone!
What is your favorite part of this remodel? Is your home Northwest Rustic as well? Leave us a picture in the comments section - we would love to see it!

To see more of the before and after photos visit the contractor <a href="http://lakevillehomes.com/rustic-chic-professional-photos/">Lakeville Homes, blog</a>.
*Photos courtesy of <a href="http://lakevillehomes.com/">Lakeville Homes</a>*]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_metadata</wp:meta_key>

	<item>
		<title>Friday Fun - Up Close and Personal Demo Style!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/05/25/friday-fun-up-close-and-personal-demo-style/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 25 May 2012 20:31:14 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=919</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This week started off with a bang as one of our <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/05/16/check-out-one-of-our-projects-that-is-about-to-break-ground/">projects broke ground</a>.

[caption id="attachment_933" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/2011-03-22-009.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-933" title="2011.03.22 009" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/2011-03-22-009.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a> The Original House<br />(The "before" picture)[/caption]

Although it was raining here in Seattle on Monday, turns out rain is the perfect forecast for demolition (with all the dust and what not from the demo.)

[caption id="attachment_924" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/4.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-924" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/4.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> Excavation Bucket's ready for business![/caption]

[caption id="attachment_927" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/7.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-927" title="7" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/7.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> Safety First![/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">The process of designing your dream home can take awhile, but when you finally get to SEE some physical progress it get's exciting, and what an exciting day it was.
The Excitement started the night before apparently as the whole bunch came to kick off- the demo by throwing rocks through the windows of the existing home.  The house was empty of course, and well, who HASN'T dreamed of throwing rocks through a perfectly good window? I know I have!</p>


[caption id="attachment_925" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/5.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-925" title="5" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/5.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> From the deck looking back at the house.[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_930" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/10.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-930" title="Broken_windows" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/10.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> You can see the rocks from the night before still on the floor. Look at the amazing view of Lake Washington. Simply stunning.[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_929" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/9.jpg"><img class=" wp-image-929 " title="9" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/9.jpg?w=1024" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> A bit of graffiti in the kitchen: their two boys traced on the wall about to be demo'd.[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">From the project manager with contractor <a href="http://www.benderchaffey.com/">Bender Chaffey</a>, to OUR project Manager<a href="http://about.me/eric.drivdahl"> Eric Drivdahl</a>, and of our course our client's, there were smiles and laughter all around.</p>


[caption id="attachment_928" align="aligncenter" width="553"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/8.jpg"><img class=" wp-image-928  " title="8" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/8.jpg?w=1024" alt="" width="553" height="553" /></a> Our AMAZING cheerful client ready to get started.[/caption]

Our client's have such a wonderful close knit family that everyone came to celebrate this huge step in bringing their dream home to life.

[caption id="attachment_922" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/2.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-922" title="Little people get excited too" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/2.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> The oldest of their two son's checking out the Excavator.<br />(His boots are my fav)[/caption]

Once everyone had a chance to fully check out all the fun equipment, eat some donuts and get some coffee that our client brought for everyone (again, AMAZING!) it was time to get started.

[caption id="attachment_926" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/6.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-926" title="6" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/6.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> Let the destruction begin!<br />(Just look at that grin on his face)[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_931" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/11.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-931" title="11" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/11.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> From the other side of the Lake. You can see the claw tearing into the top right.[/caption]

With all the time and work it takes to design and build a home, it's amazing how quickly they come down. Here is some video of our client "Bringing Down The House".

[wpvideo UZliypnh]

When all the fun was over, and it was time to turn it over to the professionals to do their job a bottle of champagne was brought out to celebrate.

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/12.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-936  " title="12" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/12.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a>

And, then.  Well...

[caption id="attachment_921" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/1.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-921" title="1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/1.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> What can we say, our client's are the BEST![/caption]

Happy Friday eveyone!]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:comment_date_gmt>2012-05-31 05:15:39</wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Hi
I grew up in that house.  we moved in 2/10/1947 just 1 month to the day prior to my 7th birthday.  It was just a summer house then but my dad hired Louie Schaeffer to redesign the house and oversee the remodel.  It was an innovative house at the time with the butterfly roofline.  It was a wonderful place to grow up.  After my folks died in 1961 and 1964 respectively, the house was sold to Ken Greenbaum.  He and his family did another remodel which added some great additional amenities.  I am sad to see it is gone but the property is beautiful and will make a great new building site.  
Mary Hoffman]]></wp:comment_content>

	<item>
		<title>Arc.I.Tek model making workshops are in full swing!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/05/30/arc-i-tek-model-making-workshops-are-in-full-swing/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 30 May 2012 21:01:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=948</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Our youth model making workshops are in full swing with the next event coming up Saturday June 16th. These events are so much fun. The workshop kicks off with an introduction to the kids about the history of the Space Needle (including why it's painted orange right now) as well as looking to the future at the same time.

[caption id="attachment_957" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3744.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-957" title="IMG_3744" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3744.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a> Kirsten Clemens from SAF leading the educational piece of the workshop.[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_949" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3748.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-949" title="IMG_3748" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3748.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a> The kids were shown the original napkin sketch of the design for the Space Needle.[/caption]

It is so much fun to watch the kid's walk through the design/creation process. They start out by sketching up ideas and then they are off and running building!

[caption id="attachment_950" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3767.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-950" title="IMG_3767" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3767.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="746" /></a> Stage one of the design process is sketching.<br />After that the kids start to build their visions.[/caption]

As their ideas take shape it gets really fun. Suddenly metal grating becomes clouds,transparencies become windows and hot glue becomes the concrete holding it all together. Take a look at a few of the models in progress.
<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3779.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-951" title="IMG_3779" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3779.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3772.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-952" title="IMG_3772" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3772.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a>

<a href="http://videos.videopress.com/dOzMGgNA/mvi_3769_fmt1.ogv"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-953" title="IMG_3786" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3786.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" />[wpvideo dOzMGgNA]
</a>

After the kiddo's fill out a form telling all about their vision including the name of it as well as the purpose or vision for the design.

[caption id="attachment_955" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3791.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-955" title="IMG_3791" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3791.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a> One of the kids filling out his entry form for his model.[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_954" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3790.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-954" title="IMG_3790" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3790.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a> One of our amazing volunteer's helping one of the kiddo's fill out his form for his model.[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_956" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3803.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-956" title="IMG_3803" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3803.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="746" /></a> One of the kiddo's taking a snack break.[/caption]

Some of the finished models.

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3827.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-958" title="IMG_3827" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3827.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3820.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-960" title="IMG_3820" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3820.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3824.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-961" title="IMG_3824" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3824.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3814.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-959" title="IMG_3814" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3814.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a>

Each of the entries will be entered into the competition piece. Judging is based off of three catergories: Sustainability, Innovation and Social Sharing. Each entry will be given a site on <a href="http://seattlearchitect.thenewhive.com/models-page-1">The New Hive</a> starting in September to be able to "share" through social media channels.
Have you registered your kiddo's for the next event? Sign up here through <a href="http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/239801">www.brownpapertickets.com.</a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>IMG_3779</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/05/30/arc-i-tek-model-making-workshops-are-in-full-swing/img_3779/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 30 May 2012 20:32:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/img_3779.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>951</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2012-05-30 20:32:27</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2012-05-30 20:32:27</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>img_3779</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>inherit</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>948</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>attachment</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

	<item>
		<title>Friday Fun - The art of the sketch.</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/06/01/friday-fun-the-art-of-the-sketch/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 01 Jun 2012 21:38:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=969</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The annual  <a href="http://archrecord.construction.com/call4entries/Napkin-Sketch-Contest-2012.asp">Cocktail Napkin Sketch</a> is back, and we decided this was our year to enter.
The rules are simple: (there are only four)

1. Sketch on a white 5'x5' cocktail napkin
2. Use a Pen/Sharpie
3. Be an architect or designer
4. You can submit up to 6 designs

So, we decided to make a working lunch out of it and ordered pizza for the whole bunch as we sat down to sketch.

[caption id="attachment_971" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/1.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-971" title="1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/1.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> One of our principal's Curt Gelotte sketching out his idea[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_973" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/3.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-973" title="3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/3.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> Curt Peterson and David Grubb getting their sketch on[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_974" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/4.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-974" title="4" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/4.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> Our other principal Scott Hommas in the beginning of his design[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_972" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/2.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-972" title="2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/2.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> Even our office manager took a crack at it (although we decided it might be better to save our 6th entry for something a bit... bigger?)[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_976" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/6.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-976" title="6" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/6.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> Eric Drivdahl working on his masterpiece[/caption]

Once they were all finished we stuck them in an envelope and sent our little designs off to the contest in New York.  We know you want to see our entries, so here they are in all their glory!

[caption id="attachment_970" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/12.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-970" title="12" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/12.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> "I don't have my glasses on, and I can't really see what I'm drawing here..." -Scott Hommas[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_977" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/7.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-977" title="7" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/7.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> David is a man of little words, but we think he was feeling a bit "blue"[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_978" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/8.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-978" title="8" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/8.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> "I might have gone to art school, but I think this perspective is a bit...off" -Nikki Fisher[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_979" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/9.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-979" title="9" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/9.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> "I really could do this all day, so I might as well stop now" - Curt Peterson[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_980" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/10.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-980" title="10" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/10.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> "Fibonacci just gets me" - Curt Gelotte[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_981" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/11.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-981" title="11" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/11.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> "I'm not sure what it is, but it's done!" - Eric Drivdahl[/caption]

Two grand prize winning submissions will be published in the September issue of <em>Architectural Record</em> AND *drumroll please* the winners get a box of napkins with <strong>their sketch printed on it!</strong>
Who's excited? We are! Wish us luck!
Click the links for winning sketches from <a href="http://archrecord.construction.com/features/cocktail_napkin_sketch_contest/2011/">2011</a> and <a href="http://archrecord.construction.com/features/cocktail_napkin_sketch_contest/default.asp">2010</a>.
<a href="https://www.aiaaustin.org/event/gallery-reception-napkin-sketch-exhibit">Click here</a> to see the 2011 napkin sketch gallery.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>On the boards with Gelotte Hommas: A Touch of Normandy</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/06/04/on-the-boards-with-gelotte-hommas-a-touch-of-normandy/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 04 Jun 2012 22:42:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=986</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One of our projects is gearing up to start construction. We received some new renderings today and I wanted to share them.

[caption id="attachment_987" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/cover-rendering.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-987" title="COVER RENDERING" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/cover-rendering.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="350" /></a> A Touch of Normandy[/caption]

This project is on the water in Medina. Here are the specs
• New Cabana with Guest Suite replaces existing next to existing pool to be repaired
• New 3 car garage, Hot Tub and Shade Pavilion
• Stone exterior crafted in the manner of Normandy Country Estates

Pool houses are always fun because, well, pools are fun! This one is particularly nice with all the stone work.
Take a look at these new renderings!

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/large_9.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-988" title="large_9" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/large_9.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>
<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/large_8.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-989" title="large_8" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/large_8.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>

We anticipate this project will break ground in the next few months, and we will be sure to post progress picts.
<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/underway/Touch_of_Normandy.html">{To see more picture of this project please visit the project page on our website here}</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Help Scott Hommas make bail - He&#039;s an MDA Jailbird!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/06/06/help-scott-hommas-make-bail-hes-an-mda-jailbird/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 06 Jun 2012 20:24:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=997</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www2.mda.org/site/TR?px=1317923&amp;pg=personal&amp;fr_id=2760"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-999" title="logo3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/logo3.png" alt="" width="454" height="98" /></a>

The Lock-Up is the Muscular Dystrophy Association’s premier fundraising program. These high-profile events occur all across the country at various times throughout the year. Business and community leaders agree to be "put behind bars for good," where they utilize use their vendors, co-workers, family and friends to get donations that will go toward their “bail.”

[caption id="attachment_1000" align="aligncenter" width="300"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/296429086-custom.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1000" title="296429086.custom" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/296429086-custom.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="231" /></a> Help make a difference![/caption]

All funds raised by the MDA Lock-Up assist the Association in providing lifesaving research, a nationwide network of medical clinics and accessible summer camp experiences to individuals and families affected by neuromuscular diseases.

This is an event that we have participated in before, and Scott Hommas has agreed to be the culprit to go behind bars this time!

[caption id="attachment_998" align="aligncenter" width="143"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/therm.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-998" title="therm" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/therm.jpg" alt="" width="143" height="338" /></a> Scotts goal is $3,200[/caption]

Please visit his <a href="http://www2.mda.org/site/TR?px=1317923&amp;pg=personal&amp;fr_id=2760">fundraising page</a> where you can donate directly. Every dollar counts - plus you get to literally "bail" Scott out from a jam! Help us spread the word and "share" this and pass it along to your friends and family.
Thanks for visiting everyone!
<em>*images courtesy of MDA Lock up*</em>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>UPDATE: Scott&#039;s on the MDA&#039;s most wanted list!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/06/11/update-scotts-on-the-mdas-most-wanted-list/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 11 Jun 2012 21:42:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1003</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align:center;">UPDATE: Scott Hommas was JUST added to the MDA's most wanted list!
Look at this press release...<a href="http://www2.mda.org/site/TR?px=1317923&amp;pg=personal&amp;fr_id=2760">
</a><a href="http://www2.mda.org/site/TR?px=1317923&amp;pg=personal&amp;fr_id=2760"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1008" title="Wanted_poster" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/wanted_poster2.png" alt="" width="521" height="775" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align:center;"><a href="http://www2.mda.org/site/TR?px=1317923&amp;pg=personal&amp;fr_id=2760">H</a>e needs your help. Click the image above
or
<a href="http://www2.mda.org/site/TR?px=1317923&amp;pg=personal&amp;fr_id=2760">CLICK HERE
</a>to go to Scott's MDA donation page.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;">Every donation is tax deductible (woo hoo!), and they MDA does all the work for you.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;">Once you donate you will receive an email with all your confirmation details on it. It's that simple!
Who's going to be the first to help Scott raise bail?</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Rammed Earth; a gorgeous environmentally friendly building option</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/06/13/rammed-earth-a-gorgeous-environmentally-friendly-building-option/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 13 Jun 2012 22:58:12 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1013</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We have a new client who is interested in environmentally friendly building options. One of the options that we showed them is called <a href="http://home.howstuffworks.com/rammed-earth-home2.htm">Rammed Earth</a>.
Most people have never heard of this method, so we thought we would share this really neat and beautiful technique. Rammed Earth (as defined by Wikipedia)  is used for the creation of walls using the raw materials of <a title="Soil" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soil">earth</a>, <a title="Chalk" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chalk">chalk</a>, <a title="Lime (material)" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lime_(material)">lime</a> and <a title="Gravel" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gravel">gravel</a>.

[caption id="attachment_1016" align="aligncenter" width="500"]<a href="http://www.rammedearth.info/rammed-earth-pictures-page2.htm"><img class="size-full wp-image-1016 " title="rammed_earth_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/rammed_earth_1.jpg" alt="" width="500" height="375" /></a> Image courtesy of Clifton Schooley[/caption]

Although this technique seems new, it's definitely not. It is actually an <em>ancient</em> building method that is seeing a revival recently due to challenges on the environment and clients seeking more <a title="Sustainability" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sustainability">sustainable</a> <a title="Building material" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Building_material">building materials</a> and <a title="Natural building" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natural_building">natural building</a> methods.
<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/rammed_earth11.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1014" title="rammed_earth11" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/rammed_earth11-e1339627369655.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="579" /></a>

A home that is made using rammed earth is resistant to pest (termites and cockroaches), non~ toxic, fireproof, sound proof , it self regulates humidity ( great for asthma sufferers), bio degradable and a hat conductor ( a great way to cut down on air conditioning and heating costs.)

[caption id="attachment_1017" align="aligncenter" width="383"]<a href="http://www.rammedearth.info/rammed-earth-pictures-page2.htm"><img class="size-full wp-image-1017" title="kitchen-pillars" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/kitchen-pillars.jpg" alt="" width="383" height="287" /></a> http://www.rammedearth.info/rammed-earth-pictures-page2.htm[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;"><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/rammed_earth31.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1015" title="rammed_earth31" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/rammed_earth31-e1339627430390.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="578" /></a>Here are a few more pictures
<a href="http://www.rammedearth.info/rammed-earth-pictures-page2.htm">
</a></p>


[caption id="attachment_1018" align="aligncenter" width="383"]<a href="http://www.rammedearth.info/rammed-earth-pictures-page2.htm"><img class="size-full wp-image-1018" title="curved-walls-stairs" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/curved-walls-stairs.jpg" alt="" width="383" height="287" /></a> Image courtesy of Clifton Schooley[/caption]

We really like the character and air of comfort this technique brings to a home. We will keep you posted and let you know if our client choose this method!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>rammed-earth-a-gorgeous-environmentally-friendly-building-option</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="gelotte-hommas-architects"><![CDATA[Gelotte Hommas Architects]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="green-sustainable"><![CDATA[Green &amp; Sustainable]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="green-building-materials"><![CDATA[Green Building Materials]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="rammed-earth"><![CDATA[Rammed Earth]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="sustainable-building-choices"><![CDATA[Sustainable building choices]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="walls-made-from-earth"><![CDATA[walls made from earth]]></category>

		<title>Calling all builders, re-modelers and realtors; let&#039;s talk 3-D over breakfast</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/06/18/calling-all-builders-re-modelers-and-realtors-lets-talk-3-d-over-breakfast/</link>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This Thursday June 21st one of our project managers Eric Drivdahl is going to be participating in a hosted discussion. Come and see where the future of 3-D is headed, and how it can positively impact your business.
The best part is you get breakfast too!
<p style="text-align:center;"><a href="http://www.masterbuildersinfo.com"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1023" title="DesignBreakfast" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/designbreakfast.png" alt="" width="360" height="476" />
</a>The cost is $15 for Members</p>
<p style="text-align:center;">and
$25 for Non-members
Register online at <a href="http://www.masterbuildersinfo.com">www.masterbuilderscinfo.com</a>
(or just click the image above)

This is a great opportunity to learn some exciting new things and get some of your questions answered.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;">See you Thursday!</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>What do kids and vintage race cars have in common?</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/06/18/what-do-kids-and-vintage-race-cars-have-in-common/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 18 Jun 2012 20:18:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1025</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[FUN - that's what!
Every summer  <a href="http://www.sovren.org/">SOVREN</a> (Society of Vintage Racing Enthusiats) hosts <a href="http://northwesthistorics.com/">The Pacific Northwest Historics</a> from  June 29th thru July 1st. This is a weekend filled with vintage car races. As if THAT wasn't cool enough on it's own, the whole reason the guild does this is to raise money for our very own Seattle Children's Hospital.

<a href="http://northwesthistorics.com/sovrenguild/theguild/upcoming-events/"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1027" title="2012_flyer" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/2012_flyer.png" alt="" width="560" height="399" />
</a>

As explained on the Pacific Northwest Historics website: "The Pacific Northwest Historics features many of the world’s rarest and most beautiful pre-1970 race cars. Most have been restored to mint condition and a handful retain the patina earned while racing years ago.  This year, more than 250 vintage race cars from all over the West Coast and Canada are expected to participate. Fan favorites include Ferraris, Lotuses, Cobras, Corvettes, Porsches, Austin Healeys and some less recognizable names like Elva, Ginetta, and McLaren; many with impressive racing histories."

The celebrity this year is <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johnny_Rutherford">Johnny Rutherford</a> and WE are sponsoring the celebrity golf cart! We don't get to drive him around, although we definitely tried. :)

There is also a silent auction on  SATURDAY JUNE 30TH which also benefits Seattle Children's Hospital. You could snag one of our amazing <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/02/09/the-cardboard-cottage/">cardboard cottages</a>, or some of our more popular auction items in the past have included:
<ul>
	<li>Car and motorcycle rental opportunities</li>
	<li>Car care products</li>
	<li>Spa treatments Luxury hotel and restaurant gift certificates</li>
	<li>Original artwork and prints, decorative glass and ceramic pieces</li>
	<li>Clothing</li>
	<li>Jewelry</li>
	<li>Remote control cars</li>
	<li>Battery powered and peddle power kids cars and other kids’ items – once we even had a twin bed shaped like an Indy car!</li>
	<li>Tools, tools and more tools from screwdrivers and wrenches to floor jackets, shop flooring and shelving</li>
	<li>One-of-a-kind gift baskets</li>
</ul>
There are tons of things happening this year at the races including the 3rd year of Friday Night KART Racing, and "Testing Day" on Thursday, June 28th. This is an event you surely won't want to miss!

From June 28th thru July 1st as the Pacific Raceways in Kent. Tickets are available at the gate during race weekend.
<h1>For more ticket info <a href="http://northwesthistorics.com/sovrenguild/theguild/upcoming-events/sovrenguild/sovrenguild/?page_id=1494">Click Here</a>.</h1>
<h1>For more information on the Auction<a href="http://northwesthistorics.com/sovrenguild/helpful-info/vendors-auction/"> click here</a></h1>
<strong>
</strong>]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>2012_flyer</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>inherit</wp:status>

		<wp:attachment_url>https://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/2012_flyer.png</wp:attachment_url>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_wp_attached_file</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/723/30761957/files/2012/06/2012_flyer.png]]></wp:meta_value>

			<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_metadata</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:5:{s:5:"width";s:4:"1397";s:6:"height";s:3:"997";s:14:"hwstring_small";s:23:"height='91' width='128'";s:4:"file";s:86:"/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/723/30761957/files/2012/06/2012_flyer.png";s:10:"image_meta";a:10:{s:8:"aperture";s:1:"0";s:6:"credit";s:0:"";s:6:"camera";s:0:"";s:7:"caption";s:0:"";s:17:"created_timestamp";s:1:"0";s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";s:1:"0";s:3:"iso";s:1:"0";s:13:"shutter_speed";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:0:"";}}]]></wp:meta_value>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>The 7 Stages of Residential Architectural Design - An Info-graphic</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/06/20/the-7-stages-of-residential-architecture-design-and-info-graphic/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 20 Jun 2012 22:08:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1034</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[From start to finish there are quite a lot of details that go into the design, and then build out processes of residential architecture. This can take anywhere from 6 months to 3 years depending on the size and complexity of the project. Whether remodeling your guest bathroom, or designing a 35,000 sq. ft home in the Colorado Rockies, the process can basically be broken down into 7 stages.
Check out this info-graphic we developed to help us explain the process. Enjoy!

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/7_stages_of_design2.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-1047" title="7_stages_of_design" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/7_stages_of_design2.jpg?w=662" alt="" width="662" height="1024" /></a><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/7_stages_of_design1.jpg">
</a>
Do you see anything that we missed? Do you have a question that we didn't cover?
Leave us a comment so we can make sure to answer them, and of course to make this info-graphic even better!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>GHA recognized as &quot;Best Architect&quot; in 425 Magazine for the second year in a row!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/06/27/gha-recognized-as-best-architect-in-425-magazine-for-the-second-year-in-a-row/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 27 Jun 2012 18:29:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1040</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This morning's mail greeted us with TWO surprises. The first was the COVETED July/August issue "Best of 425" of 425 Magazine came EARLY and the second was that we WON Best Architect- AGAIN!

[caption id="attachment_1041" align="aligncenter" width="614"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/photo_bestof425_2012.jpg"><img class=" wp-image-1041 " title="photo_bestof425_2012" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/photo_bestof425_2012.jpg?w=1024" alt="" width="614" height="614" /></a> Thank you too all the readers of 425 Magazine who voted for us.[/caption]

425 Magazine is hosting the "Best of 425 Cocktail Party" tonight at the Blue Martini Lounge in Bellevue to recognize and celebrate all the nominees and winners of the annual accolade "Best of 425". We were of course already going to this as we have a number of friends and colleges up for nomination that we were looking forward to honoring. Only now, we get to celebrate WITH them!

If you have not had a chance to check out 425 Magazine, now would be a GREAT time to start. The "Best of 425" issue has 123 catagories from Home/Garden to Food/Entertainment (and much MUCH more) all voted on and chosen buy the readers of 425 Magazine (aka - YOU!)
We feel so blessed to be chosen again this year for this amazing honor. We feel this is a direct result of our commitment to our clients and the community. We love you guys.  Congratulations to all the winners. We'll see you tonight to celebrate!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Together we raised over $1000, and sent Scott to jail!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/06/27/together-we-raised-over-1000-and-sent-scott-to-jail/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 27 Jun 2012 23:54:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1050</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Last week we rallied the troops for a fund raiser benefiting the MDA (Muscular Dystrophy Association). Every year the MDA hosts "Lock-Up" where someone from your organization goes to "jail" to raise money for bail. Their "bail" money goes to the MDA to send kids to things like summer camp. This is truly an amazing organization that helps so many lives every day and they could not do it without the help of donors such as yourselves.
This year Scott Hommas went behind bars and together we raised enough money to send one child to map and THEN some.

We don't know who all the donors are, but you know who you are and we are thankful.
So we want to send a huge thank you to everyone.  It's because of your social sharing, your time, energy and donations that we were able to EXCEED our goal of sending one child to camp.

[caption id="attachment_1051" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/mda_thankyou_page_1.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1051" title="MDA_thankyou_Page_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/mda_thankyou_page_1.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> A very hearty thank you to all who contributed to this fundraiser.[/caption]]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Friday Fun - A SWAT Team send off</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/06/29/a-swat-team-send-off/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 29 Jun 2012 18:27:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1055</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One of our current underway projects is getting close to demo time. <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/underway/Waterfront_Reflections.html">Waterfront Reflections</a> is a beautiful home situated on an amazing piece of property on the shores of Lake Washington. The property has an existing structure which is scheduled to be demo'd very soon. But this particular home is going to get a special kind of send off, the kind only the SWAT team can give.

[caption id="attachment_1056" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/underway/Waterfront_Reflections.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-1056" title="large_5" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/large_5.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a> Rendering of our underway project Waterfront Reflections[/caption]

We were contacted by the SWAT team and asked if they could use the existing structure to train in before it was torn down. This seemed like a no brainer to us, but of course we needed to make sure this was legal AND safe, so we contacted the authorities.

The City of Bellevue is going to go check out the property and make sure everything will work out for everyone's best interest and let us know. We will keep you posted on the progress. Hopefully we can take pictures and talk with the officers as they train. Keep your fingers crossed!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Energy Savers: A look at geothermal temperature controls</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/07/02/energy-savers-a-look-at-geothermal-temperature-controls/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 02 Jul 2012 21:43:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1061</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Now that summer is here, so is the heat, and by <em>here</em> I don't mean Washington State as it's currently 63 and raining.  We have heard it is hot everywhere else though, so we thought we would share an amazing energy saving, renewable option for heating and cooling a home. One of our current underway projects, <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/underway/Deliberate_Demense.html">Deliberate Demense</a>, has decided to use a <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geothermal_heat_pump">Geothermal Heat Pump system</a>.

[caption id="attachment_1062" align="aligncenter" width="497"]<a href="http://jrbolton.com"><img class="size-full wp-image-1062 " title="loops_horizontal" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/loops_horizontal.jpg" alt="" width="497" height="343" /></a> An example of the horizontal geothermal ground loops used in this project[/caption]

Geothermal heating/cooling systems are amazingly efficient and cost effective with an average of 25%-50% decreased electricity usage when compared to conventional systems. Wow!
Here's how they work: the Earth's temperature is relatively constant regardless of the temperature above ground. Even when it's 115 degrees outside the ground beneath you is much cooler. Think of a cave. When the temperature outside the cave is sweltering, the cave is much cooler and visa versa when it's cold.

[caption id="attachment_1063" align="aligncenter" width="399"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/geoheat.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1063" title="Geoheat" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/geoheat.png" alt="" width="399" height="320" /></a> Ground temperature by depth[/caption]

Ditches are dug about 6 feet beneath the surface and tubes are put into places looping back and forth across the ground. A liquid is pumped through the tubes where it is either cooled down or heated up and then pumped back through the home thus regulating the temperature of the home. Another bonus is this system is super quiet unlike most A/C units and it also takes us considerably less space. Win Win!
If you are considering other options for heating or cooling your home geothermal is a place to start.

*images courtesy of <a href="https://www.google.com/search?um=1&amp;hl=en&amp;tbm=isch&amp;sa=1&amp;q=horizontal+loop+geothermal+heat&amp;oq=horizontal+loop+geothermal+heat&amp;gs_l=img.12..0i24.2922133.2922133.0.2923201.1.1.0.0.0.0.242.242.2-1.1.0...0.0.KrH0Hh76HrA&amp;pbx=1&amp;biw=1810&amp;bih=962&amp;cad=cbv&amp;sei=2BXyT8_gE8m1rQHT0qWOAg">Google</a>*]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1061</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2012-07-02 21:43:08</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2012-07-02 21:43:08</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>energy-savers-a-look-at-geothermal-temperature-controls</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="geothermal"><![CDATA[Geothermal]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="geothermal-heating-system"><![CDATA[Geothermal heating system]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="green-sustainable"><![CDATA[Green &amp; Sustainable]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="ground-loop"><![CDATA[Ground Loop]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="renewable-energy"><![CDATA[renewable energy]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="sustainable-energy"><![CDATA[sustainable energy]]></category>

	<item>
		<title>Friday NOT so fun: It&#039;s a coffee emergency people!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/07/06/friday-not-so-fun-its-a-coffee-emergency-people/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 06 Jul 2012 21:03:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1069</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I know that normally we do Friday Fun here on the Gelotte Hommas blog, but today is different. Today we are doing Friday NOT so fun. In fact, today we are talking about something down right horrific! I understand that after reading this post, many of you may "unsubscribe" to our blog posts on the sheer basis of Seattle ethics, but it needs to be said none the less. Here goes; Our coffee in the office SUCKS! This is in fact a travesty that has been going on since before the dinosaurs and we have decided enough is enough.
We are architects people. And do you know what you get when you add bad coffee and architects? Under PERFORMING architects, that's what!
I mean, look at this. Our senior project manager <a href="http://about.me/eric.drivdahl">Eric Drivdahl</a> has had to resort to being a coffee pauper!

[caption id="attachment_1071" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/coffee_pauper2.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1071" title="coffee_pauper2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/coffee_pauper2.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> His cup runneth EMPTY![/caption]

It's not pretty people. Our coffee pot sucks. SUCKS I tell you! So much so that it has been aptly named Old Yellow. You know, because it's old and yellow.

[caption id="attachment_1070" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/coffee_pauper1.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1070" title="coffee_pauper1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/coffee_pauper1.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> Old "Yellow"[/caption]

Anyway, we want a new coffee pot. We NEED a new coffee pot.  Not just for us, but for YOU too! Just imagine the next time you come to the GHA office you were greeted with GOOD coffee instead of the gasoline we are serving now!(Just being honest here.) The heavens would part and we would all skip around singing coffee songs whilst designing houses. Win win I tell ya.
We<em> love</em> Seattle. We agree with the unsaid Seattle code that states 'where there are people there shall also be good coffee'. We <em>want </em>to have good coffee, but we need your help. We are totally clueless about which type of coffee maker to buy.  There are literally thousands. Here are a few we found;

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/coffe_collage1.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1077" title="coffe_collage" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/coffe_collage1.png" alt="" width="560" height="388" /></a>

<dl class="wp-caption aligncenter"><dt class="wp-caption-dt"></dt><dd class="wp-caption-dd"></dd></dl>HALP! Leave us a comment and tell us what kind of coffee maker YOUR office has. Also, any suggestions on a particular kind of coffee would be helpful too. How about this, ANY coffee making advice would be greatly appreciated. Maybe we can get <a title="Our own Eric Drivdahl featured in “40 under 40″!" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/07/29/our-own-eric-drivdahl-featured-in-40-under-40%e2%80%b3/">Eric</a> off the street corner and back at his desk...]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

			<wp:comment_id>305</wp:comment_id>
			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[lakevillehomes]]></wp:comment_author>
			<wp:comment_author_email>jamie@lakevillehomes.com</wp:comment_author_email>
			<wp:comment_author_url>http://www.lakevillehomes.com</wp:comment_author_url>
			<wp:comment_author_IP>98.237.177.236</wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date>2012-07-06 21:33:50</wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt>2012-07-06 21:33:50</wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[We have a single cup brewer.  However, the environmentally conscious need to consider reusable k-cups if you go this route.  Also worth mentioning that I don't think it brews the best coffee--just too weak.  Which means you have to drink more coffee (could be a ploy, I'm not sure)

I once worked at an architecture firm that did a whole blind taste testing over several weeks to choose what kind of coffee to have/serve.  That "might" have been going a bit overboard.  But we're architects.  It's kind of important.

Good Luck!]]></wp:comment_content>

	<item>
		<title>Architecture inspired by nature</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/07/12/architecture-inspired-by-nature/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 12 Jul 2012 18:59:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1082</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One of our co-workers spent the last few days at Glacier National Park in Montana camping with her family.  Being surrounded by that much natural beauty one can't help but get inspired.

[caption id="attachment_1083" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/glacier.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1083" title="glacier" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/glacier.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> Lake McDonald inside Glacier National Park[/caption]

One of our principal's Scott Hommas is actually from Montana, and grew up not too far from Lake McDonald.  As a child Scott spent many summers exploring Glacier and all the beauty the park has to offer. The Lake McDonald Lodge is literally where Scott decided that he wanted to be an architect.

[caption id="attachment_1084" align="aligncenter" width="500"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/lakemcdonaldlodge.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1084" title="lakeMcdonaldLodge" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/lakemcdonaldlodge.jpg" alt="" width="500" height="333" /></a> Lake McDonald Lodge[/caption]

"The use of natural tree limbs inside the Lodge inspired me to want to be an architect. I wanted to design buildings just like that Lodge." -<em> Scott Hommas
</em>

[caption id="attachment_1085" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/lakemcdonaldlodgeinside.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1085" title="lakeMcdonaldLodgeInside" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/lakemcdonaldlodgeinside.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="373" /></a> The inside of Lake McDonald Lodge.[/caption]

<em> </em>Scott might not get to design cabin style architecture like the Lake McDonald Lodge every day, but loves his work and it shows.  Scott is not the only one either. We are truly blessed to have an office full of talent and heart. Here is just another example of the way our clients feel after working with Gelotte Hommas Architecture.
"Gentlemen,

Well, summer is (sort of) here again, and I just wanted to drop you a note to tell you how much we’re enjoying our outdoor space. And the larger master bedroom. And our new family room cabinets. And new kitchen island.  It’s all working out great. I’ve given out both of your names to several folks; I don’t know if it’s resulted in any actual additional business but I’ll keep it up.

Thanks for all of the hard work from both of you (and your teams). We’re really happy with the results.

-- William"
<em>William Kennedy, home owner
</em><a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/02/27/break-ground-on-an-outdoor-living-space-moroccan-monday/"><em>CLICK HERE for more info and to see pictures of William's home</em> </a>

&nbsp;

*Photos from flicker*]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[Getting In Touch With the Vernacular Style | Gelotte Hommas Architecture Blog]]></wp:comment_author>
			<wp:comment_author_email></wp:comment_author_email>
			<wp:comment_author_url>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2014/01/10/getting-in-touch-with-the-vernacular-style/</wp:comment_author_url>
			<wp:comment_author_IP>66.155.38.13</wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date>2014-01-10 12:52:31</wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt>2014-01-10 20:52:31</wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[[&#8230;] Hearing about the local vernacular when it comes to language is probably familiar to most people. Discussing a region&#8217;s vernacular architecture style, however, may be less common although the idea is the same. A vernacular architecture style is one that is native to an area and its people. It often has functional elements that are necessary for the local climate, and decorative aspects that are inspired by nature. [&#8230;]]]></wp:comment_content>
