	<item>
		<title>Architecting</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/07/19/architecting/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 19 Jul 2012 17:11:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1090</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We are updating a few of our marketing pieces around here. Our marketing guru Nikki is working on developing a custom font for some of these pieces and we wanted to share. The similarities of the <em>way </em>designing something looks is pretty universal. You stick to the basics of form and function, throw in some geometry, add a splash of economy and viola! You've got yourself a font (or a Truss.) Here take a look at this and you'll see what I mean.

[caption id="attachment_1092" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/truss-design.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1092" title="Truss Design" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/truss-design.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="579" /></a> This is a design concept for a Truss on a house.[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1091" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/sketch.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1091" title="sketch" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/sketch.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="933" /></a> This is a design concept for a window with a little bit of stained glass at the top.[/caption]

The use of geometry when architecting something is really key. The relationship between proportions and beauty, or appeal if you will, are very closely intertwined. You can't have one without the other.
Here is the back end of the font she is creating. Look at all that math!

[caption id="attachment_1093" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/font.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1093" title="font" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/font.png" alt="" width="560" height="292" /></a> The backend of the font design[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1094" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/custom-font.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1094" title="custom-font" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/custom-font.png" alt="" width="560" height="120" /></a> Here are a few letters ti give you an idea of how the font is coming along.[/caption]

So, whether you are architecting a home, a car, or a custom architecture font, the tools are the same. We are thinking of naming this font "Architecting" - what do you think?]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Bungalow style playhouse get&#039;s a new look!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/07/25/bungalow-style-playhouse-gets-a-new-look/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 25 Jul 2012 18:41:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1100</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We are architects, true, but we are also people. With families and friends who we care very much about. We feel a bit special in the fact that most of our clients become friends as well. To us this means we care about what they care about, and get involved. We're just like that.

One such client is involved in fund raising for the <a href="http://www.psbc.org/home/index.htm">Puget Sound Blood Center</a>. She approached us to see if we could help out with an auction to raise money for help with Hemophilia and other bleeding disorders. We of course said yes! Scott Hommas designed a super cute little playhouse reminiscent of a bungalow - complete with porch.

[caption id="attachment_1101" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/bungalowmerged.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1101" title="BungalowMerged" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/bungalowmerged.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="258" /></a> The playhouse Scott designed for the PSBC auction.[/caption]

Scott ran in to a problem though, we could design it sure, but we would need someone to build it. Scott got on the phone and called up Hamish Anderson of <a href="http://hamishanderson.com/">Hamish Anderson Custom Homes, Inc.</a> (<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/06/29/gha-spends-the-evening-celebrating-with-the-best-of-425/">2011 "Best Builder" in 425 Magazine</a>) and before too long he was on board to donate his time and materials to build the amazing playhouse.

The family who bought the playhouse contacted us recently and had us made a few adjustments so that it would match their home. We will be sure to post picts of the finished project when it's done.

Also, let the record show it will no longer be known as a "playhouse", instead it shall be known as the "Backyard Hangout" since this is for teenagers and not small children. :)

Do you have a playhouse in your backyard? Tell us about it!]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The website Houzz is an online magazine of sorts with the largest collection of interior design and decorating ideas on the Internet, including kitchens and bathrooms. Users browse over 500000 inspiring photos and 90000 "idea books."

Today we are being featured in the article "How to Work With An Architect."

Check it out here:
[houzz=http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/3182504/list/How-to-Work-With-an-Architect w=300]

Thanks Houzz!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The Olympics of Architecture</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/07/30/the-olympics-of-architecture/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Jul 2012 17:32:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1109</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[After watching the Olympic games opening this weekend, one can't help but be over whelmed by the historical and global significance these games have grown into.

From the start of the games in 776 BC in Olympia Greece, the architectural structures were just as important as the games themselves.  Here are a few picts of what's left of the original site of the first Olympic games.

[caption id="attachment_1110" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://www.timetravelturtle.com/2012/07/olympia-greece-ancient-olympics/"><img class="size-full wp-image-1110" title="greece_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/greece_2.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="373" /></a> image courtesy "Time Travel Turtle"[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1111" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://www.timetravelturtle.com/2012/07/olympia-greece-ancient-olympics/"><img class="size-full wp-image-1111" title="greece_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/greece_1.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="373" /></a> image courtesy of "Time Travel Turtle"[/caption]

The site consists of most of what you would imagine an Olympic games would. About a dozen larger structures between a bunch of scattered smaller ones. Sound familiar? Every four years as the Olympics moves around the globe we see new architectural feats popping up to accommodate the games. As the years pass we find ourselves comparing each opening ceremony to the preceding, as well as the structures they are held in. It seems the architecture alone has become it's own Olympic game. Let's look at some from this years Olympic games in London - there are some big names on this one.

We have all heard a lot about the USA swim team, so let's look at the <a href="http://www.zaha-hadid.com/architecture/london-aquatics-centre/">London Aquatics Center</a> first designed by world re-nound architect Zaha Hadid.

[caption id="attachment_1112" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://www.zaha-hadid.com/architecture/london-aquatics-centre/"><img class="size-full wp-image-1112" title="zaha_3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/zaha_3.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="472" /></a> The London Aquatics Center *images courtesy of Zaha Hadid Architects*[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1114" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://www.zaha-hadid.com/architecture/london-aquatics-centre/"><img class="size-full wp-image-1114" title="zaha_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/zaha_2.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="280" /></a> The London Aquatics Center *images courtesy of Zaha Hadid Architects*[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1113" align="aligncenter" width="562"]<a href="http://www.zaha-hadid.com/architecture/london-aquatics-centre/"><img class="size-full wp-image-1113" title="zaha_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/zaha_1.jpg" alt="" width="562" height="491" /></a> The London Aquatics Center *images courtesy of Zaha Hadid Architects*[/caption]

Let's take a look at the Velodrome now by <a href="http://www.hopkins.co.uk/s/projects/3/131/">Hopkins Architects</a>.

[caption id="attachment_1115" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://www.hopkins.co.uk/s/projects/3/131/"><img class="size-full wp-image-1115" title="hopkins_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/hopkins_2.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="388" /></a> The London 2012 Velodrome *images courtesy of Hopkins Architects*[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1116" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://www.hopkins.co.uk/s/projects/3/131/"><img class="size-full wp-image-1116" title="hopkins_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/hopkins_1.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="388" /></a> The Londond 2012 Velodrome *images courtesy of Hopkins Architects*[/caption]

Lastly, let's take a look at the London Olympic bridges by <a href="heneghan.peng">Heneghan Peng Architects</a>.

[caption id="attachment_1119" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://www.hparc.com/work/central-park-bridges-f06-at-the-london-2012-olympic-park/"><img class="size-full wp-image-1119" title="heneghan_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/heneghan_1.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="346" /></a> London 2012 Olympic bridges *image courtesy of Heneghan Peng Architects*[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1118" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/heneghan_2.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1118" title="heneghan_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/heneghan_2.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="346" /></a> London 2012 Olympic bridges *images courtesy of Heneghan Peng Architects*[/caption]

There are SO many more amazing architectural structure in London that were constructed for the Olympics. You can find a complete list of them and who designed them <a href="http://www.e-architect.co.uk/london/london_olympics_buildings.htm#.UBbF02FfF1E">here</a>.  Amazing super human feats that go into the tradition that has become the Olympic games; both the athletes AND the architects compete, only the architects do it silently and without medals.

I vote to add architecture to the 2016 Olympics in Rio De Janero. Who's with me?!?!]]></content:encoded>

		<title>greece_2</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/07/30/the-olympics-of-architecture/greece_2/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Jul 2012 16:52:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/greece_2.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>greece_2</wp:post_name>

		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

	<item>
		<title>Using concrete inside your home to achieve that &quot;homey&quot; feel</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/08/07/using-concrete-inside-your-home-to-achieve-that-homey-feel/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 07 Aug 2012 18:16:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1128</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[When most people think of concrete, they think of driveways or sidewalks. Here is one home that just might change that perception for the better.

&nbsp;

One of our project <em>House in a Mountain Meadow</em> utilizes a concrete wall that runs the length of the home. From room to room you can both see and feel the warmth and serenity radiating from the gorgeous use of concrete.
<div>Take a look at the new idea book  featuring House in a Mountain Meadow we posted on Houzz!</div>
<div></div>
<div><a href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/1329002/House-in-a-Mountain-Meadow-contemporary-living-room-seattle"><img src="http://st.houzz.com/simages/1329002_0_8-0945-contemporary-living-room.jpg" alt="" width="500" height="400" border="0" /></a></div>

	<item>
		<title>Welcome to the Luxe Interiors + Design Gold List 2012</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/08/13/welcome-to-the-luxe-interiors-design-gold-list-2012/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 13 Aug 2012 21:36:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1133</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Luxe Interiors &amp; Design Magazine is a fabulous magazine. Most magazine are over run with more verbiage in the articles than pictures. Not Luxe. Luxe knows what it's audience wants, and it delivers; stunning, high resolution images of interiors, exteriors and design. They hold true to their name by covering the most luxurious and decadent. Although our portfolio projects range in price tag, Gelotte Hommas has been featured in the pages of the magazine on more than one occasion - the most recent being the <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/04/20/our-project-classic-on-the-green-featured-in-this-months-issue-of-luxe-magazine/">Spring of this year </a>with our project <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Classic_On_The_Green.html#">Classic on The Green</a>.

[caption id="attachment_850" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/04/20/our-project-classic-on-the-green-featured-in-this-months-issue-of-luxe-magazine/"><img class="size-full wp-image-850" title="Classic_on_the_green_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/classic_on_the_green_11.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="362" /></a> Classic on the Green was featured in the Spring 2012 issue[/caption]

This summer, Luxe published their <em>Gold List </em>for the first time ever. This is the complete list of design professionals whom have been published in the magazine over the past year.
<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/goldlistlogos1.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1135" title="GoldListLogos(1)" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/goldlistlogos1.jpg" alt="" width="141" height="241" /></a>
We are truly honored to be featured in <em>The Gold List 2012. </em>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/magazine_pic.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1134" title="magazine_pic" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/magazine_pic-e1344893437481.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a>"I'm not entirely sure I know everyone that is on this list, but I know most of them, and this is a very prestigious list to be included in. What an honor." - Scott Hommas, <em>Principal</em>

If you have not had a chance to check out Luxe magazine yet, what are you waiting for? Just make sure you have a good amount of time blocked out to go through it. It is literally packed with inspiration.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>It&#039;s all About.me!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/08/16/its-all-about-me/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 16 Aug 2012 19:04:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1144</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[For all you designers out there - interior, architectural, graphic, engineeering, structural, and the like, there is a new social media site that you have to check out. It's called <a href="https://about.me/">About.Me</a>

<a href="https://about.me/"><img class="aligncenter  wp-image-1145" title="about.me_static" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/about-me_static.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="298" /></a>

This is an awesome site that compiles all of your networking sites into one easy place. You can showcase your <span style="color:#77ae99;"><a href="http://gelottehommas.com"><span style="color:#77ae99;">Website</span></a></span>, Instagram, <span style="color:#77ae99;"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/GHarchitecture#!/pages/Gelotte-Hommas-Architecture/106339399849"><span style="color:#77ae99;">Facebook</span></a></span>, <span style="color:#77ae99;"><a href="http://twitter.com/GelotteHommas"><span style="color:#77ae99;">Twitter</span></a></span>, <span style="color:#77ae99;"><a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com"><span style="color:#77ae99;">Blog</span></a></span> and whatever else you have all in one place. Your About.me page will consist of one large splash page with either a premade template, or you can make your own and upload. You can also add a bio (highly recommend) as well as keyword tags to higher your optimization. Take a look at ours!

[caption id="attachment_1146" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://about.me/gelotte_hommas"><img class="size-full wp-image-1146" title="about.me" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/about-me.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="298" /></a> Check out the Gelotte Hommas About.me page![/caption]

This is an extremely helpful site for organizing all of your internet savy info in one easy place. People who go to your About.me webiste they can quickly click/browse through all your info right there and NOW they have just added some really amazing new features!
<h1 style="text-align:center;"><strong>Look at all this!
</strong><a href="http://about.me/gelotte_hommas"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1147" title="about.me_features" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/about-me_features.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="246" /></a></h1>
With the ability to interact with an About.me page right there on the page the impact of your page just went from a static info page to a possible lead generation MACHINE! Plus (bonus) these pages look really, REALLY good. Go check it out! While you're there, go ahead and Fav (♥) our page - we promise to Fav (♥) you back!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Friday Fun - We&#039;re going to be on the radio!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/08/17/friday-fun-were-going-to-be-on-the-radio/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Aug 2012 17:12:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1153</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Everybody clear your schedules from 2-3 on Monday afternoon and tune your radio dials to 1150 AM KKNW. Curt Gelotte has been invited to be a guest on the Monday afternoon show<a href="http://1150kknw.com/headofthehouse"> "Head of the House."</a>

<a href="http://1150kknw.com/"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1154" title="logo_default" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/logo_default.png" alt="" width="340" height="124" /></a>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>Curt will be joining Alternative Talk's Newest Star - Louis Howard.</div>
<div>

[caption id="attachment_1155" align="alignleft" width="142"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/head-of-the-house.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1155 " title="head-of-the-house" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/head-of-the-house.jpg" alt="" width="142" height="133" /></a> Louis Howard, host of Head of the House[/caption]

</div>
<div></div>
<div><strong><em><a href="http://1150kknw.com/headofthehouse">Head of the House</a> </em></strong>Mondays from 2-3:00 pm. Host Louis Howard highlights the challenges facing working professionals in business, family and life.</div>
<div></div>
<div>Curt will be joining Howard to talk about the challenges of home design. Have you ever wondered what makes a old house look charming?  According to Curt it is a number of things. He will be discussing how time honored traditions and architectural practices seem to have been sacrificed in today's spec market.</div>
<div></div>
<div>Callers, and questions are encouraged as Curt and Louis invite you to be apart of the conversation!</div>
<div></div>
<div></div>
<h1><strong><span style="color:#77ae99;">BE A PART OF THE CONVERSATION!</span> </strong></h1>
<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/beastar_kknw_carousel_march.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1156" title="beastar_kknw_carousel_march" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/beastar_kknw_carousel_march.jpg" alt="" width="490" height="345" /></a>Listen in Monday from 2-3pm then call <span style="font-family:Times New Roman, serif;font-size:medium;">425.337-5527 with your questions or comments. They want to hear from you, so don't forget!
</span>
<div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Were you at Arc.I.Tek?</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/08/20/1164/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Aug 2012 22:57:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1164</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This past weekend was another Arc.I.Tek model making event, and we can't help be in awe of the inspiration and creative genius that comes from these events.

[caption id="attachment_1165" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/9.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1165" title="9" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/9.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="560" /></a> The materials are all laid out ready for the kids to dig in, and create something amazing.[/caption]

The age range was a little wider at this event from 1st to 10th grade.  The entire event is designed to educate the kids and introduce them to some concepts.

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/8.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1173" title="8" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/8.jpg?w=224" alt="" width="224" height="300" /></a> <a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/7.jpg"><img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-1172" title="7" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/7.jpg?w=224" alt="" width="224" height="300" /></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;
From there the design is totally in their hands. We are there to assist with any questions, or give them a little push when they get stuck creatively, but really, the kids do most of the heavy lifting.

&nbsp;

Here are some sneek peaks of some of the models we saw come out of this past weekend.

[caption id="attachment_1170" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<img class="size-full wp-image-1170" title="5" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/5.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="418" /> The numerous flowers boxes on this design are architected to be made out of 100% recycled materials![/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1169" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/4.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1169 " title="4" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/4.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="418" /></a> This architect was very concerned with bears getting to her garbage, so naturally she designed an electric fence around it. :)[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1168" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/3.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1168 " title="3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/3.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="749" /></a> I believe those are solar panels[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1167" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/2.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1167" title="2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/2.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="749" /></a> Check that window going all the way through the building![/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1166" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/1.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1166" title="1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/1.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="749" /></a> This view is top down of an underground parking lot complete with elevator.[/caption]

It's truly amazing to watch as out of cardboard, toothpicks, hot glue, construction paper, and other random materials comes the future of design. You never know. This just may what down town Seattle looks like in 2062. For us, it's really about connecting and sharing the story of creativity.

[caption id="attachment_1171" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/6.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1171" title="6" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/6.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="749" /></a> Curt Gelotte sitting with young Arc.I.Tek's Lola and Gosia as they sketch out their concepts.[/caption]

Sign up your kids for the last Arc.I.Tek event on September 15th.<a href="http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/239801">
Click here</a> and register your kiddos today!

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>6</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/08/20/1164/6-3/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Aug 2012 22:24:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/6.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Curt Gelotte sitting with young Arc.I.Tek's Lola and Gosia as they sketch out their concepts.]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1171</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2012-08-20 22:24:46</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2012-08-20 22:24:46</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>6-3</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>inherit</wp:status>

	<item>
		<title>We&#039;re already gearing up for the 20th annual Gingerbread Village!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/08/24/were-already-gearing-up-for-the-20th-annual-gingerbread-village/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 24 Aug 2012 21:51:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1185</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We love the holidays. It's true. We also are strong supporters of the Juvenile diabetes research foundation. So, obviously when the two are combined it's  win-win!
Every year for the past 20 years the Sheraton in Seattle and the JDRF partner to present the annual <em>Gingerbread Village</em>. Last year was our first year participating, but we are all set to jump in again this year.

Generally how the event goes is; a theme is chosen, the team's are formed and from there the competition is on! Voting for your favorite gingerbread house has always been a highlight of the event. Although the display is free to the general public, the Seattle Sheraton accepts donations throughout the event onsite on behalf of the Northwest JDRF chapter. All proceeds from the event go to the JDRF.

Last year the theme was <em>Holiday Express</em>, and Gelotte Hommas was on a team with the MBA of King &amp; Snohomish counties. We designed and built the Gare Du Palais in Quebec, Canada.

[caption id="attachment_1187" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/img_7777.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1187" title="IMG_7777" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/img_7777.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a> The gingerbread core of the Gare Du Palais[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1188" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/img_7793.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1188" title="IMG_7793" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/img_7793.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a> The 2011 finished masterpiece[/caption]

Here's a video of all the finished gingerbread houses last year.

[wpvideo L69dGyIU]

This year the theme is <em>Fairytale Castles. </em>We are more than thrilled to be on a team with the MBA again, and we have been assigned Aladdin's Castle!
The meeting's have already started, and we could not be more excited!
We obviously can't let you in on <em>all</em> the Team Aladdin secret's, but a few might be ok.
Here is our initial sketch. Yep, you guessed it - the top is going to be golden. Also, we thought a live tiger would be super,  although we are not quiet sure <em>how</em> to accomplish that task. We are open to suggestions...

[caption id="attachment_1189" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/mock_up_round1.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1189" title="mock_up_round1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/mock_up_round1.png" alt="" width="560" height="375" /></a> Team Aladdin for the 2012 20th annual Gingerbread Village[/caption]

We will keep you posted with updates and pic's as they come!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1185</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2012-08-24 21:51:25</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2012-08-24 21:51:25</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>were-already-gearing-up-for-the-20th-annual-gingerbread-village</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="20th-annual-gingerberad-village"><![CDATA[20th annual gingerberad village]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="events-happenings"><![CDATA[Events &amp; Happenings]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="gingerbread-castle"><![CDATA[Gingerbread Castle]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="gingerbread-houses"><![CDATA[Gingerbread houses]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="jdrf"><![CDATA[JDRF]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="mba-of-king-snohomish-counties"><![CDATA[MBA of King &amp; Snohomish counties]]></category>

	<item>
		<title>Our project &quot;The Brownswood Cabin&quot; is almost finished</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/08/30/our-project-the-brownswood-cabin-is-almost-finished/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 30 Aug 2012 23:18:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1195</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One of our <a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/underway.html">underway </a>projects <a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/underway/The_Brownswood_Cabin.html">"The Brownswood Cabin"</a> is getting close to completion.

[caption id="attachment_1197" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/brownswood_rendering.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1197" title="brownswood_rendering" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/brownswood_rendering.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a> The Brownswood Cabin rendering[/caption]

The contractor, <a href="http://woodridgecustomhomes.com/about-us/">Woodridge Custom Homes</a> in Cle Elum, Wa, sent us over from recent progress pictures. We love it when drawing start to come to life and project moves from the imagination into life.
<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/brownswood_underway_3.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1198" title="brownswood_underway_3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/brownswood_underway_3.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/brownswood_underway_1.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1199" title="brownswood_underway_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/brownswood_underway_1.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/brownswood_underway_2.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1200" title="brownswood_underway_2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/brownswood_underway_2.png" alt="" width="490" height="380" /></a>This cabin is 2,500 sq feet of rustic contemporary design that both  melds wonderfully, as well as stands out just enough from the gorgeous serene wooded setting.
Suncadia and Tumblecreek are popular vacation spots in eastern Washington. We have built a number of custom cabins there and we adore every one. Especially Scott Hommas. When designing for Tumblecreek or Suncadia, he gets to channel his Montana roots - can you tell?

This project is set to be finished around Christmas time. We will be sure to update you all with more progress picts. This one is going to be gorgeous to photograph professionally. We can't wait!

Just a side note - if any of you have ever headed over to our<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/client-recommendations/"> Client Recommendations</a> page you would see an amazing recommendation from tebrownmd. That is this client and he is speaking about this project. :) We have the best clients!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Friday Fun - Let&#039;s talk POOLS!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/08/31/friday-fun-lets-talk-pools/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 31 Aug 2012 16:56:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1206</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Happy Friday everyone. We received back some progress pictures on an underway project today <a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/underway/Touch_of_Normandy.html">A Touch of Normandy</a>. I will share those photo's with you next week, but let's not get sidetracked. This project is a two phase project. Phase 1 - Beach. Phase 2 - Cabana. Are you sensing a theme here? That's right - pools.

Speaking of pools, and considering this is Labor Day weekend, which for many of us is a final hurrah before all the kiddos go back to school. That could mean (as it does for my family) one more vacation before the crazy schedules start up again, or a quiet lazy weekend BBQ'ing with friends and family. Either way, fun and vacation usually conjoin around a pool. The pool in our project A Touch of Normandy might have some fancy tileing, it might not. My personal favorite for pools are the ones with gorgeous tile work along the bottom. I adore the look of how the water causes ocular illusions on the tiles transforming them into new shapes and then back again. The feel of the tile on your feet is amazing too. There is something about a marble pool that makes me feel like my vacation is complete. Check out some of these gorgeous pools with marble mosaics and then leave us a comment on what you are going to do this Labor Day Weekend. Will you be at a pool like this?

[caption id="attachment_1207" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/vetro_blue_02_7k0ome.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1207" title="vetro_blue_02_7K0oMe" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/vetro_blue_02_7k0ome.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="520" /></a> Look at the gorgeous blue detailing. Wouldn't his be amazing on the bottom of a pool?[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1209" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/piscina_mediterranea_03_btdkvr.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1209" title="piscina_mediterranea_03_btDkVR" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/piscina_mediterranea_03_btdkvr.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="520" /></a> I love the blue shades on this one[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1208" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/piscina_mediterranea_02_pebbi2.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1208" title="piscina_mediterranea_02_Pebbi2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/piscina_mediterranea_02_pebbi2.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="520" /></a> Paisley is a win win in my book, and I love how the detailing travels along the side wall on this one[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1210" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/piscina_mediterranea_05_h5rjjb.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1210" title="piscina_mediterranea_05_H5RjJb" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/08/piscina_mediterranea_05_h5rjjb.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="520" /></a> This is my fav. This mosaic pattern is both sophisticated and elegant.[/caption]

*Images courtesy of <a href="http://www.sicis.it/eng/Mosaic">SICIS</a> the <em>art mosaic factory</em>*]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Update on our project A Touch Of Normandy</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/09/06/update-on-our-project-a-touch-of-normandy/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 06 Sep 2012 23:19:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1215</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One of our projects <em><a href="http://gelottehommas.com/underway/Touch_of_Normandy.html">A Touch Of Normandy</a></em> is currently well underway.

[caption id="attachment_987" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/cover-rendering.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-987" title="COVER RENDERING" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/cover-rendering.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="350" /></a> A Touch of Normandy[/caption]

This is a two phase project with phase one, a Pool house,  scheduled to be completed very soon. Phase two is a cabana.
Here are some recent photos of the job site!
<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/2012-08-28-021.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1218" title="2012.08.28 021" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/2012-08-28-021.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/2012-08-28-022.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1219" title="2012.08.28 022" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/2012-08-28-022.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/2012-08-28-002.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1217" title="2012.08.28 002" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/2012-08-28-002.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="746" /></a>
<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/2012-08-28-028.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1216" title="2012.08.28 028" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/2012-08-28-028.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a>We will keep you posted with more underway pictures as the project wraps up.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Friday Fun - Houseboat Architect</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/09/07/friday-fun-boathouse-architect/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 07 Sep 2012 22:25:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1222</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Being a Seattle native architecture firm we have the pleasure of designing homes for some of natures most beautiful terrain's. All within the Washington border there is Rainforest, Lake Front, Beach Front, Wooded and Down Town city scapes. We have designed every possible type of home there is from Mediterranean to Cape Cod, and everything in between. We truly love our job as we get the pleasure of bringing your ideas to life. We are inspired daily by our clients dreams, and we never really know where they are going to take us. The one house style that we have yet to design is a house boat, and we are here to say we would LOVE to! We want to be a house boat architect too. Take a look at just a few of the gorgeous house boat's on Lake Union.

[caption id="attachment_1223" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/boathouse_2.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1223" title="Lake Union Floating Home" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/boathouse_2.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a> Very contemporary[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1226" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/houseboat_4.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1226" title="houseboat_4" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/houseboat_4.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="420" /></a> The view from inside the house boat[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1224" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/houseboat_1.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1224" title="houseboat_1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/houseboat_1.jpg" alt="" width="560" height="372" /></a> These house boats look similar to a few projects we have done![/caption]

The aboev house boats look similar to some of our projects <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Sammamish_Tuscan.html">Sammamish Tuscan</a> and <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Lakefront_Splendor.html">Lakefront Splendor</a>.

[caption id="attachment_1225" align="aligncenter" width="500"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/houseboat_3.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1225" title="houseboat_3" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/houseboat_3.jpg" alt="" width="500" height="400" /></a> A cute Shingle style boat house[/caption]

With a boat house you wake up everyday with a stunning view of the water. Here in Seattle; rain, or shine, in the snow or the heat the water is always gorgeous.
Are you thinking of downgrading in size maybe? Have you ever considered designing a boat house? We would absolutely LOVE to be your architect. Give us a call and let's talk about your boat house dream.

<em>*Images courtesy of Bing</em>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Arc.I.Tek model showcase</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/09/17/arc-i-tek-model-showcase/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 17 Sep 2012 18:54:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1231</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This past weekend was Arc.I.Tek. Scott and Eric came to help out this time and, again, it was a blast! The kids have ultimately three hours to design and build their models. That might seem like a really long time, but the number one thing we have happen is the kids run out of time and are rushing at the end. It's true what they say - time fly's when you're having fun!
From a train station to a flying house and everything in between. These kids never cease to amaze us.
Take a look at some of the amazing  model's that came out of this past weekend:

[caption id="attachment_1236" align="aligncenter" width="225"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/img_0101.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1236" title="IMG_0101" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/img_0101.jpg?w=225" alt="" width="225" height="300" /></a> A flying house![/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1243" align="aligncenter" width="300"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/img_0124.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1243" title="IMG_0124" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/img_0124.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="225" /></a> A Community Center and Garden[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1238" align="aligncenter" width="300"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/img_0108.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1238" title="IMG_0108" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/img_0108.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="225" /></a> An upcylced bridge with a garden on top[/caption]

The kids have a blast and in the end we can't help but have a bit of fun too. Scott was inspired to design a super hero in tribute to the Arc.I.Tek's. He did a pretty good job!

[caption id="attachment_1244" align="aligncenter" width="1024"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/img_0044.jpg"><img class="size-large wp-image-1244" title="IMG_0044" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/img_0044.jpg?w=1024" alt="" width="1024" height="768" /></a> The Super Hero[/caption]

Soon we will be adding all the models to the Arc.I.Tek website to begin the voting phase of our workshops. Stay tuned and don't forget to vote!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Nominate GHA on Houzz &#038; get entered to win an iPad. Win-Win!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/09/20/nominate-gha-on-houzz-get-entered-to-win-an-ipad-win-win/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 20 Sep 2012 18:59:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1248</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[As most of you know we love the online database <a href="http://www.houzz.com/pro/gelottehommas">Houzz.com.</a> From Architects, to Interior designers Houzz showcases design professionals nationwide. If you are looking for someone to help you with your next remodel, paint colors for your bathroom, tile for your kitchen, or some new trees to plant in your garden - then Houzz is your dream come true. You can chat with like-minded decorating  individuals and get feedback to all of life's little home improvements questions.

Has Gelotte Hommas worked with you on a project in 2012? If so, then would you mind taking 5 minutes to recommend us on Houzz?
<strong>UPDATE: <span style="color:#77ae99;">If you recommend us</span></strong> on Houzz <strong><span style="color:#77ae99;">you will be entered</span></strong> into the monthly drawing to <strong><span style="color:#77ae99;">win an </span><span style="color:#77ae99;">iPa</span></strong><span style="color:#77ae99;">d!</span>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/recommend-us.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1249" title="RECOMMEND-US" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/recommend-us.jpg" alt="" width="467" height="350" /></a>

<span style="color:#000000;">It's super easy to write a review and enter the drawing. Here's what you do:</span>

1) click <a href="http://www.houzz.com/writeReview/cmd=r/n=gelottehommas">THIS LINK</a> (which will take you to the Houzz website)

2) Fill in info about your particular project

3) Click Submit and you're done!

We have found Houzz to be a great forum for both exiting clients as well as potential clients thanks to recommendations such as these. We are very appreciative.

Thanks everyone and Good luck on that iPad!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>New project underway: Ravenswood Farm</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/09/26/new-project-underway-ravenswood-farm/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 26 Sep 2012 22:57:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1258</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We have a new project that is underway called <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/underway/Ravenswood_Farm.html">Ravenswood Farm.</a>

This client has an existing structure on their gorgeous view property right in the heart of Issaquah.

After tear down there will be a 5,500 square foot Farmhouse style home. The design is centered around taking advantage of the amazing property views.

[caption id="attachment_1259" align="aligncenter" width="1024"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/underway/Ravenswood_Farm.html"><img class="size-large wp-image-1259" title="Ravenswood Farm 1" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/ravenswood-farm-1.jpg?w=1024" alt="" width="1024" height="768" /></a> Check out the stunning view from the existing deck.[/caption]

This is going to be an spectacular project. We will keep you updated as we break ground for demo and then as the new structure goes up!

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Ravenswood Farm 1</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/09/26/new-project-underway-ravenswood-farm/ravenswood-farm-1/</link>

	<item>
		<title>Friday Fun - our most popular fall paint palette&#039;s</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/10/05/friday-fun-our-most-popular-fall-paint-palettes/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 05 Oct 2012 19:44:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1262</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Happy Friday everyone! We have are members of the Houzz.com community. On this community we receive comments and questions from fabric to paint colors. We thought we would take our five most popular projects on Houzz and make a fun inf graphic broken them down by the paint color! These are gorgeous colors that come from stunning projects (if we do say so ourselves). Take a look and if you love any of these palettes leave us a comment.

<a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/4700069/thumbs/Our-five-most-popular-projects-broken-down-by-paint-color-"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1267" title="houzz_color_palette" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/houzz_color_palette2.png" alt="" width="560" height="2484" /></a>

*Please note that the paint colors listed are not necessarily the exact paint colors used by the designers in the homes, nor are we suggesting they are.
Paint colors may vary and look different that they appear.*]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The old is new again: architectural salvage</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/10/08/the-old-is-new-again-architectural-salvage/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 08 Oct 2012 22:38:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1271</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This past weekend Curt Gelotte headed out to a meeting with a potential client. He visited a piece of property with a home on it that has been abandoned for the past 15 years. The property is beautiful, but it looks like the house will not be salvageable. IT does however have some amazing pieces to it that are definitely salvageable, and this is actually pretty common!

<a href="http://www.re-store.org/index.php"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1273" title="500_web_doorknoblayout" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/500_web_doorknoblayout.gif" alt="" width="500" height="393" /></a>

As we all know, fashion and what is "in" goes in cycles. Right now antique is in. Vintage is cool. Although there are tons of ways on Pinterest to make something LOOK vintage, the best way to really get that vintage look is to use something antique. There are tons of places that will come that specialize in both selling and helping you to remove salvageable pieces from your old property.
A great example of this is <a href="http://www.re-store.org/index.php">The RE Store</a> in Seattle or Bellingham. They sell everything from old vintage claw foot bathtubs, to stained glass windows, door pulls, cabinets, you name it - they have it. Whether you are an architect or just a weekend warrior, this store is always fun way to spend an afternoon dreaming.
<a href="http://www.re-store.org/index.php"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1272" title="500_web_sinklayout" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/500_web_sinklayout.gif" alt="" width="500" height="393" /></a>

Are you planning on updating your house to have some vintage charm? Leave us a comment and let us know about it. We would also love to know about any re-use stores you regular that we may not know about.

Happy hunting!
*images courtesy of The Re Store]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We did a walk though today on a home that was completed not too long ago.

This is a breathtaking located home in Grand Ridge.

Tons of natural light fill this home and you can't help but feel at peace with your surroundings when you enter the property.
This home is set to be photographed next week, but here is a sneak peek.

Meet the GHA project 'The Tree's OutBack'

[caption id="attachment_1276" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/exterior2.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1276" title="exterior2" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/exterior2.jpg" height="418" width="560" /></a> Extensive windows adorn this home[/caption]

		<title>exterior2</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/10/11/photography-sneak-peek/exterior2/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 11 Oct 2012 23:50:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Friday Fun - Annual Awesome Pumpkin Carving!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/10/19/friday-fun-annual-awesome-pumpkin-carving/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 19 Oct 2012 20:59:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1280</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Every year our very own project manager Curtis Peterson gets to work carving elaborate pumpkins. These aren't your regular run-of-the-mill triangle eyed, jagged toothy grin, looks like my 8 year old carve it. These pumpkin are true works of art. Take a look.

[caption id="attachment_1281" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/2012-04.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1281" title="2012-04" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/2012-04.jpg" height="746" width="560" /></a> Look at that detailing[/caption]

Each pumpkin is hand carved taking about 3-4 hours to create.

[caption id="attachment_1283" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/2012-03.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1283" title="2012-03" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/2012-03.jpg" height="746" width="560" /></a> The nose ring is a separate piece Curt carves out and attaches later[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1282" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/2012-02.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1282" title="2012-02" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/2012-02.jpg" height="746" width="560" /></a> Frankenstein[/caption]

Curt carves these up right up until Halloween entering some into competitions, while others are on display at local businesses.
When asked what his process and inspiration are this is what Curt said:
"I use clay loop tools most of the time… (I like the Kemper tools brand. These seems to be the sturdiest I’ve found so far) in addition to x-acto knives, carving knifes, brillo pads, scotch brite pads, etc. Anything and everything that can be used to remove pumpkin is a tool.

Inspiration? Anything really… seeing a funny face in a magazine or on the internet.  Making a face in a mirror works.  Sometimes just making one up can be fun. I highly recommend working from reference though.  It’s the best way to learn the anatomy of a face, how it works, how wrinkles work, etc."

Thanks Curt! As he carves more pumpkins we will post them. Happy carving!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>20th annual Gingerbread Village UPDATE</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/10/24/gingerbread_village_update/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 24 Oct 2012 23:21:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1287</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Our team gingerbread house: Aladdin's Castle, is getting closer and  closer to completion.

With only 4 &amp; 1/2 weeks until the Grand Unveiling at the Sheraton in Seattle our team has been kept plenty busy!
Since we last updated here is the progress we have had:
1) Designed and fabricated the towers
2) Designed and fabricated the Orbs sit on top of the towers
3) This is the most exciting - we were assigned our ELF!

First I will start with our Elf this year as really this is what this event is all about. We are so proud to announce our Elf:  Miss Julianna. Julianna is 8 years old and has lived with type 1 diabetes since being diagnosed on Christmas day in 2008 at just four years old. Since then team Julianna has raised more than $60,000 towards juvenile diabetes. Woo Hoo!

From lemonade stands to bake sales Julianna is very involved in helping raise money to find a cure to Type 1 diabetes - and she is just a DOLL! We are all delighted to have Julianna on our team.

[caption id="attachment_1288" align="aligncenter" width="300"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/img_1307.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1288" title="IMG_1307" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/img_1307.jpg?w=300" height="224" width="300" /></a> Miss Julianna, her mom, her little sister and one of the fellow chef's from the MBA[/caption]

Now, we all know that Aladdin's castle has tall towers with orbs on top. The main problem we faced was how we were going to achieve the goldeness as well as the shape of the orbs. Well, luckily for us we have one crafty architect on our hands who quickly set out to solve the problem.
Eric very crafily decided to crate the shape and foundation for the towers out of bent tin. He hand cut and shaped each one (how many bandaids he had when all was said and done - we will never know.) Take a look at his process!
<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/aladdin-2.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-1291" title="Aladdin-2" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/aladdin-2.jpg?w=199" height="300" width="199" /></a>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/aladdin-1.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-1290" title="Aladdin-1" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/aladdin-1.jpg?w=300" height="199" width="300" /></a>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/aladdin-4.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-1289" title="Aladdin-4" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/aladdin-4.jpg?w=300" height="199" width="300" /></a>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/aladdin-3.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-1292" title="Aladdin-3" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/aladdin-3.jpg?w=199" height="300" width="199" /></a>Once the towers were all finished then we set to work figuring out how to get that signature look of the orbs. It wasn't too long and our team had that figured out too, and it was blown sugar.
Some of our team contacted the Lake Washington Votech school and they were delighted to help us with the blown sugar endeavor. Even our elf came out to help us!
It is quiet the process with careful handling required, but the end result is gonna be amazing on the gingerbread castle.

[caption id="attachment_1294" align="aligncenter" width="300"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/img_1287.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1294" title="IMG_1287" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/img_1287.jpg?w=300" height="224" width="300" /></a> Starts off as a big gooey blob of melted sugar[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1295" align="aligncenter" width="300"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/img_1289.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1295" title="IMG_1289" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/img_1289.jpg?w=300" height="224" width="300" /></a> Then you start to stretch the sugar[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1296" align="aligncenter" width="300"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/img_1309.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1296" title="IMG_1309" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/img_1309.jpg?w=300" height="224" width="300" /></a> Once the desired consistency is reached you put the blob on the end of a hand pump and carefully inflate it[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1297" align="aligncenter" width="300"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/img_1311.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1297" title="IMG_1311" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/img_1311.jpg?w=300" height="224" width="300" /></a> Our Elf is helping Eric get the Orb just right![/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1298" align="aligncenter" width="300"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/img_1312.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1298" title="IMG_1312" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/img_1312.jpg?w=300" height="224" width="300" /></a> Almost done![/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1299" align="aligncenter" width="224"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/img_1318.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1299" title="IMG_1318" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/img_1318.jpg?w=224" height="300" width="224" /></a> Finished orbs - BEFORE we painted them[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1300" align="aligncenter" width="224"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/img_1300.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1300" title="IMG_1300" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/img_1300.jpg?w=224" height="300" width="224" /></a> They are gonna look AMAZING![/caption]

Great job Team Aladdin's Castle and thank you so much to our Elf Julianna and her family for coming out to help out!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The Woods Outback</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/10/31/the-woods-outback/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 31 Oct 2012 22:09:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1312</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The Woods Outback is a gem tucked away in the highlands of Issaquah. Although it's located in rainy state of Washington, this home was designed to inter-fuse with the gorgeous green Pacific Northwest scenery.

[caption id="attachment_1313" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/The_Woods_Outback.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-1313" title="Issaquah Highland House" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/b_coulter2.jpg" height="419" width="560" /></a> The Woods Outback nestled into the surrounding Pacific Northwest scenery[/caption]

The extensive landscaping, Solartubes, and strategically placed windows throughout the home help to bring in the natural light and ambiance of the surrounding forest indoors.

<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/The_Woods_Outback.html"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1314" title="Issaquah Highland House" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/d_coulter4.jpg" height="419" width="560" /></a>

The most unique feature of this home is the outdoor living area that is completely enclosed with sliding doors. Come rain or shine this cozy space doesn't loose it functionality or usability.

[caption id="attachment_1315" align="aligncenter" width="435"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/The_Woods_Outback.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-1315" title="The_Woods_Outback" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/10/the_woods_outback.jpg" height="326" width="435" /></a> The outdoor living space is fully enclosed with sliding Nanawalls[/caption]

To see the rest of this gorgeous Pacific Northwest contemporary home please visit the gallery page on our website by clicking <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/The_Woods_Outback.html">here.</a>
*Photography by <a href="http://www.benschneiderphoto.com/">Ben Benschneider</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Can we blog everyday for a MONTH?</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/11/01/can-we-blog-everyday-for-a-month/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 01 Nov 2012 22:26:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1317</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[November is <a href="http://www.marketwire.com/press-release/media-alert-november-is-national-blog-posting-month-nablopomo-now-hosted-by-blogher-1581191.htm">national blog posting month, </a>now hosted by <a href="http://www.blogher.com/about-this-network">blogher</a>, and to celebrate it bloggers are asked to post ever day for a month. Whoa!
They posts don't have to be lengthy, just a little blurb would be fine. This is an effort to promote, and give more attention, to blogging. Posting everyday for a month sounds a bit steep, but we are up for a challenge. We would appreciate some feed back as we go, so please feel free to share what we blog and leave us a comment!
Thanks for reading and wish us luck!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1317</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_date_gmt>2012-11-01 22:26:24</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>can-we-blog-everyday-for-a-month</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

	<item>
		<title>Friday Fun - Project update for Deliberate Dimense</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/11/02/friday-fun-project-update-for-deliberate-dimense/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 02 Nov 2012 18:06:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1319</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The last time we visited our project <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/underway/Deliberate_Demense.html">Deliberate Dimense</a> we were in demo phase. That was 5 months ago. Let's go take a peek at what's going on now!
<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/img_1406.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1322" title="IMG_1406" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/img_1406.jpg" height="418" width="560" /></a>
As you can see the framing is almost complete, and the house is taking shape! You can see the general layout of the home as well, and pretty much make out where everything is going to go.

The openings and room sizes are clearly seen. And finally all the views that will be seen have been boxed out awaiting windows in them. Don't mind all the mud - landscaping is coming!

&nbsp;

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/img_1378.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1320" title="IMG_1378" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/img_1378.jpg" height="418" width="560" /></a>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/img_1402.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1321" title="IMG_1402" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/img_1402.jpg" height="418" width="560" /></a>

The next steps are roughing in mechanical, electrical and plumbing. Oh - and take a look at the mock up of the rock exterior!

[caption id="attachment_1323" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/img_1407.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1323" title="IMG_1407" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/img_1407.jpg" height="418" width="560" /></a> Gorgeous contemporary rock exterior going up on Deliberate Demense[/caption]

The project is moving along!

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Our project The Wood Outback was featured on Inhabitat</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/11/06/our-project-the-wood-outback-was-featured-on-inhabitat/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 06 Nov 2012 00:24:51 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1325</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Inhabitat.com is a weblog "devoted to the future of design, tracking the innovations in technology, practices and materials that are pushing architecture and home design towards a smarter and more sustainable future."

This is a really great blog that is updated daily with all sorts of interesting and relevant information on the worlds "goings on". We always feel so honored when we get mentioned in a blog, or featured in an article, and this one is no different. Thank you Inhabitat for featuring us!

Go check out the article <a href="http://inhabitat.com/this-woods-outback-in-washington-state-boasts-beautiful-open-spaces-that-meld-with-the-outdoors/">HERE</a>.

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

		<title>New renderings of one of our underway projects Deliberate Demense</title>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We received renderings on one of our projects Deliberate Demense today. Take a look!

[caption id="attachment_1329" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/front-view-autocourt.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1329" title="Front View - Autocourt" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/front-view-autocourt.jpg" height="366" width="560" /></a> Front view showing the showing the auto court[/caption]

	<item>
		<title>Our cardboard cottage is going up for bid!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/11/09/our-cardboard-cottage-is-going-up-for-bid/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 09 Nov 2012 00:54:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1342</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The very last cardboard playhouse in the 2012 "Cottage" edition is headed for the auction block.

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/cardboard-cottage_02.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1355" title="cardboard-cottage_02" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/cardboard-cottage_02.png" height="437" width="327" /></a>

The radio station <a href="spirit1053auction.com/?">Spirit 105.3 </a>hosts an annual auction that all proceeds go the World Vision and the Seattle Urban Academy. We had one cardboard cottage left, and we couldn't think of a better place to have it go. So, tune in to <a href="spirit1053auction.com/?">Spirit 105.3 FM</a> and listen for instructions on how to bid on the LAST 2012 model of the cardboard cottage, or just <a href="spirit1053auction.com/?">CLICK HERE</a> to go to their website.

The 2013 model is just around the corner. What do you think we will come up with this year?

UPDATE: The cottage is LIVE and will be accepting bids as of  December 1st.
It's listed under the "Children" catergory.
Don't forget to place your bids!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_metadata</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:4:{s:5:"width";i:637;s:6:"height";i:437;s:4:"file";s:97:"/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/723/30761957/files/2012/11/gha_cardboard_cottage.png";s:10:"image_meta";a:10:{s:8:"aperture";i:0;s:6:"credit";s:0:"";s:6:"camera";s:0:"";s:7:"caption";s:0:"";s:17:"created_timestamp";i:0;s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";i:0;s:3:"iso";i:0;s:13:"shutter_speed";i:0;s:5:"title";s:0:"";}}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Friday Fun - The Aqua Nook</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/11/09/friday-fun-the-aqua-nook/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 09 Nov 2012 19:17:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1345</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Happy Friday everyone! Here is Seattle our Friday is bright and filled with - FISH! That's right, fish. One of our underway projects has had a fun turn of design over the last few days and I wanted to share.

In our project "The Redmond Residence" there is a grand entrance leading you into hallway that horizontally spans the length of the house with all the rooms branching off. At one end of the hallway is a little nook. Originally (as you can see from the sketch below) the center point of this little nook was going to be a fireplace.

[caption id="attachment_1346" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/fireplace_sketch.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1346" title="fireplace_sketch" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/fireplace_sketch.png" height="380" width="490" /></a> The view looking down the hallway towards the nook.[/caption]

Now the plan has changed, and so has the name. Now the view at the end of the hallway is going to be a massive 3' by 5' fish tank.

[caption id="attachment_1339" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/fish_tank_2_05_05.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1339" title="Fish_tank_2_05_05" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/fish_tank_2_05_05.png" height="192" width="560" /></a> Looking at the fish tank wall straight on[/caption]

How fun is that! This little nook is basically a transparent wall (minus the oceanic scene of course) with little portholes on either side.
Here is a view from the top down to give you an idea.

[caption id="attachment_1337" align="aligncenter" width="179"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/fish_tank_for_blog_02.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1337" title="Fish_tank_for_blog_02" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/fish_tank_for_blog_02.png" height="115" width="179" /></a> You can see the portholes off to either side[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">An Aqua Nook!</p>
<p style="text-align:center;">This is just one amazing feature to this great project.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
