	<item>
		<title>A holiday gift guide GHA style</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/11/13/a-holiday-gift-guide-gha-style/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 13 Nov 2012 00:55:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1359</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Happy Monday all!

It is that time of year again where; no matter what your traditions are, who/what you are remembering, what you are eating, or how many gifts you are giving the fact is we are all celebrating. This wonderful time of year is where everyone across the globe agrees that families are universal, and we love them.

We consider our clients to be part of our family, and every year we look at getting client gifts. I can be known to spend quiet a bit of time trying to find the perfect gifts for our clients. This year I thought I would share some of my findings, and BONUS they are all around $25!

<a href="http://www.etsy.com/?ref=so_home">ETSY </a>is a super great place to find literally anything and everything. Most things on here are handmade and sometimes you can get custom orders with your logo. Score! Etsy is where I found <a href="http://www.etsy.com/listing/114842318/personalized-wine-charms-sterling-silver?ref=sr_gallery_7&amp;ga_search_query=gifts&amp;ga_view_type=gallery&amp;ga_ship_to=US&amp;ga_search_type=handmade">THESE</a> and <a href="http://www.etsy.com/listing/90956795/snowflakes-black-acrylic-lasercut">THESE</a>. Remember - most of these can be made with YOUR custom image or logo. Just ask the store owner and see what they say!

Another really great gift site is Uncommon Goods where I found <a href="http://www.uncommongoods.com/product/egg-tangram-set">THIS  </a>which you could make your own little card of your logo out of those little blocks and place it in there for some extra brand push. So fun!

Edible stuff is always welcomed (I know we love it when the holiday baskets come rolling in) So here are some different spins on that.

Macaroons are hugley popular this year, and they come in all sorts of fun colors!
<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/macaroons.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1363" title="macaroons" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/macaroons.jpg" height="372" width="560" /></a>
<a href="http://www.etsy.com/listing/71871868/one-dozen-french-macaroons-lemon?utm_source=googleproduct&amp;utm_medium=syndication&amp;utm_campaign=GPS&amp;gclid=CKePwqHZyrMCFcxcMgodGy8A6Q">HERE </a>is a seller were you can pick and choose which colors you want. How about your brand colors for some extra pizazz?
Chocolate is just a classic. <a href="http://www.deandeluca.com/candy-and-confections/chocolates/dean-andamp-deluca-ballotins.aspx">HERE </a>is a website with some amazing stuff within a reasonable price range.

Winter also means cold weather. I found some amazing holiday coffee <a href="http://www.barringtoncoffee.com/blog/geishas-for-the-holidays">HERE</a>, and if you're not a coffee drinker than <a href="http://www.deandeluca.com/coffee-tea-cocoa/tea-by-type/black-tea/mariage-freres-marco-polo.aspx">THIS </a>tea is fun too. Or, how about a travel mug? <a href="http://www.etsy.com/listing/112576575/custom-hand-painted-porcelain-travel-mug?ref=sr_gallery_35&amp;ga_search_query=travel+mug&amp;ga_view_type=gallery&amp;ga_ship_to=US&amp;ga_search_type=all">THIS </a>one is pretty nice. (don't forget to ask about adding your brand for that extra little reminder)

We are a firm in Seattle, but that is not to say that we were not effected by Super storm Sandy.
<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/sandy_2.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1362" title="sandy_2" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/sandy_2.jpg" height="691" width="560" /></a>
If you are going to be purchasing some holiday gifts this year, maybe thinking about getting something that will benefit more than one person. ETSY has a number of sellers donating profits to relief efforts from the super storm. I personally really like <a href="http://www.etsy.com/listing/114195106/hurricane-sandy-relief-seaside-heights?ref=sr_gallery_3&amp;sref=sr_0d63c92bb72dddcb49665862dfd550e76226573a89593eb168a44892e3220c1d_1352767710_14477132_hurricane&amp;ga_search_query=hurricane+sandy&amp;ga_view_type=gallery&amp;ga_ship_to=US&amp;ga_search_type=all">THIS </a>and <a href="http://www.etsy.com/listing/87621559/ferris-wheel-8x10-large-size-fine-art?ref=sr_gallery_33&amp;ga_search_query=hurricane+sandy&amp;ga_view_type=gallery&amp;ga_ship_to=US&amp;ga_page=12&amp;ga_search_type=handmade">THIS</a>.

I haven't quiet figured out what we are going to do about corporate gifts this year, but I am really excited and we will keep you posted!
If you know what you are going to do, leave us a comment! We would love to know how you celebrate the holidays with your clients.]]></content:encoded>

		<pubDate>Tue, 13 Nov 2012 00:57:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1363</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2012-11-13 00:57:47</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2012-11-13 00:57:47</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

		<wp:post_name>macaroons</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>inherit</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>1359</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>attachment</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:attachment_url>https://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/macaroons.jpg</wp:attachment_url>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_wp_attached_file</wp:meta_key>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>A Man-Cave like no other</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/11/17/a-man-cave-like-no-other/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 17 Nov 2012 00:46:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1367</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This fully custom designed steel structure is the perfect man cave for any red-blooded male.
<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/large_1.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1368" title="Large_1" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/large_1.png" height="380" width="490" /></a>
Being that it is built in the Pacific Northwest, from top to bottom, although electic, the design holds a Native American air.

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/leven-totem.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1369" title="Leven Totem" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/leven-totem.jpg" height="800" width="532" /></a>

With a 3,000 sf garage capable of holding over 20+ cars on custom fabricated car lifts for his "toys" as well as an over 1,000 sf of suspended living space for the gym.

[caption id="attachment_1371" align="aligncenter" width="450"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/a_taj1.png"><img class="wp-image-1371 " title="a_Taj1" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/a_taj1.png" height="337" width="450" /></a> What man cave would be complete without restored vintage race cars?[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1372" align="aligncenter" width="428"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/f_taj6.png"><img class="wp-image-1372 " title="f_Taj6" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/f_taj6.png" height="320" width="428" /></a> The gym over looks out over the garage and the suspended helicopter[/caption]

The two disconnected living spaces are connected by a catwalk suspended over the cars giving you an up close look at the helicopter hanging from the ceiling.

[caption id="attachment_1370" align="aligncenter" width="450"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/g_taj7.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1370 " title="g_Taj7" alt="" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/11/g_taj7.png" height="337" width="450" /></a> Quiet a view from the catwalk![/caption]

We think any one would agree that this garage is function and form for the car enthusiast in all of us.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Holiday Happenings! Part 1</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/18/holiday-happenings-part-1/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 18 Dec 2012 01:22:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1380</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Whew! What a crazy couple of weeks it has been getting ready for Christmas. Here at the office we go all out. It starts with designing our unique custom Christmas cards every year. This process probably should start around June 1st, but who are we kidding here. I am just not that far ahead of the game. So instead this was started around Thanksgiving. This year Curt Gelotte designed an spectacular snowflake using the fibonacci sequence.

<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/18/holiday-happenings-part-1/2012-card-model-1/" rel="attachment wp-att-1382"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1382" alt="2012-CARD-Model-(1)" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/12/2012-card-model-1.jpg" width="399" height="598" /></a> <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/18/holiday-happenings-part-1/2012-card-geometry/" rel="attachment wp-att-1383"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1383" alt="2012-CARD-Geometry" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/12/2012-card-geometry.jpg" width="560" height="544" /></a>

Then we transferred the design onto a ceramic wooden block and hand carved it out.
<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/18/holiday-happenings-part-1/image/" rel="attachment wp-att-1385"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1385" alt="image" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/12/image.jpeg" width="532" height="399" />
<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?attachment_id=1386" rel="attachment wp-att-1386"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1386" alt="snowflake2" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/12/snowflake2.jpeg" width="560" height="560" /></a></a>
Finally we hand stamped it with gorgeous blue ink on watercolor paper.
<img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1387" alt="snowflake_front_2012" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/12/snowflake_front_2012.jpg" width="560" height="784" />
The cards this year are truly a work of art. Leave a comment and let me know if you would like to be included on our Christmas card list this year.

What we are <em>really</em> excited about though are our Christmas gifts this year. We will post about those tomorrow.
We heard that snow might be on the way tonight, so stay warm!

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Holiday Happeneings! Part II</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/19/holiday-happeneings-part-ii/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 19 Dec 2012 22:14:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1394</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We love the holidays, and we love all of our clients. The way we see it this is a perfect time for us to put some extra effort into tell you all just how much. On Monday we blogged about our Christmas cards. If you missed that you can read about them <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/18/holiday-happenings-part-1/">here</a>. They are truly a work of art, but we didn't stop there. This we decided to go a different route and started a fun new holiday tradition in the process.

In years past we have done the traditional gifts that everyone both expects and loves. Harry &amp; David gift baskets and Frans chocolate truffles were the choice for a few years. A few years ago we started getting a bit more crafty and sent out wine bottles with a custom designed Gelotte Hommas Architecture label. The next year we sent beautiful little tree ornaments with a GHA sterling silver tag hung from the top. This year however we wanted to do something that reflected our creativity a bit more, and we think we hit the jackpot.

As architects we are first artists. Our tag line is "The Art of Architecture" and all you have to do is look at some of our watercolors to know it's more than a slogan. Art is apart of the fabric of our makeup as designers. Now, as that relates to presents we hit a wall - how do you give that as a gift? We knew we couldn't do a water color for every person getting a gift. The amount of time and effort that would take was just not reasonable. And if we did send out something artistic, where would people put them? On their walls? On their desks maybe? Furthermore how would we design something that each of you receiving gifts would like the same considering you are all so very different? We were stumped.

Then, while looking around at the sketches and drawings all over the office we had an idea. What if we gathered up the best of the best and made a custom GHA calendar? It would have to be good of course. Professional. Classy. Not too big, not too small. So, we got to work and here is the finished product.
Announcing the 2013 Gelotte Hommas Architecture desk calendar.

[caption id="attachment_1400" align="aligncenter" width="307"]<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/19/holiday-happeneings-part-ii/calendar_final_02/" rel="attachment wp-att-1400"><img class="size-full wp-image-1400" alt="The 1st ever yearly GHA desk top calendar" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/12/calendar_final_02.jpg" width="307" height="306" /></a> The 1st ever (now yearly) GHA desk top calendar[/caption]

This amazing little calendar is a showcase of art done by our very own talented team of architects.  Each of the 12 months are approximately 3' X 4' printed on cold press water color paper in high contrast ink.

[caption id="attachment_1395" align="aligncenter" width="225"]<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/19/holiday-happeneings-part-ii/stacked_calendars/" rel="attachment wp-att-1395"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1395" alt="Each 12 month calendar was hand cut" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/12/stacked_calendars.jpg?w=225" width="225" height="300" /></a> Each 12 month calendar was hand cut and stacked[/caption]

The bases for the calendars are small circular cut pieces of wood that the paper fits snuggly into propping them up perfectly.

[caption id="attachment_1396" align="aligncenter" width="307"]<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/19/holiday-happeneings-part-ii/base/" rel="attachment wp-att-1396"><img class="size-full wp-image-1396" alt="Each calendar comes with a hand cut wooden base" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/12/base.jpg" width="307" height="409" /></a> Each calendar comes with a hand cut wooden base.[/caption]

These bases are literally taken from trees in Scott Hommas's back yard. How much more personalized can you get?

[caption id="attachment_1399" align="aligncenter" width="307"]<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/19/holiday-happeneings-part-ii/bases_inbag_02/" rel="attachment wp-att-1399"><img class="size-full wp-image-1399" alt="Scott cut over 50 bases by hand" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/12/bases_inbag_02.jpg" width="307" height="320" /></a> Scott cut over 50 bases by hand[/caption]

We packaged them up with a little twine, some golden tissue paper, a little white ribbon and a bright red box.

[caption id="attachment_1398" align="aligncenter" width="300"]<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/19/holiday-happeneings-part-ii/finished_in_a_box_02/" rel="attachment wp-att-1398"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1398" alt="All ready to get packaged up and sent out to you" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/12/finished_in_a_box_02.jpg?w=300" width="300" height="257" /></a> All ready to get packaged up and sent out to you[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1397" align="aligncenter" width="307"]<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/19/holiday-happeneings-part-ii/gift/" rel="attachment wp-att-1397"><img class="size-full wp-image-1397" alt="Your 2013 GHA calendar awaits" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/12/gift.jpg" width="307" height="409" /></a> Your 2013 GHA calendar awaits[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">These calendars turned out beautifully. Each month features a glorious little watercolor painting for you, with the calendar itself being a wonderful little work of art for your desk. This is now a special holiday tradition that we can all look forward to each year.
<em>*If you would like to be on our mailing list, or if you would like your own copy of the GHA desk top calendar please inquire with us at nicholef@gelottehommas.com for pricing.*</em></p>


[caption id="attachment_1401" align="aligncenter" width="307"]<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/19/holiday-happeneings-part-ii/finished_gift_02/" rel="attachment wp-att-1401"><img class="size-full wp-image-1401" alt="Happy Holidays from all of us at Gelotte Hommas Architecture" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/12/finished_gift_02.jpg" width="307" height="350" /></a> Happy Holidays from all of us<br />at Gelotte Hommas Architecture[/caption]]]></content:encoded>

		<title>finished_gift_02</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/19/holiday-happeneings-part-ii/finished_gift_02/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 19 Dec 2012 20:10:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/12/finished_gift_02.jpg</guid>

	<item>
		<title>Gingerbread fit for a King</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/20/gingerbread-fit-for-a-king/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 20 Dec 2012 21:05:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1410</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Our Project Manager Eric Drivdahl was apart of the Gingerbread Village to benefit JDRF for the second year in a row. This is a lovely event that is hosted by the Sheraton every year and has quickly become a holiday tradition for many families.  Each year has a different theme and all the proceeds go directly to the JDRF.
Last year our team designed, built and decorated the Gare Du Palais train station in Canada.

[caption id="attachment_193" align="aligncenter" width="300"]<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/12/01/check-out-the-gelotte-hommas-gingerbread-creation/gingerbread_house_1/" rel="attachment wp-att-193"><img class="size-medium wp-image-193" alt="Architecturally designed by our very own Eric Drivdah, this amazing masterpiece outshines your typical gingerbread house." src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/gingerbread_house_1.jpg?w=300" width="300" height="225" /></a> Architecturally designed by our very own Eric Drivdahl, this amazing masterpiece outshines your typical gingerbread house.[/caption]

This year the theme was fairy tale castles our team chose the iconic Aladdin's castle.

[caption id="attachment_1411" align="aligncenter" width="300"]<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/20/gingerbread-fit-for-a-king/img_4591/" rel="attachment wp-att-1411"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1411" alt="Aladdin's castle gingerbread style" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/12/img_4591.jpg?w=300" width="300" height="225" /></a> Aladdin's castle gingerbread style[/caption]

<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/20/gingerbread-fit-for-a-king/img_4623/" rel="attachment wp-att-1412"><img class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-1412" alt="IMG_4623" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/12/img_4623.jpg?w=225" width="225" height="300" /></a>

The team worked really hard to complete the look including hand blown sugar domes, little candy vendor booths and a candy elephant!
We were recently featured on This Old House as number 8 out of 99 of the top gingerbread houses. You can check it out <a href="http://www.thisoldhouse.com/toh/photos/0,,20655404_21255138,00.html">here..</a>

We were ALSO featured on the local favorite mom blog The Red Tricycle. You can view the post <a href="http://www.redtri.com/seattle-kids/explore-the-holiday-sites-sounds-spirit-of-downtown-seattle">here</a>.

If you have not had a chance to get down to the Sheraton to view the gingerbread masterpieces then we recommend you do it quick. Time is running out!
Oh - and vote for Aladdin's castle while you're there!
:)]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Have you checked out this months 425 Magazine?</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/31/have-you-checked-out-this-months-425-magazine/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 31 Dec 2012 19:09:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1416</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Our project The Woods Outback is being featured in the Jan/Feb issue 425 Magazine.

Such a beautiful home. If you have not had a chance to see it, here are some pages from the Magazine.

[caption id="attachment_1420" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/12/31/have-you-checked-out-this-months-425-magazine/spread_1/" rel="attachment wp-att-1420"><img class="size-full wp-image-1420" alt="Out Project The Woods Outback" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2012/12/spread_1.png" width="560" height="362" /></a> Our Project The Woods Outback[/caption]

The Magazine is on newsstands now.

	<item>
		<title>Friday Fun - The Excellent Ex-Christmas Gift Exchange!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/01/04/friday-fun-the-excellent-ex-christmas-gift-exchange/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 04 Jan 2013 22:38:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1425</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Now that the holiday's are over, and might I say Happy New Year, there might be a gift or two lingering around your abode that you were - well, less than thrilled with let's say. That was the case with all of us over here at GHA. Our senior Project manager Eric Drivdahl had a wonderful idea of what he called the "Excellent Ex-Christmas Gift Exchange." Intrigued? Good! Here's how it works:

You take the, um BEST gift you received this year  and wrap it up to re-gift.
<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/01/white-elephant-gift-exchange.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1426" alt="white-elephant-gift-exchange" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/01/white-elephant-gift-exchange.jpg" width="560" height="347" /></a>
<em>*Sidenote: By best I mean worst, unless of course said gift was given to you by your mother, spouse or kids in which case then it truly is the best and how dare you re-gift it.
:Side Eye:</em>
There are rules to the re-gifting exchange. Everyone seems to play a little differently, thus some over all rules must be agreed upon prior to the exchange. Here's what we agreed to:

We went in order of employment as to decide order of gift choosing.
Once something had been stolen twice it was locked and could no longer be stolen.
The first person to go was also the last person to go.

We made an afternoon office event out of it and ordered pizza. Personally I think I won the gift exchange. I successfully stole myself a classic party staple that my family and I will enjoy for years to come.

Words and pictures just don't do this particular piece justice, so I posted a video.
Be jealous. It's awesome.

[wpvideo 4Dfv4RY1]
Happy New Year everyone!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>

		<title>Friday Fun - New Team Members!</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/01/11/friday-fun-new-team-members/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 11 Jan 2013 21:37:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1431</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/01/brie_zack_2013.png" class="size-full" alt="Friday Fun - New Team Members!" />

<p>In the excitement of the playoff game on Sunday The Seattle Times featured a Russel Wilson paper doll cut out. Naturally we cut him out and added him to our office. While we're at at we thought we would introduce you to OUR newest team members here at GHA. Meet Zack and Brie. They come highly recommended, and we are really excited to have them. Welcome guys!

Oh - and GO HAWKS!</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>An architecture inspired pop-up card</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/01/19/an-architecture-inspired-pop-up-card/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 19 Jan 2013 00:58:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1445</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It's almost valentines day, and that means showing some love to someone special. Well, to us you are all special, so here is a special card from us to all of you.

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="675"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/01/pop_up_card_1.png"><img class="size-full wp-image" id="i-1451" alt="Image" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/01/pop_up_card_1.png?w=675" width="675" height="400" /></a> A Gelotte Hommas home styled into a pop-up card[/caption]

The house in this pop-up card is one of our projects that was voted the top ten most romantic homes in the united states. You can see that <a href="http://www.toptenrealestatedeals.com/homes/featured/2011/the-top-ten-most-romantic-homes/3/">HERE</a>. Happy Valentines Day everyone.

If you feel like trying your hand at this, I have attached a template below.
<em>*The dotted lines are where you score it, and the solid lines are where you cut*</em>

If you finish it, we would LOVE to see a pic.

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/01/2013_valintines_day_pop-up_card.pdf">2013_Valintines_Day_Pop-UP_Card</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Gelotte Hommas Architecture awarded Best of Houzz for 2013</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/01/21/gelotte-hommas-architecture-awarded-best-of-houzz-for-2013/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 21 Jan 2013 19:07:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1460</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We just found out we were awarded the honor of Best of Houzz for 2013 for both Design and Customer Satisfaction. Wow. What an honor!

[caption id="attachment_1461" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/01/best_of_houzz_2013.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1461" alt="GHA sporting the honor of Best of Houzz for 2012 and now 2013!" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/01/best_of_houzz_2013.png" width="560" height="438" /></a> GHA sporting the honor of Best of Houzz for 2012 and now 2013![/caption]

Here is an excerpt from Houzz.com about what it means to be awarded this honor:

" <em>Houzz awards Best of Houzz profile badges every year to the top home pros in the Houzz professional community — not only in the United States but also in Canada, the United Kingdom, Australia and New Zealand.</em>

<em>Winners are selected in two categories: Design and Customer Satisfaction. The Design winners are those with the most popular designs in 2012. Customer Satisfaction honors are determined by a variety of factors, including the number and quality of client reviews.</em>"

We were one of the early adopters of the Houzz.com social site, and it has been one of the best marketing moves we have made. Houzz is a great platform to create PR buzz and social presence in a really fun, visual way. We are thrilled to have been selected again this year by Houzz as one of the best.
::bow::
Thanks Houzz.com. Right back at ya!]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Cardboard playhouses 2013</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/02/02/cardboard-playhouses-2013/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 02 Feb 2013 01:08:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1466</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We are super excited to announce that the first of the 2013 Cardboard Playhouses headed out today for the Chestnut Academy's annual gala. This year our playhouse was designed by one of our principal architect's Scott Hommas. This year has more of a contemporary look and feel, and was designed with more of a dynamic element in mind.

[caption id="attachment_1468" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/02/cardboard_playhouse_backyard_2013.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1468" alt="cardboard_playhouse_backyard_2013" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/02/cardboard_playhouse_backyard_2013.jpg" width="560" height="394" /></a> This year can either be 4 separate structures, or two. (The home in the background is our project The Gambrel House)[/caption]

At just over 27 square feet and standing at almost 6 feet high at it's peak, this playhouse is pretty roomy!
It even comes with a little teepee for dolls, dogs, or little sisters - depending on who you ask. :)

[caption id="attachment_1469" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/02/cardboard_playhouse_livingroom_2013.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1469" alt="cardboard_playhouse_livingroom_2013" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/02/cardboard_playhouse_livingroom_2013.jpg" width="560" height="394" /></a> New tab technology and a reinforced roof make this the most sturdy GHA cardboard playhouse yet. (The home featured here is our project Capecod Shingle Style)[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">Of all the community programs that we do, this one is definitely a favorite.
Our 2013 cardboard playhouses are on the boards for 10 auctions this year. Maybe you will be lucky enough to bring one home.</p>


[caption id="attachment_1467" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/02/cardboard_playhouse_playroom_2013.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1467" alt="The most stable and versatile cardboard playhouse yet. (The home featured is courtesy of Houzz.com)" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/02/cardboard_playhouse_playroom_2013.jpg" width="560" height="300" /></a> The most stable and versatile cardboard playhouse yet. (The home featured is courtesy of Houzz.com)[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">

</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>Coastal Cove House</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/02/09/coastal-cove-house/</link>

		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1471</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[As the East coast gets hit with a massive winter storm, I thought we could all use some warm thoughts of summer.

Check out one of our recently finished projects Coastal Cove House

[caption id="attachment_1472" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Coastal_Cove_house.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-1472 " alt="Gig Harbor Home - 20 WEB SIZE" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/02/gig-harbor-home-20-web-size.jpg" width="560" height="374" /></a> Gorgeous view of the beach[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1476" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Coastal_Cove_house.html"><img class="size-large wp-image-1476 " alt="Gig Harbor Home - 16 WEB SIZE" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/02/gig-harbor-home-16-web-size.jpg?w=560" width="560" height="373" /></a> Vaulted ceilings and huge picture windows open up this space and invite you to relax[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1475" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Coastal_Cove_house.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-1475 " alt="Gig Harbor Home - 11 WEB SIZE" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/02/gig-harbor-home-11-web-size.jpg" width="560" height="372" /></a> Shingle style design[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1474" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Coastal_Cove_house.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-1474 " alt="Gig Harbor Home - 06 WEB SIZE" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/02/gig-harbor-home-06-web-size.jpg" width="560" height="372" /></a> As far as entertaining goes, this covered area behind the house sets the bar.[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1473" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Coastal_Cove_house.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-1473 " alt="Gig Harbor Home - 04 WEB SIZE" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/02/gig-harbor-home-04-web-size.jpg" width="560" height="372" /></a> Relax and unwind in this gorgeous beach front luxury vacation home.[/caption]

	<item>
		<title>The Art of Archtiecture 30 years in the making</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/03/11/the-art-of-archtiecture-30-years-in-the-making/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 11 Mar 2013 17:06:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1479</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Next month the firm will celebrate it's 30th anniversary in business. On April 1st actually, and that's no joke. :)

[caption id="attachment_1481" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/03/transperant_seal-01.png"><img class="size-large wp-image-1481" alt="Gelotte Hommas Archtiecture" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/03/transperant_seal-01.png?w=560" width="560" height="560" /></a> Thirty years on April 1st (no foolin')[/caption]

We know that we would not be here if it wasn't for all of our amazing client's and colleagues. In honor and appreciation of all of you we will be having an open house. Check your mailboxes this week and expect to find an invite to the fun!

By the way, we sort of realized that the anniversary falls on a certain holiday that happens on the first of April.  What if we were to have, say - have some fun with this holiday? Maybe have some themed activities based around it? Nah. Never mind.  Why would we do something like that?
(Stay tuned)]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Ready? Set? Party!</title>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We are pretty excited over here at GHA. One, because spring has sprung and the sun has found it's way to Seattle at last.
Two, because we are all ready to host all of you on Monday evening.

It's not everyday a firm turns thirty you know, and we are really excited to share it with all of you!

[caption id="attachment_1481" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/03/transperant_seal-01.png"><img class="size-large wp-image-1481" alt="Gelotte Hommas Archtiecture" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/03/transperant_seal-01.png?w=560" width="560" height="560" /></a> Thirty years on April 1st, and that's no joke![/caption]

Come by on Monday for some good food, good people, and good fun.

See you Monday!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The orchestra of architecture</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/04/03/the-orchestra-of-architecture/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 04 Apr 2013 04:23:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1485</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Monday April 1st was the thirty year anniversary here at Gelotte Hommas Architecture. Over the last thirty years the firm has had hundreds of clients, made thousands of connections and overall created some really meaningful relationships. On Monday night we opened our doors to all of them to say thank you. We recognize just how fortunate we are to have this kind of history to celebrate.

[caption id="attachment_1486" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/30th-anniversary-157.jpg"><img class="size-large wp-image-1486" alt="Thirty years of memories" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/30th-anniversary-157.jpg?w=560" width="560" height="160" /></a> Thirty years of memories[/caption]

It has been my (Nikki here) great pleasure to call Gelotte Hommas home for the last two and a half years. When I started here at the firm was in a very different place than they are right now. I watched the firm come together through a tough season, and now I am watching as the firm grows, quiet literally, into a brand new season. What I have come to learn is just how very talented the people I call work mates truly are.

[caption id="attachment_1488" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/30th-anniversary-143.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1488" alt="30th Anniversary 143" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/30th-anniversary-143.jpg" width="560" height="372" /></a> Curtis Gelotte and Scott Hommas taking a moment to celebrate[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">Curt said in his toast on Monday "Somewhere over the years it became less about the projects, and more about the people." That seems to define this firm to it's core. It was no wonder that our office was packed to the brim all night with people coming to celebrate in the magic of thirty years in business.  What we offer is a service of the most personal kind - homes. The place your families histories are penned with memories made of laughter and tears. The place lazy weekends give rest, and family dinners give warmth. This is the place your children grow. The place your in laws come to visit. The place where you plant roots and grow into your life path. That is what Gelotte Hommas designs. It doesn't get much more personal than that.</p>


[caption id="attachment_1489" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/30th-anniversary-112.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1489" alt="Clients become friends at GHA" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/30th-anniversary-112.jpg" width="560" height="372" /></a> Clients become friends at GHA[/caption]

Over the past few years here I have learned we are less of a team and more of an orchestra. Curt and Scott are the maestro's gracefully guiding the symphony one note at a time. Each person that touches the project is like an instrument in the symphony.  Some becoming more pronounced that others as the direction of the music is decided, and ultimately completed. Each piece is exquisite and perfected, yet they are all beautifully different. It's not just what we do, it's who we are.
We are architects, and we are friends.

[caption id="attachment_1490" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/img_6020.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1490" alt="Thanks for celebrating with us!" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/img_6020.jpg" width="560" height="373" /></a> Thanks for celebrating with us![/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">From all of us here at GHA,
thank you to everyone to came out on Monday to celebrate with us.
Cheers!</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Russell Wilson - our BFF</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/04/11/russell-wilson-our-bff/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 11 Apr 2013 17:52:55 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1497</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[As a company we like to be involved in our community, and give back. We also enjoy supporting the Seattle sports teams, such as the Seahawks. Which, is obviously easy to do when you are best friends with Russell Wilson (the quarter back from the Seahawks)

[caption id="attachment_1498" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/wilson_gelotte.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1498" alt="Curt Gelotte, his daughter in law Leisle and Russell Wilson" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/wilson_gelotte.jpg" width="560" height="400" /></a> Curt Gelotte, his daughter in law Leisle, and Russell Wilson[/caption]

Last month we sponsored a Hall of Fame dinner at Northwest University where Russell Wilson was the guest speaker. Before the auction there was a meet and greet where Curt and his daughter in law took a photo with the famed quarterback. All in all, it was a lovely night where the university raised money to support their sports programming, and we got to hang out with our bff.

Ok, so maybe saying we are bff's is a little bit of a stretch. Nah!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Friday Fun - Summer is coming</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/04/26/friday-fun-summer-is-coming/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 26 Apr 2013 20:17:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1504</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I know that it's been snowing in some places across the nation this week, but I promise; summer IS coming. The sun has found it's way to Seattle this weekend just long enough for us to photograph a recent completed project.

[caption id="attachment_1518" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/web_ready.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1518" alt="A spectacular exterior addition " src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/web_ready.jpg" width="560" height="373" /></a> A spectacular exterior addition[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1517" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/sam-details-elephant-headwebready.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1517" alt="Little details are what bring every project to life - like this elephant carved into the beam" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/sam-details-elephant-headwebready.jpg" width="560" height="323" /></a> Little details are what bring every project to life - like this elephant carved into the beam[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1514" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/glassworks_remodle_2.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1514" alt="Interior Designer Faith Sheridan Designs" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/glassworks_remodle_2.jpg" width="560" height="373" /></a> Interior Designer Faith Sheridan Designs[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1511" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/details_2.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1511" alt="Interior designer Faith Sheridan Designs " src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/details_2.jpg" width="560" height="373" /></a> Interior designer Faith Sheridan Designs[/caption]

Looking at this space makes me really excited for summer. Bring on the sunshine!
To view more pictures of this project click <a href="http://www.houzz.com/projects/221854/Glassworks-Remodel">HERE</a> to visit our Houzz.com profile.

*Images by Taylor Grant Photography]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>We draw stuff sometimes</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/05/01/we-draw-stuff-sometimes/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 01 May 2013 21:13:03 +0000</pubDate>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Sometimes our projects get revised, and sometimes that happens pretty quickly. This project is one of those projects.</p><p>Eric Drivdahl is the senior project manager and architect on this one. In case you were all wondering, we still draw renderings and drawings by hand around here.</p>[caption id="attachment_1521" align="aligncenter" width="560"]<img class="size-full wp-image-1521" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/gadre_drawing-e1367442550814.jpg" alt="Gadre_Drawing" width="560" height="418" /> The old fashioned style of doing things by hand still rings true here at Gelotte Hommas Architecture.[/caption]<p style="text-align:center;">Go see more of this project, Bellevue Residence Remodel, on our website by clicking <a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/complete-home-remodel-and-addition.html">here</a>.</p><p style="text-align:center;"> </p>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Gadre_Drawing</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/05/01/we-draw-stuff-sometimes/gadre_drawing/</link>

	<item>
		<title>Western Exposure: A room with a view</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/05/15/western-exposure-a-room-with-a-view/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 15 May 2013 09:28:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1524</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[With the weather slowly warming to reveal the temperatures of Spring and Summer, we naturally gravitate outdoors. Whether you're a kayak enthusiast, bicyclist, or just enjoy a glass of wine out on a patio, chances are you'll find yourself outside a lot more this season. Windows aren't just the eyes of the home--They allow you to bring the outside in, an ever important aspect of architecture as the temperatures continue to rise to the occasion for summer fun.

[caption id="attachment_1528" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/casa-del-sol.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1528" alt="Casa del sol home from Gelotte Hommas" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/casa-del-sol.png" width="490" height="380" /></a> The living area of Casa Del Sol offers exposure to the outdoors so you can move seamlessly between the coziness of indoors and the expansive beauty outside.[/caption]

In<a title="Casa Del Sol" href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Casa_Del_Sol.html"> Casa Del Sol</a>, A Seattle Homes &amp; Lifestyles Home of the Year, the Gelotte Hommas design did a great deal to welcome the outdoors in. With a modern aesthetic applied to natural materials, the home reflects nature while leaving as much window space possible to welcome in the sunset, sunrise, and beautiful views; even the master suite of this beautiful home is wrapped in glass on three sides to allow the perfect view of the gorgeous scenery.

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/cape-cod.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1527" alt="cape cod shingle style from Gelotte Hommas" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/cape-cod.png" width="490" height="380" /></a>Our <a title="Cape Cod" href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Cape-Cod%20Shingle.html">Cape Cod Shingle Style</a> also made sure to take in the view, offering a stunning skyline to enjoy from the living room and patio. French doors connect outdoor living to indoor living space, perfect for entertaining during the warmer months. The eyebrow window spans the entire length of the west side of the home to make the most of the home's view of the Puget Sound.

With such natural splendor available in Washington, it's only natural that your home should make the most of the view and lighting of nature around you. Capitalize on light with a Western view that allows you take in the splendor of the sunset, or create a panoramic view with expansive floor to ceiling windows on the side of your home with the best view. When is the last time you got to sit back and take in the sunset? With a well-designed space, it's possible and effortless every evening.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1524</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2013-05-15 02:28:34</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2013-05-15 09:28:34</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>western-exposure-a-room-with-a-view</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>

		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="gelotte-hommas"><![CDATA[Gelotte Hommas]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

	<item>
		<title>Whimsical Garage from Gelotte Hommas Featured in Houzz</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/05/21/whimsical-garage-from-gelotte-hommas-featured-in-houzz/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 May 2013 21:54:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1531</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[While Facebook and Twitter keep you up to date with friends, news, and memes, and Pinterest has you planning your yoga strategy and cookie recipes hand in hand, Houzz is the go-to corner of the web for the architecturally minded. Showcasing beautiful spaces and the teams behind them, Houzz catalogs well-designed and interesting spaces from around the world. <a title="Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a> was extremely flattered to find one of our designs featured as an exemplary "man cave," especially with Father's Day right around the corner.

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/houzz.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1532" alt="gelotte hommas featured in houzz" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/houzz.png" width="560" height="306" /></a>

Our whimsical garage for a Seattle-based professional Porsche driver was featured as a "man cave" dream space. In their feature, Houzz focused not just on the design, but the client behind it, an essential element to any personal architectural space.
<div><a href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/1994672/The-Garaj-Mahal-eclectic-exterior-seattle"><img class="aligncenter" alt="" src="http://st.houzz.com/simgs/d2e13bd300a6beeb_8-5135/eclectic-exterior.jpg" width="500" height="332" border="0" /></a></div>
<div style="color:#444;"><small><a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;"> </a></small></div>
<div><span style="color:#444444;">The garage blends in with the other homes and structures in the area from the exterior, employing natural tones and architectural features typical of cabins and farmhouses to make the garage seem more approachable and at home that a stark, more industrialized design. Inside, the space becomes a burst of color and life, creating an environment of encouragement and creativity for the homeowner as he resurrects dilapidated cars into a renewed glory:</span></div>
<div></div>
<div><img class="aligncenter" alt="" src="http://st.houzz.com/simgs/a971b56700a6bdaf_8-4824/eclectic-garage-and-shed.jpg" width="500" height="374" border="0" /></div>
<div></div>
<div>We're flattered to have been featured so prominently in Houzz and happy that the homeowner can enjoy and take advantage of a "man cave" designed specifically with him in mind and to meet the needs of his passion for restoring older cars.</div>
<div></div>
<div></div>
<div>Is your dream man cave a garage? Theater room? A library? Tell us about your ideal in-home getaway. Want to learn more about this specific project?  Read the full article on our garage design on <a title="Seattle Garage Design" href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/11128040/list/Dream-Spaces--Trash-Becomes-Treasure-in-a-Massive-Seattle-Garage" target="_blank">Houzz</a>.</div>
<div style="color:#444;"></div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Working Your Architectural Angles</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/05/24/working-your-architectural-angles/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 24 May 2013 16:10:31 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1535</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Three of the main tenants of the design theory and mindset at Gelotte Hommas Architecture are form, beauty, and architecture. A good architect needs the same know-how as a Super Model: You have to know how to work your angles.

Geometric patterns are one of the biggest, booming trends in fashion today. From the ever popular chevron to a well-defined diamond outline, geometry and angles are making a huge comeback. The trend is all about working angles and shapes in a creative, modern way, and it gets down to a simple truth:

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/math-t-shirt.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1536" alt="&quot;deep down we all love math&quot; t-shirt" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/math-t-shirt.jpg" width="479" height="500" /></a>

&nbsp;

This new trend in fashion is getting down the heart of something architects have known for years: Angles and geometric patterns are a part of life, and we can use them to better form and beauty at once. While you may not have loved math class, these patterns and forms are something you probably appreciate daily in your home. Our "<a title="House in a Mountain Meadow by Gelotte Hommas" href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/House_in_a_mountain_meadow.html" target="_blank">House in a Mountain Meadow</a>" in Issaquah, WA, is a great example:

[caption id="attachment_1537" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/geometric-hall.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1537" alt="geometric hall in Issaquah home" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/geometric-hall.png" width="490" height="380" /></a> Angles work together for strong form, function, and geometric beauty.[/caption]

In this hallway, rafters go beyond basic support to add an element of style to the space, bringing the eye upwards to enjoy the blend of triangles, trapezoids, and more with a ceiling that's anything but boring. Various shapes and angles from the walls, skylights, rafters, and furniture blend together for a modern and geometrically interesting space that's warm and inviting.

While this resurgence in the love of geometric form and balance in fashion may someday go out of style, in your home, it's a timeless look that keeps your space interesting and intriguing as well as purposeful and gorgeous.

What other architectural influences have you seen in today's fashion world? Share your findings in a comment.

<em>T-shirt Photo via<a title="Math T-shirt on Flickr" href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/networkosaka/4706488737/sizes/m/in/photostream/" target="_blank"> Flickr CC</a>.</em>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>shower</title>

	<item>
		<title>spa-shower</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/05/29/home-design-with-your-life-in-mind-the-entertainer/spa-shower/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 29 May 2013 19:03:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/spa-shower.png</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[A spa shower can relax away even the most stressful party planning.]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1547</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2013-05-29 19:03:35</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2013-05-29 19:03:35</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

		<wp:post_name>spa-shower</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>inherit</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>1541</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>attachment</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:attachment_url>https://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/spa-shower.png</wp:attachment_url>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_wp_attached_file</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/723/30761957/files/2013/05/spa-shower.png]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_metadata</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:5:{s:5:"width";i:490;s:6:"height";i:380;s:4:"file";s:86:"/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/723/30761957/files/2013/05/spa-shower.png";s:5:"sizes";a:0:{}s:10:"image_meta";a:10:{s:8:"aperture";i:0;s:6:"credit";s:0:"";s:6:"camera";s:0:"";s:7:"caption";s:0:"";s:17:"created_timestamp";i:0;s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";i:0;s:3:"iso";i:0;s:13:"shutter_speed";i:0;s:5:"title";s:0:"";}}]]></wp:meta_value>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[spa shower from Gelotte Hommas Architecture]]></wp:meta_value>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Home Design with Your Life in Mind: The Entertainer</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/05/29/home-design-with-your-life-in-mind-the-entertainer/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 29 May 2013 19:08:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1541</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[When purchasing, building, or remodeling a home, the architecture and design of your space are meant to enhance your life there, not inhibit it. Reflecting who you are in your home goes beyond decor, paint, and furniture; every beam, nail, and board should work to cohesively make your space the best that it can be for you as an individual. We're starting a series on the Gelotte Hommas blog to showcase rooms, homes, and spaces designed for various personalities, starting out with The Entertainer. Are you the socialite of any social gathering? Love to host to dinner parties and get togethers? Enjoy helping people meet other people and the buzz of conversation? If so, you're an Entertainer (with a capital E), and your space needs to live up to the challenge. Here are a few of the rules that your home should follow to fit your needs:
<h2>The Entertainer needs ample space for get-togethers and groups within the home.</h2>
Open floor plans are a bit of a "buzz" word in the architectural and home design world at the moment, but this style of architecture is anything but a mere trend. Having your rooms flow seamlessly into one another allows you breathing room, space, and the perfect entertaining setting, as guests can join you in the kitchen, in the dining room, or in the living room while still being able to view guests and the party in general throughout the space.

[caption id="attachment_1542" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/open-floorplan.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1542" alt="Wood Stone Water home from Gelotte Hommas Architecture" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/open-floorplan.png" width="490" height="380" /></a> Large windows, open spaces, and an open balcony make this living space feel larger than life.[/caption]

In our "<a title="Wood Stone Water House" href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Wood_Stone_Water.html" target="_blank">Wood Stone Water</a>" home in Bellevue, the architects of Gelotte Hommas created an open, welcoming environment perfect for entertaining. Large windows and open spaces make the room feel even larger, helping guests to avoid feeling stuffy, and create a great space for visitors to flow through as they enjoy group interaction and intimate conversations alike. The large windows provide great scenery and ample conversation starters. Interesting features within the home,  including an indoor waterfall spanned by a delicate wood bridge in the living room, make the house interesting, inviting, and the perfect vessel for a host or hostess.
<h2>Preparation is part of the party, so make every space social.</h2>
Any regular party host knows that your job is never done, and you're often handing party management tasks while talking with guests and enjoying the festivities yourself. Make spaces like the kitchen inviting and open so that your guests can enjoy your company while you whip up extra hors d' oeuvres  or mix a signature cocktail. Our "<a title="House on Pine Lake" href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/House_on_pine_lake.html" target="_blank">House on Pine Lake</a>" as a perfect example:

[caption id="attachment_1543" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/house-on-pine-lake.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1543" alt="open, modern kitchen designed by Gelotte Hommas" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/house-on-pine-lake.png" width="490" height="380" /></a> Expansive counter space and in-kitchen seating welcome guests to a behind-the-scenes moment.[/caption]

The beautiful, modern kitchen in our House on Pine Lake provides seating for guests so that they can enjoy conversation with you while you finish up a few drinks or snacks. Ample bar and counter space provide room for a wonderful food display or just a space to serve to the helping hands of a catering staff.
<h2>Behind every great Entertainer there's a relaxing getaway.</h2>
Even socialites need to recharge, and while your home should be designed to accommodate groups in great entertaining spaces, you should also have a niche that's all about you. A spa shower or bathroom gives you a place to soak away pre-party stress or to relax away a job well done when the final guest says farewell.

[caption id="attachment_1547" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/spa-shower.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1547" alt="spa shower from Gelotte Hommas Architecture" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/spa-shower.png" width="490" height="380" /></a> A spa shower can relax away even the most stressful party planning.[/caption]

A beautiful, welcoming spa shower gives you the perfect space to relax. Beautiful, natural tile provides a soothing environment as you wash away all of your cares.

&nbsp;

Are you an Entertainer? How does your home design fit your personality? If you're not exactly a socialite, stay tuned: We have other personality and design features coming up next month!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Home Design with Your Life in Mind: The Artist</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/06/03/home-design-with-your-life-in-mind-the-artist/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 03 Jun 2013 15:42:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1549</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[As we continue our series on using the architectural elements of your Seattle home to fit your lifestyle, we're getting in touch with our artistic side. (If you haven't already, be sure to read our first post in this series on <a title="The Entertainer" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/05/29/home-design-with-your-life-in-mind-the-entertainer/" target="_blank">The Entertainer</a>, focusing on the perfect home structure for a socialite). Artists thrive in creative spaces, offering inspiration to their work and the perfect space for their craft. An artists' home shouldn't lack the elements that they hold dear; architecture, whether clean, sleek, and modern or traditional and ornate doesn't have to be the "bare bones" of a home; artistic elements can be incorporated into the very core of a structure to make it exceptional.
<h2>For the geometric artist</h2>
<a title="Know your Architectural Angles" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/05/24/working-your-architectural-angles/" target="_blank">Geometry is back</a> in style in a very, very big way, but has been a strong element of artistic works, from M. C. Escher to current and popular modern art trends. Even with a softer and more traditional color palette, geometry can be featured in subtle way that adds artistic character and inspiration to a space, as with this floor medallion in our <a title="House on Cosey Cove" href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/house_on_cozy_cove.html" target="_blank">House on Cozy Cove</a> in Hunts Point, WA:

[caption id="attachment_1550" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/floor-medallion.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1550" alt="floor medallion " src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/floor-medallion.png" width="490" height="380" /></a> A floor medallion steps up the appeal of an entry way.[/caption]
<h2>For the traditionalist</h2>
Prefer art of the French vein or working in the styles of the great names of yore? Create an artistic space that brings old world charm to the new age. This <a title="French Country Manor" href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Country_French_Manor.html" target="_blank">French Country Manor</a> in Medina, WA does just that with beautiful elements like this french door set:

[caption id="attachment_1551" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/iron-doors.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1551" alt="french doors" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/iron-doors.png" width="490" height="380" /></a> Whether walking into a room or into another century, these doors seem perfectly at home.[/caption]

Surround your space with elements of the past to pull inspiration from the lines, movement, and more within your space. Within this room, texture from the tiles, the warmth of the wood, and the pattern of the doorway could inspire many beautiful pieces (The wine in the cellar wouldn't hurt the inspiration, either).
<h2>For the showcase</h2>
Art enthusiast but not out to produce your own? Turn your home into it's very own gallery. Gelotte Hommas did just that for one homeowner in a home fittingly named <a title="The Gallery" href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/The_Gallery.html" target="_blank">The Gallery</a> in Kirkland, WA. Smooth, clean modern spaces and white walls lend themselves well to a fitting space to showcase the homeowner's art collection. Some areas of the home look as if they were lifted directly from an art museum:

[caption id="attachment_1552" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/the-gallery.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1552" alt="the gallery" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/the-gallery.png" width="490" height="380" /></a> Trendy art museum or the perfect hallway? You decide.[/caption]

&nbsp;

What's your artistic style, and how does your home reflect it? Tell us about it in the comments section.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>home-design-with-your-life-in-mind-the-artist</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>

	<item>
		<title>Local non-profit making waves globally</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/06/03/local-non-profit-making-waves-globally/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 03 Jun 2013 23:46:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1555</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align:center;"><span style="color:#808080;">One of the things we love is seeing a local company take things global, and that's just what <a href="http://www.pilgrimafrica.org/"><span style="color:#808080;">Pilgrim Africa</span></a> has done. In fact, we are so inspired by what they are doing we have decided to partner with them. </span></p>


[caption id="attachment_1563" align="aligncenter" width="300"]<img class="size-full wp-image-1563" alt="4453471_300" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/4453471_300.jpg" width="300" height="300" /> <span style="color:#808080;">Their mission: to challenge despair, love boldly, and help African people create a future of sustainable prosperity and health. </span>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;"><span style="color:#808080;">Pilgrim Africa was founded in 2001 in response to the plight of more than 1.5 million internally displaced people in war-torn Northern Uganda. With no more than a handful of volunteers they  provided health services, education, trauma-counseling and agricultural training to refugees. <a href="http://www.pilgrimafrica.org/"><span style="color:#808080;"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1562" alt="529926_10150812841524063_716012791_n" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/529926_10150812841524063_716012791_n.jpg" width="560" height="372" /></span></a></span></p>
<span style="color:#808080;">Now, over a decade later, <span style="color:#000000;">Pilgrim Africa has gained a national reputation</span> for catalyzing local solutions into widespread, social change. </span>
<span style="color:#808080;"> From its inception this <span style="color:#000000;">grass roots non-profit</span> has grown into a force for development throughout Uganda with major <span style="color:#000000;">projects today</span> in <span style="color:#000000;">education</span> and <span style="color:#000000;">public health</span>.</span>

<span style="color:#808080;"><a href="http://www.pilgrimafrica.org/"><span style="color:#808080;"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1561" alt="homeslide-hopeisthework" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/homeslide-hopeisthework.jpg" width="560" height="313" /></span></a></span>

<span style="color:#808080;">If you would like to come and <span style="color:#000000;">meet</span> some of the <span style="color:#000000;">amazing people behind this movement</span> then we welcome you to <span style="color:#000000;">join us</span> for a <span style="color:#000000;"><em>free</em></span> wine tasting and socializing <span style="color:#000000;">event at our office</span>.</span>

<span style="color:#808080;"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1566" alt="invitation" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/invitation2.jpg" width="778" height="286" /><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/invitation2.jpg">
</a><span style="color:#000000;">TO RSVP please email us at  [contact-form][contact-field label='Name' type='name' required='1'/][contact-field label='Email' type='email' required='1'/][contact-field label='Website' type='url'/][contact-field label='Comment' type='textarea' required='1'/][/contact-form] </span></span>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1555</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2013-06-03 23:46:11</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2013-06-03 23:46:11</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>local-non-profit-making-waves-globally</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		<wp:post_id>1558</wp:post_id>

			<wp:meta_key>_wp_attached_file</wp:meta_key>

	<item>
		<title>Gelotte Hommas is going MAD for #SOCIALMADNESS</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/06/05/gelotte-hommas-is-going-mad-for-social-madness/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 06 Jun 2013 05:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1572</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The Puget Sound Business Journal has an annual competition where they try and find out the most socially acceptable organizations around. The Puget Sound Business Journal has dubbed this competition #SocialMadness and it's pretty awesome. In order to even be apart of the madness your organization has to be nominated, and GHA found out today that we were! Thank you to who ever voted for us, we are honored! Now -  to quote the PSBJ "Let the games begin!"

<a href="http://www.bizjournals.com/seattle/socialmadness?post_id=100000419015658_602989099725052#_=_"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1573" alt="PSBJ_social_madness_icon" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/psbj_social_madness_icon.png" width="560" height="580" /></a>We are going to have to bring our A game to this social throw down - that part is obvious, but we need your help. Will you all please go vote for us? It will only take a second of your time, and it's FREE! * Let's face it, people love free these days*

To vote for us (you know you want to) just<strong> click <a href="http://www.bizjournals.com/seattle/socialmadness?post_id=100000419015658_602989099725052#_=_">HERE , </a></strong>scroll down until you see us <strong>GELOTTE HOMMAS ARCHITECTURE</strong> then <em>click the VOTE</em> check and YOUR DONE! Ha! (Told you it'd be easy)

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/voted_gha_psbj.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1574" alt="voted_GHA_PSBJ" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/voted_gha_psbj.png" width="721" height="226" /></a>We think we have a prettygood social presence, but let's see if we are right. Will you help us make it to the next round?
Our SCORE will be measured across multiple platforms including LinkedIn, FB and Twitter. We will need engagement in the form of 'likes,' ‘shares,’ and comments on these platforms.
After you vote, please take a moment and follow our pages and 'like,' ‘share,’ and comment away! "
Facebook: <a href="http://www.facebook.com/GHarchitecture">http://www.facebook.com/GHarchitecture</a>
Our fan page at <a href="http://www.facebook.com/pages/Gelotte-Hommas-Architecture/106339399849">http://www.facebook.com/pages/Gelotte-Hommas-Architecture/106339399849</a>
or follow us on Twitter: <a href="https://twitter.com/GelotteHommas" target="_blank" rel="nofollow nofollow">https://twitter.com/GelotteHommas</a>
Thanks a million!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Furniture Design Competition</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1582</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 12 Jun 2013 22:27:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1582</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="font-size:small;">Our project <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/underway/Touch_of_Normandy.html">Touch of Normandy</a> is coming to a close, and just in time for summer. Part of the project is a trellised shade pavilion, with redwood rafters and trellis; you can see images of the semi finished structure <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/underway/Touch_of_Normandy.html">here.
</a><span style="font-size:small;">The builder came to us with some extra redwood pieces with the proposition of building something out of it, we thought that was a great idea. In fact, we decided to make a competition out of it.
</span></span>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/blog_pic.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1586 aligncenter" alt="The GHA 2013 Furniture Design Competition" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/blog_pic.png" width="560" height="374" /></a>

<span style="font-size:small;"><span style="font-size:small;">Now for the rules:
</span></span>
<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:small;">Design for simple and clear assembly &amp; connections
</span></li>
	<li>Design must complement this Normandy Style building assemble</li>
	<li><span style="font-size:small;">Dimensions must use the remaining pieces without cutting them down</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:small;">Dimensions include:</span>
<span style="font-size:small;"><span style="font-size:10pt;">2.5"x7.5" - 1/11'6"  1/12'  10 pieces from 24"-48"  11 pieces 22"-24"
3/4x3/4 - 5/14"
1.5"x3.5" - 1/5'  1/12'
1.5"x2.5" - 1/48"  1/13'  1/14'
3/4"x3.5"  -  2/66"
1.5"x1.5" - 1/69"  1/71"
7.5"x7.5" - 3/24"  1/21"</span></span></li>
	<li>The winning piece of furniture built and presented to the client</li>
</ul>
<span style="font-size:small;">There will be a Prize for the winner (other than having the design featured and built). </span>

<span style="font-size:small;"><span style="font-size:small;"><span style="font-size:small;">Maybe we choose a simple outdoor table, or chair, or both!  We are looking forward to the submissions from the talented team here at GHA. Deadline is next Tuesday, so we'll keep you posted!
If you could design something to go in this space, what would it be? Let us know in the comments.
</span></span>
</span>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
