		<title>Balance Privacy and Style in the Bathroom</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/11/22/balance-privacy-and-style-in-the-bathroom/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 22 Nov 2013 23:03:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1773</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="Paragraph SCX176578018" style="color:windowtext;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Each zone within your bathroom serves a different purpose; the toilet, <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/09/18/open-your-bathroom-up-with-a-curbless-shower/" target="_blank">the shower</a>, the sink and the vanity all have important roles to play, and displaying these zones as the independent functions that they are can be a great way to promote bathroom privacy without compromising style.</p>

<div><a href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/5177990/Classic-Luxury-contemporary-bathroom-atlanta" target="_blank"><img class="aligncenter" style="border:0;" title="using half walls in a bathroom" alt="using half walls in a bathroom" src="http://st.houzz.com/simgs/55d1927a0208fd5c_8-0862/contemporary-bathroom.jpg" width="500" height="370" border="0" /></a></div>
<div style="color:#444444;text-align:center;"><small><a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/contemporary/bathroom">Contemporary Bathroom</a> by <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/professionals/interior-designer/c/Johns-Creek--GA">Johns Creek Interior Designers &amp; Decorators</a> <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/pro/cporcheinteriors/cynthia-porche-interiors">Cynthia Porche Interiors</a> via Houzz</small></div>
<p class="Paragraph SCX176578018" style="color:windowtext;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Here are a <a href="http://www.decoist.com/2013-04-01/fancy-bathroom-toilet-privacy-options/" target="_blank">few ideas</a> to help you plan the perfect bathroom:</p>

<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="color:#0d0e00;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Walls and doors</b><b style="color:#0d0e00;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">:</b> Using walls or sliding doors to separate the toilet from the rest of the room is the most common way to increase bathroom privacy, but can be done in not-so-common ways, too, like using glass walls or shelving.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="color:#0d0e00;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Half walls</b><b style="color:#0d0e00;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">:</b> Half walls are good for bathrooms that don't have a lot of room to spare. They can separate the toilet from the rest of the room without closing it off thus maintaining a more "open" feel.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="color:#0d0e00;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Plants and sculptures:</b> If you'd like something a bit more unique, you may consider using tall plants or sculptures to keep your toilet separate. This bathroom design trend will be both relaxing and inspiring, and may even help purify the air.</li>
</ul>
<p class="Paragraph SCX176578018" style="color:windowtext;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">The bathroom is where that people relax, relieve, and renew in the most private of settings, and the unique function of this room should not go unappreciated.</p>
<p class="Paragraph SCX176578018" style="color:windowtext;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">If you've been planning your dream bathroom, contact <a class="Hyperlink SCX176578018" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a> and let us help make your dream a reality.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Architecture with Pets in Mind: Designing a Cat-Friendly Home</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/11/16/architecture-with-pets-in-mind-designing-a-cat-friendly-home/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 16 Nov 2013 18:34:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1775</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Cats are not so much pets as they are roommates, and their attitude about your home - and your things - shows that. That's why you should design your new home or remodel with <a href="http://www.architizer.com/blog/cats-rule-everything-around-me/" target="_blank">your cat in mind</a>; give them his or her space and he or she will (hopefully) give you yours. Here are a few things to keep in mind when planning a cat-friendly home design:</p>

<div><a href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/1322678/Fit-for-a-McQueen-modern-bedroom-philadelphia" target="_blank"><img class="aligncenter" style="border:0;" title="pet friendly design ideas in Seattle" alt="incorporate a cat scratch post in your Seattle residence" src="http://st.houzz.com/simgs/c851b6cf001fd7f3_8-4186/modern-bedroom.jpg" width="375" height="500" border="0" /></a></div>
<div style="color:#444444;text-align:center;"><small><a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/modern/bedroom">Modern Bedroom</a> by <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/professionals/interior-designer/c/Philadelphia--PA">Philadelphia Interior Designers &amp; Decorators</a> <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/pro/bettysroom/bettys-room-llc">Betty's Room, LLC</a> via Houzz</small></div>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Provide a perch</b><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">:</b> Cats love to tower over their surroundings, and having the perfect place to perch will be a great opportunity to do so. Provide the furry animal with ample perching places with the use of high shelving, or add a custom perch for your cat by mounting "cat cubbies" to the walls.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">The cat wants windows:</b><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"> </b>Your little kitty<b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"> </b>is just like any other cat and wants a place to watch the world, ideally a window sill. When designing your home, make sure to <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/05/15/western-exposure-a-room-with-a-view/" target="_blank">include plenty of windows</a> with large ledges so your cat can watch the world outside from the comfort of his home.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Scrounge up a scratching post:</b> The beast loves to massage his or her paws, and she'll do so whether you approve of the location or not. To avoid damaged furniture, add scratching areas to all of her favorite hang-out spots. If you need a little help convincing her to use them, just add some catnip to the area.</li>
</ul>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Show your cat how much you appreciate her by giving her her own space with these simple ideas.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">To learn more about planning a cat-friendly home design, contact <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a>, where art meets architecture.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Why You Should Consider Bamboo Flooring</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/11/13/why-you-should-consider-bamboo-flooring/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 13 Nov 2013 15:34:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1777</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[When people typically plan their flooring, a few different options come to mind: carpet and hard-wood. There is another flooring option that is both affordable and durable: bamboo. And because <a href="http://www.examiner.com/article/bamboo-a-rapidly-renewable-resource-for-leed-certification">bamboo is renewable</a>, using it to cover your floors is environmentally friendly, as well.
<div><a href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/5219218/Wando-River-Private-Residence-contemporary-kitchen-charleston" target="_blank"><img class="aligncenter" style="border:0;" title="bamboo flooring design in seattle" alt="bamboo flooring design" src="http://st.houzz.com/simgs/5ac1a233020c458b_8-0762/contemporary-kitchen.jpg" width="500" height="420" border="0" /></a></div>
<div style="color:#444444;text-align:center;"><small><a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/contemporary/kitchen">Contemporary Kitchen</a> by <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/professionals/architect/c/Charleston--SC">Charleston Architects &amp; Designers</a> <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/pro/dlbarchitectureanddesign/dlb-custom-home-design">DLB Custom Home Design</a> via Houzz</small></div>
There are three different types of bamboo flooring, each with their own appearance, durability, and price:
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Flat grain:</b> The most common bamboo floor is the flat grain, featuring broad strips of bamboo which is actually many strips laminated together.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Vertical grain:</b> Vertical grain floors boast a sort-of "cutting board" appearance by stacking planks on end.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Strand planks:</b> By far the hardest of the three, strand flooring is composed of "leftover" bamboo by weaving together scraps then lamenting them together.</li>
</ul>
While gluing or nailing planks is  the most sturdy option, it is certainly not universal. For example, if you've got concrete flooring, you obviously couldn't nail your bamboo down. If your floor is prone to moisture, glue will not permanently adhere and will likely cause the floor to buckle. In these cases, installing a "floating" floor may be the best bet.

Carpet flooring is a fine way to help keep toes cozy, but anyone with a child or a pet knows that they are also a magnet for stains. To avoid this, many people turn to hard wood flooring, but steep prices make this a less-than-ideal option, too.

Hence the appeal of bamboo; it boasts the same beauty and durability of hard-wood, but comes at a fraction of the cost.

If you are considering different flooring options, we strongly recommend bamboo flooring for its beauty and easy maintenance. For more information about designing and installing bamboo flooring, contact <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a>, where your home is our passion.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>bamboo flooring in seattle</title>

	<item>
		<title>Taking Inspiration From Nature&#039;s Lines</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/11/26/taking-inspiration-from-natures-lines/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 27 Nov 2013 02:43:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1791</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[caption id="attachment_1799" align="alignright" width="392"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/11/seattle_cottage_2.png"><img class=" wp-image-1799 " title="seattle cottage" alt="seattle cottage" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/11/seattle_cottage_2.png" width="392" height="304" /></a> Source: Gelotte Hommas[/caption]
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Many people go camping, take hiking trips, and use the outdoors as an escape from the indoors and as a space to clear their minds. Why not make your home an indoor space that makes you feel the same way by reflecting the great outdoors? Take into consideration all the following ways that the interior design of your space can be inspired by nature.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Point to Outdoors</b></p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">One of the most obvious and easiest ways to make your home feel more like the outdoors is to have lots of windows that actually show the outdoors. If done correctly, this can also save money by having natural lighting brighten up your home and using less artificial lighting. Many people also prefer natural lighting, and some studies even suggest that natural lighting is healthier.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Use Plants</b></p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Actually keep plants in your home or office! This will help inspire more designs and are a great way to make your space smell fresh in a more pure way than artificial air fresheners.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Copy Plants</b></p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Use plants as inspiration to your furniture and room layout. If you are using dogwood plants, have the furniture match with parallel or perpendicular lines to match.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">There are a lot of advantages to having the interior design of your home replicate the outdoors. For people that love to spend time outdoors, it's a great way to still experience a little bit of nature during all seasons without dealing with bad weather or insects. With the use of large windows and open spaces, it helps a space feel bigger and aids in avoiding the sense of confinement.</p>
<a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/home.html" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a> has been designing rooms for 30 years, with a very creative and functional approach to our <a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/Design.html" target="_blank">design</a> workflow. Take a look at our <a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/Portfolio.html" target="_blank">portfolio</a> for examples, and <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">contact us</a> with questions!]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:post_name>taking-inspiration-from-natures-lines</wp:post_name>

	<item>
		<title>Working With a Design Wish List</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/12/02/working-with-a-design-wish-list/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 02 Dec 2013 20:43:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1793</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">At Gelotte Hommas Architecture, we excel in translating clients' desires into exceptional designs. We live by the motto “the Art in Architecture," blending the intuitive with the rational and paying careful attention to the distinct aspects of aesthetics.</p>


[caption id="attachment_1806" align="aligncenter" width="504"]<a href="http://www.shutterstock.com/pic-94130386/stock-photo-chalk-drawing-wish-list.html?src=wQvf_HApRX_ghFSWMb-FLA-1-2" target="_blank"><img class=" wp-image-1806 " title="how to work with architects " alt="how to work with architects " src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/11/shutterstock_94130386.jpg?w=560" width="504" height="335" /></a> Source: Shutter Stock[/caption]
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Here's how to work with your architect using a wish list when designing a home to create the living space you've always dreamed of:</p>

<ul>
	<li><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Think big. </b><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Every project starts with possibility, so here's your chance to go wild. Whether you're building an entire home or just remodeling a room, think about what your dream space would have. From the big picture to the tiniest details, don't overlook a thing. Make a list and compile an idea book with clips and images for inspiration; then give them both to your architect.</span></li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Narrow the scope.</b><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"> Once you’ve got your best-of-all-possible-worlds scenario, it's time to start thinking practically. Consider constraints like budget, space, and lifestyle, and whittle your dream list down to the absolute essentials. What can't you live without?</span></li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Let the architect work their magic.</b><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"> Clear communication with your architect is key. Confirm that your architect understands your desires, rather than pushing his or her own on you; then keep the conversation going as the architect creates plans and revises. This is called the “iterative” approach, and it should result in a plan that is exactly to your specifications.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">Contact us</a> at Gelotte Hommas Architecture for more information about our approach, or about how we can work together to build your dream home in Seattle.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>How Your Homesite Impacts Your Home Design</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/11/28/how-your-homesite-impacts-your-home-design/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 28 Nov 2013 21:34:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1795</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[caption id="attachment_1801" align="alignright" width="392"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/11/anacortes-project-gelotte-hommas.png"><img class=" wp-image-1801 " title="anacortes project Gelotte Hommas" alt="anacortes project Gelotte Hommas" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/11/anacortes-project-gelotte-hommas.png" width="392" height="304" /></a> Source: Gelotte Hommas[/caption]
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Selecting a design for your new home and finalizing the plans is an exciting prospect. However, a suitable homesite is as important as the <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/09/20/home-for-a-lifetime-creating-a-home-for-all-stages-in-life" target="_blank">prospective design</a>. Selecting an incompatible site for your new home can impact your plans in ways you never imagined. A bit of homework beforehand will ensure you enjoy your new home for years to come.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">The lot size has the most obvious and immediate impact on home design. Make sure the lot you choose is suitable for your home plans. Your new home should not dwarf its surroundings. It should fit in well. This includes making sure the design style blends with other homes in the area as well. You probably would not want to build an ultra-modern home in a neighborhood of Craftsman style homes.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Another consideration is the zoning regulations of your potential homesite. Certain areas have stipulations on what type of home can be built. In addition, some zoning regulations may impose unwanted restrictions on your allowable use of the property. Eliminate surprises by researching first.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">If you are not building in a pre-planned subdivision where viability has already been predetermined, the <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/07/12/architecture-inspired-by-nature" target="_blank">topography of the land</a> on your future homesite may impact and/or limit your design choices. The quality of soil, drainage, slope of the land, rocks, trees, and other natural land characteristics can inflate building costs or make building your new home cost prohibitive altogether. The architectural firm or builder you have chosen can help assess the feasibility of your homesite selection.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">If you are in the process of designing a new home, we can help ensure the process will be an enjoyable experience. <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com" target="_blank">Contact us</a>, Gelotte Hommas, for guidance on designing a home you will cherish forever.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The Appeal of Modern Architecture</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/11/30/the-appeal-of-modern-architecture/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 30 Nov 2013 19:34:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1797</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[caption id="attachment_1803" align="alignright" width="392"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/11/clyde-hill-project-gelotte-hommas.png"><img class=" wp-image-1803 " title="Clyde Hill Project Gelotte Hommas" alt="Clyde Hill Project Gelotte Hommas" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/11/clyde-hill-project-gelotte-hommas.png" width="392" height="304" /></a> Source: Gelotte Hommas[/caption]<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">What do you think of when you hear the words, "modern architecture"? For many, modern architecture evokes images of museum-like spaces without much warmth, instead of a home made for happy times and laughter. It doesn't have to be that way. <a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/7406856/list/Discover-Modern-Architecture-s-Appeal" target="_blank">Modern architecture</a> can inspire living spaces which hold a great appeal for everyone.</p><p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Modern architecture represents a snapshot of the materials and designs suited to the time in which the structure is built. The time period measured in the word "modern" has less to do with years than it does with the ways in which current technologies and methods of construction change lifestyles. These include the ways in which space is used in modern living, avoiding trends which don't suit both geographic area and lifestyle.</p><p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Today's times dictate open, bright spaces with wide windows and plenty of light. Bring the beautiful landscape into your home with the vast windows allowed by modern design. Floor plans have been simplified to remove extraneous rooms, and instead dedicated use of space to great rooms which allow kitchens, dining areas, and gathering areas to flow together. Gatherings and meals become closer and more social.</p><p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">While many architectural designs draw from both the past, and the <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/05/24/working-your-architectural-angles/" target="_blank">natural geometry</a> found in the world around us, modern architecture presents the opportunity to take a fresh view of how homes are planned. By eschewing trends in favor of creating a home which captures both the time and the desires of the ones planning it, a modern design leaves a tribute to imagination and originality while building a beautiful living space.</p><p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Learn more about how to incorporate modern architectural designs when planning your new Seattle home by contacting <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a>.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>7 Lucky Ways to Bring Some Asian Influence Into Your Home</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/12/10/7-lucky-ways-to-bring-some-asian-influence-into-your-home/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 10 Dec 2013 22:41:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1810</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">The Orient has always inspired a sense of mystery and refinement that is appealing to the adventurous soul. Whether you have a home in the Hamptons or in downtown Seattle, adding a little <a title="Asian influence in the home" href="http://www.architecturaldigest.com/decor/2013-12/oda-architecture-manhattan-duplex-penthouse-article" target="_blank">Asian influence</a> into your home is a fabulous decision. Here are some ways you can incorporate Asian influences when you are designing a home:</p>


[caption id="attachment_1815" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Asian_ambiance.html" target="_blank"><img class="size-full wp-image-1815 " title="asian inspired home design" alt="asian inspired home design" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/larege_3.png" width="490" height="380" /></a> Source: Gelotte Hommas's Portfolio[/caption]
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Keep things simple</b>. Asian design is all about maintaining a sense of openness and minimalism within the home. Rooms should be airy and unencumbered by excess furniture and decoration.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Allow natural light to illuminate your rooms</b>. The more windows and skylights you include in your design, the easier this will be to accomplish.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Incorporate bold and Asian themed works of art</b>. Large paintings, sculptures, and physical elements placed against a plain and simple background will stand out and draw attention.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Focus on organic themes.</b>  By utilizing gentle curves to contrast straight lines and edges, you'll create a natural flow to the home that reflects the natural beauty of the world outside.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Lay your home out according to the principles of <a title="Feng Shui in the home" href="http://www.chictip.com/design-tips/10-feng-shui-rules-you-should-follow" target="_blank">Feng Shui</a></b>. This means giving clear definition to each room and using the proper colors and design elements to create a relaxing and harmonious environment.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Use water liberally</b>. Water features such as small ponds and gently flowing fountains help create an ambiance that is conducive for <a title="Make your home comfortable" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/11/11/3-tips-to-make-your-home-happier/" target="_blank">relaxation and comfort</a>. Further, these elements make excellent pieces of conversation that will peak the curiosity of your guests.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Use the right materials</b>. Bamboo, paper, stone, and sand make excellent inclusions within any Asian themed home.</li>
</ul>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">When you are ready to begin the process of designing a home, contact the team at <a title="Contact us" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a>. We will be happy to bring your dream home to life.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The Difference Between Simpleness and Simplicity</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/12/13/the-difference-between-simpleness-and-simplicity/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 13 Dec 2013 20:41:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1812</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">When it comes to architectural style, <a title="Simplicity in the home" href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/9223498/list/Simplicity-vs--Simpleness-in-Architecture-----and-Why-You-Should-Care" target="_blank">simplicity is the greatest compliment</a> an architect can ever achieve. Simplicity doesn't mean simpleness, rather it is an effortless blending of architectural elements to create structure that is welcoming and inviting while still being interesting and engaging.</p>


[caption id="attachment_1818" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Casa_Del_Sol.html" target="_blank"><img class="size-full wp-image-1818 " title="simplicity vs simpleness" alt="simplicity vs simpleness" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/large_8.png" width="490" height="380" /></a> Source: Gelotte Hommas's Portfolio[/caption]
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Simpleness is easy to accomplish as it is uninspired and often just a combination of elements that appear to fit together but do not. Simplicity on the other hand requires crafting a delicate balance between each and every element of the home.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Here are some ways simplicity can be achieved when it comes time to design a home:</p>

<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Fill a need in a beautiful way.</b> By using geometry along with the right materials, architecture can be brought to life in a simple way that isn't overwhelming or distracting.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Use a minimum of decorations and features.</b> Extraneous add-on's and distracting decorations take away from a structures aesthetic appearance. If it isn't essential to the aesthetic or the function of the structure, then it should be discarded without a second thought.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Connect the home to the landscape.</b> For simplicity to be achieved, a home must blend in with the landscaping that surrounds it. When done correctly, there is a seamless transition and bond between the two that can never be broken.</li>
</ul>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">To discuss the right architectural style for your next home design project, contact the award winning team at <a title="Contact us" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a>. We would be happy to sit down with you and help you design the perfect place for you to call home.</p>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>asian inspired home design</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/12/10/7-lucky-ways-to-bring-some-asian-influence-into-your-home/larege_3-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 10 Dec 2013 21:02:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>

	<item>
		<title>Architecture Trends: Ideas for Craftsman Style Homes</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/12/15/architecture-trends-ideas-for-craftsman-style-homes/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 15 Dec 2013 21:18:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1825</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><a title="Craftsman Homes" href="http://www.bhg.com/home-improvement/exteriors/curb-appeal/craftsman-style-home-ideas/#page=1" target="_blank">Craftsman-Style homes</a> are embellished with plenty of details and features that make them truly unique within the world of architecture. Their sometimes intricate adornments make them stand out from the crowd and it is for that reason that Craftsman homes are among the <a title="Trends and styles" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/01/04/top-custom-home-design-trends-for-2012/" target="_blank">most popular styles</a> in the Washington area. While architecture trends come and go, this style has proven its staying power.</p>


[caption id="attachment_1838" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/completed/The_Urban_Lodge.html" target="_blank"><img class="size-full wp-image-1838 " title="craftsman homes near Seattle" alt="craftsman homes near Seattle" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/large_1.png" width="490" height="380" /></a> Source: Gelotte Hommas' Portfolio[/caption]
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Craftsman homes feature broad proportions with deep eaves and sometimes exposed brackets and structural elements such as rafters and beams. The homes can be one-story or multi-story, and they are often painted in darker tones such as grays and greens.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Among the most common features you will find in a Craftsman home, the following give the structure its unique style and sense of flair:</p>

<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Upstairs Dormers </b>- These sprout from the roof and provide a fabulous vantage point from which to view the outside world.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Porches with distinctive roof lines</b> - A central element to almost every Craftsman home is the porch. Often, these are accented by simple, square pillars.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Bric-a-brac</b> - No Craftsman home is complete without a little embellishment. Window boxes, shake shingles, and decorative windows are the fine details homeowners use to give their homes a unique sense of personality and style.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Superb landscaping</b> - As with all architecture trends, it's imperative to make sure the home fits well within the landscape. Craftsman homeowners are experts at employing bushes, shrubs, planter boxes, and other features around their homes for this purpose.</li>
</ul>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">For more information about the latest architecture trends,<a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank"> contact us</a> at Gelotte Hommas Architecture. Our team would be happy to answer your questions and offer you our award winning services.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>professional architectures in seattle</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/12/20/get-to-know-the-architects-toolbox-using-scale/shutterstock_91332494-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 13 Dec 2013 20:34:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/shutterstock_913324941.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[professional architectures in seattle]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1833</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2013-12-13 12:34:10</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2013-12-13 20:34:10</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>shutterstock_91332494-2</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>inherit</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>1823</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>attachment</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:attachment_url>https://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/shutterstock_913324941.jpg</wp:attachment_url>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_wp_attached_file</wp:meta_key>

		<title>craftsman home style in Seattle</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/12/15/architecture-trends-ideas-for-craftsman-style-homes/large_1-9/</link>

	<item>
		<title>Home Design Ideas: Wooden Slats</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/12/17/home-design-ideas-wooden-slats/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 17 Dec 2013 18:23:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1821</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Few elements in the home are as standard or common as wood. Its strength and ease of use make it a standard building material that architects and builders rely on. Of course, it's also quite beautiful and it can be used to enhance the appearance of your home. That's why when we are designing a home we like to <a title="Using exposed wood" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/01/11/using-exposed-wood-in-your-home/" target="_blank">bring wood out</a> from behind the walls and allow it to be seen and enjoyed.</p>

<div><a href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/701608/Hillcrest-Farm-contemporary-bathroom-seattle" target="_blank"><img class="aligncenter" style="border:0;" title="using wood slats" alt="using wood slats" src="http://st.houzz.com/simgs/824124670f6a41b2_8-9485/contemporary-bathroom.jpg" width="500" height="332" border="0" /></a></div>
<div style="color:#444444;text-align:center;"><small><a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/contemporary/bathroom">Contemporary Bathroom</a> by <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/professionals/architect/c/Bellevue--WA">Bellevue Architects &amp; Designers</a> <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/pro/gelottehommas/gelotte-hommas-architecture">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a> via Houzz</small></div>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">One of the best ways to do this is to <a title="Using wooden slats" href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/464624/list/Wood-Slats-in-Design--Repetition--Scale-and-Light" target="_blank">incorporate wooden slats</a> into your design. Slats of all sizes can be used along walls to allow the passage of light and air into the home, or they can be used to create enclosures that provide a sense of security and privacy. The secret to accomplishing either is to determine the proper amount of space you want between the slats.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Another interesting way you can incorporate wooden slats into a home design is to use it as a ceiling cover. By interspersing light and dark colored slats, you can create a pattern along the ceiling that gives your rooms definition and an eclectic sense of style. When combined with other natural elements such as stone, glass, and steel, the results are truly stunning.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Ultimately, whether you lay your slats down horizontally or vertically, make sure they follow the natural lines of the home. This will help them blend in with the structure. The end result will be a home with a refined and contemporary appearance that people will notice and admire.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Be sure to contact the team at <a title="Contact us" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas</a> before you begin the process of designing a home. Our expert architects can help you bring your dream home to life.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Get to Know the Architect&#039;s Toolbox: Using Scale</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/12/20/get-to-know-the-architects-toolbox-using-scale/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 20 Dec 2013 23:00:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1823</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><a title="Using scale and proportion" href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/695603/list/Architect-s-Toolbox--Scale-and-Proportion" target="_blank">Scale and proportion</a> are among the most important tools architects use when designing a home. When used correctly, these calculations are used to create a structure that relates to the natural landscape and to the people that will utilize and enjoy it.</p>


[caption id="attachment_1832" align="aligncenter" width="400"]<a href="http://www.shutterstock.com/pic-91332494/stock-photo-compass-tools-set.html?src=7fHgUBxUT4jQEf_2fIAXfw-1-6" target="_blank"><img class=" wp-image-1832 " title="professional architectures in seattle" alt="professional architectures in seattle" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/shutterstock_91332494.jpg" width="400" height="400" /></a> Source: Shutter Stock[/caption]
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">At the heart of the calculation is what is referred to as the "<a title="What is the golden ratio?" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_ratio" target="_blank">golden ratio</a>." This mathematical equation is used to create structures that are aesthetically pleasing and can be seen in structures ranging from the Parthenon to the houses that dot the American landscape. Ultimately, this ratio is used to determine the proper sized features and accessories for a home so that when completed everything comes together as a complete package rather than as a series of individual elements.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Naturally, scale and proportion are also used to draw attention to various elements of a home. Features such as grand fireplaces, <a title="Scaling your ceilings" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2011/11/22/give-your-high-ceiling-a-smaller-scale/" target="_blank">high ceilings</a>, sharp roof lines, and floor to ceiling windows can provide a connection to the natural landscape that is simply stunning. As long as the proper scale is used, the home will appear to simply spring forth from the building site.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Finally, scale is also used to trick the eyes and the senses by making open spaces feel smaller, and by making closed spaces feel larger. The end result being that regardless of the size of the home, considering "human scale" creates a structure that people can relate to and feel comfortable within.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Designing a home for the first or tenth time is always a challenge. Gelotte Hommas Architecture has the skills and experience needed to make your design visions a reality and we encourage you to <a title="Contact us" href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">contact us</a> today to learn more about our services and how we can assist you.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Utilizing Transparency to Connect to the Outdoors</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/12/23/utilizing-transparency-to-connect-to-the-outdoors/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Dec 2013 23:00:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1841</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">When you live in a home surrounded by inspiring outdoor views, there’s no need to shut them out once you’re inside. You can make the most of those stunning views by incorporating transparency in your home’s design.</p>


[caption id="attachment_1848" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Lakefront_Splendor.html" target="_blank"><img class="size-full wp-image-1848 " title="transparency in the home" alt="transparency in the home" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/large_4.png" width="490" height="380" /></a> Source: Gelotte Hommas' Portfolio[/caption]
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/4391826/list/Houzz-Tour--Transparency-Guides-a-Woodland-Home" target="_blank">Architecture trends</a> that focus on transparency provide homeowners with a chance to feel as though they’re connected to their natural surroundings. The main aspect of this kind of design involves having several windows, especially larger ones, to maximize views of the outdoors and let in as much natural light as possible.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">This can even be done in rooms where a higher level of privacy is desired, such as bedrooms and bathrooms. Having attractive shades or blinds installed allows the homeowner to shut out the outdoors whenever they want.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">The interior design used can also add to the transparent effect. This can be accomplished by using decorative glass to separate rooms, instead of standard walls and doors, which makes the home seem more open and airy as well.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">With homes with woodland surroundings, going with a wood-themed design indoors also enhances the feeling of being part of the outdoors. These are just a few of the ways in which architecture can be used to create a harmonic blend between a home's interior and external environment.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Are you interested in using transparency and other architecture trends to connect your home with your surroundings? Contact <a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/Contact.html" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a> to set up a consultation today.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Building in a Fireplace? Add a Stylish Wood Storage Space</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/12/26/building-in-a-fireplace-add-a-stylish-wood-storage-space/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 26 Dec 2013 21:17:51 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1843</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Adding a fireplace to your home is a wonderful way to add warmth and comfort to it, but you have to think about where you’ll store your firewood. If you would rather not have to make a trip out to the yard in the cold to gather a few logs, consider having <a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/4327237/list/Stylish-Wood-Storage-for-Contemporary-Spaces" target="_blank">wood storage</a> built inside.</p>


[caption id="attachment_1851" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Cedar_Haven.html" target="_blank"><img class="size-full wp-image-1851 " title="fire wood storage inside the house" alt="fire wood storage inside the house" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/large_6.png" width="490" height="380" /></a> Source: Gelotte Hommas's Blog[/caption]
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">When designing a home, convenience is as much of a factor as physical appearance. Having a place to store firewood inside certainly makes it easier to get a fire going, and it can also add an attractive element to your home. There are several options available for wood storage, including:</p>

<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Stacking logs in a rough and irregular pile next to the fireplace, which adds some texture to a room with an austere and symmetrical design.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Having a niche built off to the side for an inset fireplace, which keeps the logs from interfering with the view.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Building a floor to ceiling niche for firewood, which adds visual interest to an otherwise minimalist room.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Creating symmetry by having a niche for logs built on either side of the fireplace.</li>
</ul>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Keep in mind that you can also have wood storage niches built for fire pits or outdoor fireplaces, instead of stacking them up behind the shed.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Need professional assistance designing a home that includes wood storage? <a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/Contact.html" target="_blank">Contact us</a> at Gelotte Hommas Architecture to discuss your project, and see how our experts can help you achieve your goal.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Three Architect&#039;s Tools to Add Dimension to a Home</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/12/30/three-architects-tools-to-add-dimension-to-a-home/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Dec 2013 17:12:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1845</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Adding dimension can make a home seem larger and create visual appeal that boosts its value. A few of the latest <a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/2227649/list/18-Winners-from-the-Architect-s-Toolbox" target="_blank">architecture trends</a> provide simple yet effective methods for achieving this look.</p>


[caption id="attachment_1856" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/large_81.png" target="_blank"><img class="size-full wp-image-1856  " title="adding dimension to a home" alt="adding dimension to a home" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/large_81.png" width="490" height="380" /></a> Source: Gelotte Hommas's Portfolio[/caption]
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">These trends include:</p>

<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Paying close attention to scale and proportion</b>: This might seem basic, but it can be overlooked, leading to rooms or other elements of a home that are poorly proportioned. For example, you could end up with doorways that are too narrow or windows that are too large.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Creating in-between spaces</b>: One good way to add dimension to a home is by making use of empty space that lies between two areas. For example, adding a deck on the side of a house that overlooks a gorgeous view bridges the gap between these two spaces.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Adding a vestibule</b>: You might associate these with older homes, but you can have a vestibule added to a more modern home. This space provides an area for residents and guests to take off their shoes and remove their coats before entering the main part of the house.</li>
</ul>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">At <a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/Design.html" target="_blank">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a>, we specialize in using the latest architecture trends and design elements to create a home that’s a work of art. Adding dimension is just one example of the types of services we offer.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Ready to discuss your home design project? <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">Contact us</a> at Gelotte Hommas Architecture to schedule a consultation and see how our experts can help add dimension to your dream home.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>GHA 2013 holiday goodies</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/12/23/gha-2013-holiday-goodies/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Dec 2013 21:56:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.gelottehommas.com/?p=1859</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The Holidays are a big deal around here, and we spend many hours planning and preparing for our annual cards and gifts. Last year we came up with the GHA desktop calendar as a way to give a thoughtful gift that would last a bit longer through the year, and this year we took it to another level.
<p style="text-align:center;"><a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/gha_calendar_web_ready.jpg"><img class="wp-image-1864 aligncenter" alt="Gelotte Hommas Desktop Calendar" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/gha_calendar_web_ready.jpg" width="368" height="523" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align:center;"><img class="aligncenter" alt="Gelotte Hommas Desktop Calendar" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/web_ready_gha_calendar.jpg" width="368" height="523" /></p>
The base for the calendars was wooden last year, but this year we designed a base from the GHA logo and had some custom silicone bases fabricated.
After that we poured the concrete and let it set.

<img class="size-large wp-image-1863 aligncenter" alt="3d Rendering" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/3d-rendering.jpg?w=560" width="560" height="373" />

<span style="line-height:1.5em;">The 2013 GHA holiday cards are more interactive than they have ever been before.</span>

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/img_1199.jpg"><img class="size-large wp-image-1862 aligncenter" alt="IMG_1199" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/img_1199.jpg?w=560" width="560" height="560" /></a>

We knew the over all theme of the card was going to be blue prints for the sled, but then we wondered if there was a way to bring out of the 2d into 3d. That's where it got fun!
We knew we wanted it to be out of a material that was light enough to mail with our cards, but sturdy enough to maintain the shape. Bass wood would be perfect, and that's where Scott Younger took our idea and ran with it. He is the owner of <a href="http://www.alliancepackaging.net/">Alliance Packaging</a> and the gentleman who works with us every year to manufacture our cardboard playhouses.  We brought the design to him and asked if it could be done, and he did the rest. 800 laser cut sleds later, I think he *might* have regretted his decision. They look great Scott! Great job to Alliance on these.

<a href="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/img_1197.jpg"><img class="size-large wp-image-1861 aligncenter" alt="Gelotte Hommas Architecture laser cut sleds" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/img_1197.jpg?w=560" width="560" height="749" /></a>
If you have received a card or gift this year, leave us a comment. We would love to know what you think! <img class="wp-image-1860 aligncenter" alt="IMG_0054" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/12/img_0054.jpg?w=560" width="336" height="251" />Happy Holidays everyone, from all of us at Gelotte Hommas Architecture.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>gha-2013-holiday-goodies</wp:post_name>

	<item>
		<title>vernacular style architecture</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2014/01/10/getting-in-touch-with-the-vernacular-style/hommas/</link>

	<item>
		<title>Architectural Design Inspiration: Soaring Cantilevers</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2014/01/07/architectural-design-inspiration-soaring-cantilevers/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 07 Jan 2014 23:49:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1872</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">When it comes to drama, no architectural feat will ever outdo the cantilever. Anchored only at one end, the cantilever appears to defy gravity as it juts out from the main structure of a building, appearing to hover in mid-air. As with many architecture trends, cantilevers are more than just a source of beauty, they also serve important <a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/337580/list/Daring-Cantilevers--Architecture-Takes-Flight" target="_blank">functions</a> in building design.</p>


[caption id="attachment_1881" align="aligncenter" width="343"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/High%20_Above_the_Water.html" target="_blank"><img class=" wp-image-1881 " title="implementing" alt="implementing Cantilevers" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2014/01/large_6.png" width="343" height="266" /></a> Source: Gelotte Hommas[/caption]
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><strong>Add Dimension</strong>. Besides creating visual interest, <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2013/12/30/three-architects-tools-to-add-dimension-to-a-home/" target="_blank">adding dimension</a> can also make a structure appear larger and contribute to the overall value of the project. Cantilevers break up long, straight walls from the outside and make a building feel expansive from the inside.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><strong>Utilize Outdoor Space</strong>. By raising portions of the structure off the ground without intrusive supports, outdoor space becomes more open and useable. Similarly, if outdoor space is very unusable - perhaps a steep hill or jutting boulders - a cantilever can be extended over the area and not only provide extra usable space, but often a spectacular view from the cantilevered room as well.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><strong>Define Spaces</strong>. A cantilevered second-floor room can define the sitting area of a patio below. The bottom of the cantilever becomes the "ceiling" of the patio and the shadow created contributes to the illusion of a boundary while providing shade from the sun.</li>
</ul>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">At Gelotte Hommas Architecture, we specialize in combining the functional needs of each project with dramatic and interesting effects for our clients. <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">Contact us</a> today to see how we can create a true work of art for you.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>How to Make Architecture Efficient</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2014/01/13/how-to-make-architecture-efficient/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 13 Jan 2014 21:30:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1874</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Efficiency is a popular idea in construction and design, although it is usually attached to energy and how to use less of it. Architecture trends, however, have plenty of room to accommodate <a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/Design.html" target="_blank">design</a> efficiency - especially in terms of space and materials. Here are some ways to incorporate <a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/15794932/list/Efficient-Architecture-Suggests-a-New-Future-for-Design" target="_blank">efficiency into architecture</a> and achieve great results.</p>


[caption id="attachment_1886" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Villa_at_San_Sebastian.html" target="_blank"><img class="size-full wp-image-1886 " title="efficiency in architecture" alt="efficiency in architecture" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2014/01/hommas1.png" width="490" height="380" /></a> Source: Gelotte Hommas[/caption]
<ul>
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><strong>Think "Tract House"</strong>. Don't cringe yet - tract house doesn't have to mean "plain and unoriginal". The idea is to apply the method of construction while still creating beautiful designs. Using standard construction methods such as 2-by-6 frames, trussed roofs, and taking advantage of prefabricated components means that construction can move quickly and efficiently and carpenters have fewer plans to learn.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><strong>Shrinking Square Footage</strong>. Homes in America have been growing and growing in size over the last several decades of the 20th century and into the 21st century. However, the economic climate over the last several years combined with a focus on energy efficiency has led to a revival of the small home. Skilled architects can create open, airy, and comfortable homes that echo the mid-century concepts of simplicity and minimalism and use a fraction of the square footage used in the McMansions of the 1990s.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><strong>Finish For Less</strong>. High-end finishes used to be a must-have: a new kitchen without stainless steel and granite was unthinkable ten years ago. Today's finishes are more creative, flexible, and budget-friendly and when paired with good design they are just as beautiful. Shop around for materials and negotiate for deals.</li>
</ul>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Incorporating efficiency is one of many architecture trends that will continue to be in the forefront of design. To learn how Gelotte Hommas can incoporate efficient designs in your next project, <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">contact us</a>.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Getting In Touch With the Vernacular Style</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2014/01/10/getting-in-touch-with-the-vernacular-style/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 10 Jan 2014 20:49:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1876</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Hearing about the local vernacular when it comes to language is probably familiar to most people. Discussing a region's vernacular architecture style, however, may be less common although the idea is the same. A vernacular architecture style is one that is native to an area and its people. It often has functional elements that are necessary for the local climate, and decorative aspects that are <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2012/07/12/architecture-inspired-by-nature/" target="_blank">inspired by nature</a>.</p>


[caption id="attachment_1884" align="aligncenter" width="490"]<a href="http://gelottehommas.com/completed/Kirkland_Bungalow.html"><img class="size-full wp-image-1884" alt="vernacular style architecturevernacular style architecture" src="http://gelottehommasblog.files.wordpress.com/2014/01/hommas.png" width="490" height="380" /></a> Source: Gelotte Hommas' Portfolio[/caption]
<h2 style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);text-decoration:underline;">Examples of Vernacular Architecture</span></h2>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Because vernacular style is dependent on the location, it can be difficult to truly define. The best way to understand it is by example so we've <a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/12164610/list/Vernacular-Design--Architecture-s-Regional-Voices" target="_blank">collected a few</a>:</p>

<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Scandinavian design often incorporates white walls. This was done to help brighten the home during long, dark winters and now the design element is part of the area's vernacular.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Adobe homes are perfectly at home in the Southwest landscape. The earthen textures and colors make the structures feel like they grew on the hillside with bright colors added to showcase important elements.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Steeply pitched roofs, end gables, and a simple cottage look serve an important function of these types of homes in the Northeast. The roofs are pitched to keep snow off, and the low and long shape of the home keeps wind from causing damage. Over time, these functional homes became part of the landscape and define the architecture style of the area.</li>
</ul>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">What area's vernacular speaks to you? To learn how Gelotte Hommas Architecture can help you incorporate the local vernacular, or elements of a more exotic vernacular, into your home, <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">contact us</a> today.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="seattle-architects"><![CDATA[Seattle architects]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="seattle-area-custom-design-firm"><![CDATA[Seattle-area custom design firm]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="vernacular-style"><![CDATA[vernacular style]]></category>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[30256825]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>

	<item>
		<title>Understanding Architecture Through Music</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2014/01/16/understanding-architecture-through-music/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 16 Jan 2014 18:20:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1878</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Sometimes the best way to truly understand one art form is through the words of another. Even though the finished work doesn't move, architecture trends still retain a rhythm, a beat, a tone, and a style. Understanding <a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/2552045/list/Tune-In-to-the-Music-of-Architecture" target="_blank">architecture through music</a> is natural and applying musical terms to architectural ideas brings greater understanding to both art forms.</p>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Here are some various overlaps in music and <a href="http://gelottehommas.com/" target="_blank">architecture in Seattle</a>:</p>

<ul>
	<li><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Dolce</b><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">. In music, this term lets the musician know to play delicately and with a light touch. In architecture it refers to the intricate details and the craftsmanship required to create delicate but powerful details.</span></li>
</ul>
<div><a href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/379549/Our-top-20-favorite-fireplaces-modern-family-room-seattle" target="_blank"><img class="aligncenter" style="border:0;" title="using dolce in architecture" alt="using dolce in architecture" src="http://st.houzz.com/simgs/7b4132570ed3c979_8-8443/modern-family-room.jpg" width="500" height="374" border="0" /></a></div>
<div style="color:#444444;text-align:center;"><small><a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/modern/family-room">Modern Family Room</a> by <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/professionals/architect/c/Bellevue--WA">Bellevue Architects &amp; Designers</a> <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/pro/gelottehommas/gelotte-hommas-architecture">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a> via Houzz (Dolce)
</small></div>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Ma non troppo</b>. Literally stated, this means "not too much". In music it is added with another direction to mean not to go too far. So to play "allegro ma non troppo" means to play fast, but not too fast. Architecture trends often reflect this idea whenever restraint is used and a "less is more" approach is taken.</li>
</ul>
<div><a href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/4577825/Fallen-Maples-contemporary-exterior-seattle" target="_blank"><img class="aligncenter" style="border:0;" title="incoporating Ma Non Troppo in architecture " alt="incoporating Ma Non Troppo in architecture " src="http://st.houzz.com/simgs/ecf1096a01d6f9b9_8-3132/contemporary-exterior.jpg" width="500" height="336" border="0" /></a></div>
<div style="color:#444444;text-align:center;"><small><a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/contemporary/exterior">Contemporary Exterior</a> by <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/professionals/architect/c/Bellevue--WA">Bellevue Architects &amp; Designers</a> <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/pro/gelottehommas/gelotte-hommas-architecture">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a> via Houzz (Ma Non Troppo)</small></div>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Sforzando</b><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">. Loud and strong. Music that is played sforzando is meant to be heard, it is played with force and is aggressively seeking attention. Architectural features that are sforzando are similarly aggressive - sharp angles, contrasting colors or textures - elements that are designed to stand out and stand alone.</span></li>
</ul>
<div><a href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/543856/A-storybook-cottage-by-Gelotte-Hommas-Architecture-eclectic-living-room-seattle" target="_blank"><img class="aligncenter" style="border:0;" title="using Sforzando in architecture" alt="using Sforzando in architecture" src="http://st.houzz.com/simgs/28e16c590f315e02_8-9409/eclectic-living-room.jpg" width="500" height="334" border="0" /></a></div>
<div style="color:#444444;text-align:center;"><small><a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/eclectic/living-room">Eclectic Living Room</a> by <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/professionals/architect/c/Bellevue--WA">Bellevue Architects &amp; Designers</a> <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/pro/gelottehommas/gelotte-hommas-architecture">Gelotte Hommas Architecturevia Houzz</a> (Sforzando) </small></div>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Vivace</b>. Lively and upbeat, it is easy to imagine music that is vivace. Light notes, higher tones, skipping along in a quick tempo. Architecture that is vivace is similarly busy and light. There may be several complimentary elements throughout one space, many different spaces that are connected, or lots of interesting objects and focal points to keep the eye and the mind busy.</li>
</ul>
<div><a href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/379548/Our-top-20-favorite-fireplaces-modern-family-room-seattle" target="_blank"><img class="aligncenter" style="border:0;" title="using Vivace in architecture" alt="using Vivace in architecture" src="http://st.houzz.com/simgs/c591aee00ed3c978_8-8441/modern-family-room.jpg" width="500" height="400" border="0" /></a></div>
<div style="color:#444444;text-align:center;"><small><a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/modern/family-room">Modern Family Room</a> by <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/professionals/architect/c/Bellevue--WA">Bellevue Architects &amp; Designers</a> <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/pro/gelottehommas/gelotte-hommas-architecture">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a> via Houzz (<b>Vivace)</b></small></div>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Gelotte Hommas has been bringing art to architecture for more than 30 years. To find out how to incorporate some of these musical notes into your next project, <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">contact us</a> today.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Home Design Considerations: Light or Dark Wood?</title>
		<link>http://blog.gelottehommas.com/2014/01/20/home-design-considerations-light-or-dark-wood/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Jan 2014 20:21:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>gelottehommas</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://gelottehommasblog.wordpress.com/?p=1893</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">You're <a href="http://www.gelottehommas.com/Completed.html" target="_blank">designing a home</a>, and you've decided that you love the look of wood. Should you go with light or dark wood? This is a common question that comes up, and there is no correct answer. Both <a href="http://www.houzz.com/ideabooks/261064/list/Light-Wood-vs-Dark-Wood" target="_blank">light and dark wood have their merits</a> and drawbacks, and you must consider these carefully when making your choice.</p>

<div><a href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/95970/Home-Office-of-Cedar-Haven-Home--home-office-other-metro" target="_blank"><img class="aligncenter" style="border:0;" title="contrast light and dark wood " alt="contrast light and dark wood " src="http://st.houzz.com/simgs/5ed1bb570d10f376_8-7127/-home-office.jpg" width="500" height="372" border="0" /></a></div>
<div style="color:#444444;text-align:center;"><small><a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/photos/home-office">Home Office</a> by <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/professionals/architect/c/Bellevue--WA">Bellevue Architects &amp; Designers</a> <a style="text-decoration:none;color:#444;" href="http://www.houzz.com/pro/gelottehommas/gelotte-hommas-architecture">Gelotte Hommas Architecture</a> via Houzz</small></div>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Dark Wood</b></p>

<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Dark wood is great for creating a rustic look, especially when it's used for floors. Pair dark wood with neutral colored walls to create a timeless look. If you use textured decor, it intensifies the look.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Dark wood holds its color better than light wood, meaning that it's the same color after 15 years as it was when you first installed it.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">A downfall of dark wood is that it shows dings more easily than light wood. You may have to touch these up with stain or a wood pen.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Dark wood also tends to make small rooms seem smaller, thus it's not usually the best choice in smaller dens, hallways or bedrooms.</li>
</ul>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);"><b style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Light Wood</b></p>

<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Light wood creates a beautiful contrast when paired with dark-colored walls. This is a more modern look than the look created with dark wood.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">An advantage to light wood is that it does not show dings and dents easily.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Light wood is less prone to fading in sunlight than dark wood, making it a good choice in rooms with lots of sunlight.</li>
</ul>
<ul style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">
	<li style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Light wood sometimes darkens with age, meaning that it may be darker in 15 years than it is when you install it.</li>
</ul>
<p style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);">Are you in the process of designing a home? We would be happy to help you make it the home of your dreams. <a href="http://blog.gelottehommas.com/contact-us/" target="_blank">Contact us</a> at Gelotte Hommas Architecture to learn more about our interior and exterior design services.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
